revision.text: {{Old AfD multi| date = 23 March 2011 (UTC) | result = '''keep''' | page = List of bean-to-bar chocolate manufacturers }} {{WikiProjectBannerShell|1= {{WikiProject Food and drink|class=List|importance=low}} {{WikiProject Brands|class=List|importance=low}} {{WikiProject Lists|class=list|importance=Low}} {{WikiProject Companies|class=|importance=}} }} {{archives |archivelist = /archivelist |auto = short |index = |search = yes |list = |collapsible = yes |collapsed = no |style = |bot = MiszaBot |age = thirty days }} {{User:MiszaBot/config |archiveheader = {{aan}} |maxarchivesize = 70k |counter = 1 |minthreadsleft = 2 |minthreadstoarchive = 1 |algo = old(30d) |archive = User talk:List of bean-to-bar chocolate manufacturers/Archive %(counter)d }} == Semi-protected edit request on 23 April 2015 == {{edit semi-protected|List of bean-to-bar chocolate manufacturers|answered=yes}} Company: Nibble Chocolate Location: USA, San Diego CA Year Found: 2013 Products: Single Origin Chocolate Bars Webiste: www.nibblechocolate.com Notes: Certified Organic single origin bean to bar chocolate maker in San Diego CA. Chocolate made with only two ingredients. [[User:Davidmejiadiago|Davidmejiadiago]] ([[User talk:Davidmejiadiago|talk]]) 18:03, 23 April 2015 (UTC) :[[File:Red information icon with gradient background.svg|20px|link=]] '''Not done:''' I don't see a Wikipedia article for this company. Companies on this list must have an [[WP:WTAF|article already written]] and [[WP:RS|reliable sources]] to support inclusion. --'''[[User talk:ElHef|ElHef]]''' ([[Special:Contributions/ElHef|Meep?]]) 18:39, 23 April 2015 (UTC) == Semi-protected edit request on 8 May 2015 == {{edit semi-protected|List of bean-to-bar chocolate manufacturers|answered=yes}} Please add Samaritan Xocolata Costa Rica to your list of bean to bar chocolate manufacturers. www.samaritanxocolata.com [[User:Samaritanxocolata|Samaritanxocolata]] ([[User talk:Samaritanxocolata|talk]]) 21:31, 8 May 2015 (UTC) :[[File:Red information icon with gradient background.svg|20px|link=]] '''Not done:''' Company is [[WP:N|not notable]]. --I am [[User:K6ka|'''k6ka''']] [[User talk:K6ka|Talk to me!]] [[Special:Contributions/K6ka|See what I have done]] 22:16, 8 May 2015 (UTC) Can we re-open this discustion? — Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[User:Chocolunatic|Chocolunatic]] ([[User talk:Chocolunatic#top|talk]] • [[Special:Contributions/Chocolunatic|contribs]]) 13:05, 26 March 2018 (UTC) :No. [[WP:WRITETHEARTICLEFIRST]] [[User:Meters|Meters]] ([[User talk:Meters|talk]]) 18:00, 26 March 2018 (UTC) == Semi-protected edit request on 30 December 2015 == {{edit semi-protected|List of bean-to-bar chocolate manufacturers|answered=y}} Addition of Claudio Corallo, a bean-to-bar chocolate producer situated on Sao Tome & Principé / Africa, website claudiocorallo.com. He has his own plantation of cocoa trees and only transforms himself the harvest of his own plantations (no bought-in beans) into chocolate. He works organic, fair-trade & sustainable, and the product is 100% handmade. Thank you for giving me the possibility to add him in the list. [[User:BirdZen|BirdZen]] ([[User talk:BirdZen|talk]]) 14:18, 30 December 2015 (UTC) {{Not done}} as we do not have an article on [[Claudio Corallo]] - as it says at the top of the edit page {{editnotice | header = Attention editors! | headerstyle = font-size: 150%; | text = Every entry in this list must have [[WP:WTAF|an article written]] and [[WP:RS|reliable sources]] to support inclusion, else it will be removed. | textstyle = font-size: 120%; | image = File:Nuvola apps important.svg | imagesize = 50px | expiry = indefinite }} So - no article = no inclusion - [[User:Arjayay|Arjayay]] ([[User talk:Arjayay|talk]]) 14:22, 30 December 2015 (UTC) Thhis an article that talk about Claudio Corallo as a tree-to-bar chocolate maker. https://elhedonista.es/gourmet/al-punto/claudio-corallo-el-chocolate-mas-puro-del-mundo-44036/ — Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[User:Chocolunatic|Chocolunatic]] ([[User talk:Chocolunatic#top|talk]] • [[Special:Contributions/Chocolunatic|contribs]]) 17:12, 26 March 2018 (UTC) :Again, see [[WP:WRITETHEARTICLEFIRST]] We have an article about the '''individual''' [[Claudio Corallo]], but not one about the chocolate or chocolate manufacturing company. [[User:Meters|Meters]] ([[User talk:Meters|talk]]) 18:04, 26 March 2018 (UTC) == Verkade == I found this page after doing some research into the topic of fair trade and bean-to-bar chocolate, however, I noticed that there is atleast one mistake. Namely that Verkade is not a bean-to-bar producer. Their chocolate does have the UTZ certification but that is about it. I tried to check, but could not find anything that points to Verkade using bean-to-bar production. Since this article is semi protected and I can't change it myself, I thought of dropping a line here. Hope this works. — Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[User:Mr Begeer|Mr Begeer]] ([[User talk:Mr Begeer#top|talk]] • [[Special:Contributions/Mr Begeer|contribs]]) 14:08, 14 April 2017 (UTC) :{{done}} Nothing in [[Verkade]] mentions them being a bean-bar manufacturer, and as far as a can see neither does their webpage. [[User:Meters|Meters]] ([[User talk:Meters|talk]]) 19:16, 14 April 2017 (UTC) == Semi-protected edit request on 18 April 2017 == {{edit semi-protected|List of bean-to-bar chocolate manufacturers|answered=yes}} [[User:Marclambart|Marclambart]] ([[User talk:Marclambart|talk]]) 09:29, 18 April 2017 (UTC) I would like to add to the list a Chocolate bean to bar from Vietnam : ALLUVIA Chocolate Hoa My Hamlet, Binh Ninh Ward, Cho Gao District, Tien Giang Province VIETNAM Start production 2013 Website : www.cacaoxralluvia.com :{{not done}} They do appear to be a bean-bar producer, but to be included in this list they must already have a Wikipedia article. If the company is notable please write the article first. [[User:Meters|Meters]] ([[User talk:Meters|talk]]) 17:11, 18 April 2017 (UTC) == Semi-protected edit request on 29 May 2017 == {{edit semi-protected|List of bean-to-bar chocolate manufacturers|answered=yes}}I would like to add to the list of bean-to-bar chocolate manufacturers from California. PHI KIND ORGANICS (www.phikind.com), USA (Santa Rosa, California), Founded 2016, Products: Organic Chocolate bars, discs and shiny, galaxy-like, silky smooth truffles, Notes: Traditionally inspired low-heat stone grinding process to alchemize chocolate with organic, zero-glycemic index sweeteners. Then tempering this liquid bliss to create bars, chips and truffles. All PKO products are Dairy, Gluten, GMO and Sugar FREE. :{{not done}} Do they have an article in Wikipedia? Cannot be entered until they have an article. Please point to it in that case, and we can add them to the list. -- [[User:Alexf|Alexf]][[User talk:Alexf|(talk)]] 21:29, 29 May 2017 (UTC) == Semi-protected edit request on 21 July 2017 == {{edit semi-protected|List of bean-to-bar chocolate manufacturers|answered=yes}} Please add Samaritan Xocolata, Costa Rica, to your Chocolate Makers list. for questions or more information: info@samaritanxocolata.com thank you. [[Special:Contributions/200.59.21.226|200.59.21.226]] ([[User talk:200.59.21.226|talk]]) 19:37, 21 July 2017 (UTC) :{{not done}}. This list is limited to manufacturers that have an existing Wikipedia article. [[User:Deli nk|Deli nk]] ([[User talk:Deli nk|talk]]) 19:51, 21 July 2017 (UTC) == External links modified == Hello fellow Wikipedians, I have just modified one external link on [[List of bean-to-bar chocolate manufacturers]]. Please take a moment to review [[special:diff/817529495|my edit]]. If you have any questions, or need the bot to ignore the links, or the page altogether, please visit [[User:Cyberpower678/FaQs#InternetArchiveBot|this simple FaQ]] for additional information. I made the following changes: *Added archive https://web.archive.org/web/20110614052730/http://www.academyofchocolate.org.uk/academy/awards.html to http://www.academyofchocolate.org.uk/academy/awards.html When you have finished reviewing my changes, you may follow the instructions on the template below to fix any issues with the URLs. {{sourcecheck|checked=false|needhelp=}} Cheers.—[[User:InternetArchiveBot|'''InternetArchiveBot''']] ([[User talk:InternetArchiveBot|Report bug]]) 00:16, 29 December 2017 (UTC)

revision.text: ==Your edits to [[Club Penguin]]== [[Image:Stop_hand.svg|left|30px]] You have recently vandalized {{{{{subst|}}}#if:Club Penguin|the Wikipedia article [[:Club Penguin]]|a Wikipedia article}}, and you are now being asked to '''stop''' this type of behavior. You're welcome to continue editing Wikipedia, so long as these edits are constructive. Please see Wikipedia's [[Wikipedia:Blocking policy|Blocking policy]] and [[Wikipedia:Vandalism|what constitutes vandalism]]; such actions are not tolerated on Wikipedia, and ''are not'' taken lightly. We hope that you will become a legitimate [[Wikipedia:Wikipedians|editor]]. Again, you are welcome here at Wikipedia, but remember not to vandalize or you will soon be ''[[Wikipedia:Blocking policy|blocked]]'' from editing. If you feel you have received this message in error, it may be because you are using a shared IP address. Nevertheless, repeated vandalism from this address may cause you to be included in any future sanctions such as temporary blocks or bans. To avoid confusion in the future, we invite you to [[Wikipedia:Username|create a user account]] of your own. Thank you,  [[User talk:Satori Son|Satori Son]] 19:49, 30 October 2006 (UTC)

{{Infobox figure skater |name= Roxana Luca |image= Roxana Luca 2005Euro.jpg |caption= Luca at the [[2005 European Figure Skating Championships|2005 European Championships]] |fullname= |altname= |country= [[Romania]] |birth_date= {{birth date and age|1982|12|23|df=y}} |birth_place= [[Bucharest]], Romania |hometown= |residence= |height= {{height|m=1.65}} |formercoach= [[Marius Negrea]], Alexandru Barbalau |formerchoreographer= Leonardo Azzola, Sandra Schaer, [[Pasquale Camerlengo]] |skating club= C.S. Forex Brasov |formertraininglocations= [[Flims]], [[Ravensburg]], [[Mannheim]], [[Oberstdorf]], [[Bucharest]], [[Milan]] |beganskating= 1987 |retired= 2009 |combined total= 121.22 |combined date= [[2005 European Figure Skating Championships|2005 Europeans]] |SP score= 42.57 |SP date= 2005 Europeans |FS score= 78.65 |FS date= 2005 Europeans }} '''Roxana Luca''' (born 23 December 1982) is a Romanian former competitive [[figure skater]]. She is a ten-time [[Romanian Figure Skating Championships|Romanian national]] champion and represented her country at two Olympics. She qualified for the free skate at the [[Figure skating at the 2002 Winter Olympics|2002 Winter Olympics]] in [[Salt Lake City]], four [[European Figure Skating Championships|European Championships]], and two [[World Junior Figure Skating Championships|World Junior Championships]]. Her best [[ISU Figure Skating Championships|ISU Championship]] result was 15th, which she achieved at the [[2002 World Junior Figure Skating Championships|2002 Junior Worlds]] and [[2005 European Figure Skating Championships|2005 Europeans]]. == Career == Luca made her senior international debut when she was 13 years old, placing 14th in her qualifying group at the [[1996 European Figure Skating Championships|1996 European Championships]]. She competed on both the junior and senior levels until the end of the 2001–02 season. Her best result in five appearances at the World Junior Championships was 15th in [[2002 World Junior Figure Skating Championships|2002]]. Luca was 23rd at the [[Figure skating at the 2002 Winter Olympics|2002 Winter Olympics]] in [[Salt Lake City]], [[Utah]], USA. She underwent knee surgery in September 2003 and missed the 2003–04 season as a result. Luca finished a career-best 15th at the [[2005 European Figure Skating Championships|2005 European Championships]]. A back injury caused her to withdraw from the [[2006 European Figure Skating Championships|2006 European Championships]] during the short program. She placed 26th at her [[Figure skating at the 2006 Winter Olympics|second Olympics]] in Turin. == Programs == {|class=wikitable style=text-align:center ! Season ! <center>==More Information== Hello, and welcome to Wikipedia, specifically my userpage. I am a relatively infrequent editor on Wikipedia, only editing articles that I possess personal knowlege of or have an interest in.
Some of my work on Wikipedia involves patrolling [[Special:Recentchanges|Recent Changes]] for vandalism nowadays. The rest either involves improving pages under the jurisdiction of one of my [[Wikipedia:Wikiprojects|WikiProjects]] or just editing where I see fit.
Please feel free to leave a note on my talk page for any reason. Have a nice day! The next time you have an rv dispute with me it would be better for you to sign my talk page. I would be happy to discuss it there. Vandalizing one's page is usually not a smart thing to do. As far as the edit, Wikipedia's articles always must maintain an '''NPOV''' (Neutral Point of View). Whether I agree with your views or not as a Wikipedia contributer I'm obligated to maintain the '''NPOV''' rule. Once again, try the talk page next time.[[User:Persian Poet Gal|¤~Persian Poet Gal]] 19:50, 30 October 2006 (UTC) I appreciate you using my talk page this time. I have kept the response because it was presented more intelligently this time. Feel free to read my response on my talk page.[[User:Persian Poet Gal|¤~Persian Poet Gal]] 20:53, 30 October 2006 (UTC) :She is right on this one: while he has been heavily criticized, calling his behavior to be "gross incompentance" and the Iraq war to be a "humanitarian disaster" is clearly POV. Sorry, chief.-[[User:Patstuart|Patstuart]][[User_talk:Patstuart|(talk)]][[Special:contributions/Patstuart|(contribs)]] 22:32, 30 October 2006 (UTC)

== article for deletion ==
==[[Portland public art]]== I have added a "{{[[Template:prod|prod]]}}" template to the article [[Portland public art]], suggesting that it be deleted according to the [[Wikipedia:Proposed deletion|proposed deletion]] process. All contributions are appreciated, but I don't believe it satisfies Wikipedia's criteria for inclusion, and I've explained why in the deletion notice (see also "[[Wikipedia:What Wikipedia is not|What Wikipedia is not]]" and [[Wikipedia:Deletion policy|Wikipedia's deletion policy]]). Please either work to improve the article if the topic is worthy of inclusion in Wikipedia, or, if you disagree with the notice, discuss the issues at [[Talk:Portland public art|its talk page]]. Removing the deletion notice will prevent deletion through the proposed deletion process, but the article may still be sent to [[Wikipedia:Articles for deletion|Articles for Deletion]], where it may be deleted if consensus to delete is reached, or if it matches any of the [[Wikipedia:Criteria for speedy deletion|speedy deletion criteria]]. -[[User:Peteforsyth|Pete]] 08:50, 15 February 2007 (UTC)

== merge == IMHO the articles about the building ([[Hôtel-Dieu, Beaune]]) and about the charitable institution ([[Hospices de Beaune]]) should be merged. Best wishes, --[[User:Drahreg01|Drahreg01]] 19:50, 30 October 2006 (UTC)
'''Oppose''' - the two are really quite separate subjects. --[[User:Ross Burgess|rossb]] 22:48, 30 October 2006 (UTC)
'''Support''' I know this is old but the two really should be merged, the far more comprehensive French version treats them as one subject and the Hôtel-Dieu is the hospice. The opening line of the French article even states it as "Les Hospices de Beaune ou Hôtel-Dieu de Beaune est un ancien établissement hospitalier du XVe siècle, devenu aujourd'hui musée, situé à Beaune en Bourgogne." [[User:Jayran|Jayran]] 05:36, 6 August 2007 (UTC)

A '''day-fine''', '''day fine''', '''unit fine''' or '''structured fine''' is a unit of [[Fine (penalty)|fine]] payment that, above a minimum fine, is based on the offender's daily [[personal income]]. A crime is punished with incarceration for a determined number of days, or with fines. As incarceration is a financial [[punishment]], in the effect of preventing work, a day-fine represents one day incarcerated and without salary. It is argued to be just, because if both high-income and low-income population are punished with the same jail time, they should also be punished with a proportionally similar income loss. An analogy may be drawn with [[income tax]], which is also proportional to the income, even [[progressive tax|progressively]].
Jurisdictions employing the day-fine include Finland ({{lang-fi|päiväsakko}}), Sweden ({{lang-sv|dagsbot}}), Denmark ({{lang-da|dagbøde}}), Croatia, Germany ({{lang-de|Tagessatz}}), Switzerland, and Macao.
==Distribution== Unit fine systems are common and standard in many jurisdictions across the world, notably in [[Fenno-Scandinavia]], where it originated in 1921 in [[Finland]], and in [[Commonwealth of Nations|Commonwealth]] countries such as [[Australia]] and [[New Zealand]]{{Citation needed|date=December 2012}}.
===Finland=== [[Image:Poliiseja ja rajavartijoita partioveneellä.jpg|thumb|right|Both police and the [[Finnish Border Guard]] can make a formal demand for fining a person or order a petty fine.]] In [[Finland]], the day-fine system is used for most crimes that are punishable by way of a fine. The system has been in use since 1921.<ref>Law 130/1921</ref><ref>{{cite news |author=[[Suzanne Daley]] |agency= |title=Speeding in Finland Can Cost a Fortune, if You Already Have One |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2015/04/26/world/europe/speeding-in-finland-can-cost-a-fortune-if-you-already-have-one.html |quote=In fact, the Finnish “day fine” system, also in use in some other Scandinavian countries, dates to the 1920s, when fines based on income were instituted for all manner of lesser crimes, such as petty theft and assault, and helped greatly reduce the prison population. |newspaper=[[New York Times]] |date=April 25, 2015 |accessdate=2015-04-26 }}</ref> Most minor infractions are punished with a fixed petty fine (''rikesakko'', ''ordningsbot'') such as minor traffic and water traffic violations, [[litter]]ing, and breaches of public peace.<ref>[http://www.finlex.fi/fi/laki/ajantasa/1889/18890039001 Criminal Code (''Rikoslaki'' 39/1889)] Chapter 2a, 9 §] Retrieved 9-27-2007 {{fi icon}}</ref> A petty fine is summarily ordered by the police officer if the suspect does not contest his guilt, but the person punished may contest the fine in a district court.<ref>[http://www.finlex.fi/fi/laki/ajantasa/1983/19830066 ''Laki rikesakkomenettelystä'', 6§ and 12 §.] Retrieved 9-27-2007 {{fi icon}}</ref>
[[Image:Valtionsyyttäjä Ari Kuusimäki ja kihlakunnansyyttäjät Johanna Hervonen sekä Tommi Hietanen.jpg|thumb|right|Finnish prosecutors have considerable judicial power in deciding fines. Here, prosecutors are arriving at a court of law.]] Most infractions are punishable with a day-fine. For crimes warranting no more than six months in prison, the fine may be summarily ordered by the [[prosecutor]] if the suspect does not want the court to handle the case. The process of ordering a day fine is started by a police officer who makes a formal demand for the suspect to be fined. The suspect has one week to contest the demand. If the suspect does not contest the demand, the prosecutor may order a fine which may not be higher than demanded by the police officer. If the suspect contests the demand, the case may be taken to the [[Judicial system of Finland#District Courts|district court]] if the prosecutor considers the suspect guilty. If the prosecutor considers the case to merit a term in prison or a higher fine, the case is always taken to the court.<ref>[http://www.finlex.fi/fi/laki/ajantasa/1993/19930692 ''Laki rangaistusmääräysmenettelystä'' (692/1992)] Retrieved 9-27-2007 {{fi icon}}</ref> If the prosecution or the injured party do not demand a higher punishment than a fine, the district court has a [[quorum]] with a single member.<ref>[http://www.finlex.fi/fi/laki/ajantasa/1734/17340004000 ''Oikeudenkäymiskaari'' (4/1734)], Chapter 2, 6 §. Retrieved 9-27-2007. {{fi icon}}</ref> The fine is paid to the bank using a [[giro]].<ref>[http://www.oikeus.fi/oikeusrekisterikeskus/13536.htm Oikeusrekisterikeskus. ''Täytäntöönpano- ja perintäasiat'']. Retrieved 9-27-2007. {{fi icon}}</ref> A fine ordered in Finland is executable in any [[European Union]] member country.<ref>[http://www.oikeus.fi/oikeusrekisterikeskus/39018.htm Oikeusrekisterikeskus. ''EU-sakkojen täytäntöönpano'']. Retrieved 9-27-2007. {{fi icon}}</ref>
A Finnish fine consists of a minimum of 1 day-fine, up to a maximum of 120 day-fines. If several crimes are punished together, 240 day-fines may be sentenced. The fines may not be sentenced together with a prison sentence, unless the prison sentence is probational. The minimum amount of a day-fine is 6 [[euro]]s. Usually, the day-fine is one half of daily disposable income. The daily disposable income is considered to be one 60th part of the person's monthly mean income during the year, after taxes, social security payments and a basic living allowance of €255 per month have been deducted. In addition, every person for whose upkeep the fined person is responsible decreases the amount of daily fine by €3. The income of the person is calculated on the basis of the latest taxation data.<ref>[http://www.finlex.fi/fi/laki/ajantasa/1889/18890039001 ''Rikoslaki'' (39/1889), Chapter 2a]. Retrieved 27-9-2007 {{fi icon}}</ref><ref>[http://www.finlex.fi/fi/laki/alkup/1999/19990609 ''Asetus päiväsakon rahamäärästä''], 2-3§. Retrieved 27-9-2007. {{fi icon}}</ref> For speeding in traffic, however, the fine is at least as high as the petty fine, i.e. €115.<ref>[http://www.finlex.fi/fi/laki/alkup/2001/20011037 ''Asetus päiväsakon rahamäärästä''], 7§. Retrieved 27-9-2007. {{fi icon}}</ref>
The person who is punished with a fine is responsible for giving accurate information concerning their income. Lying about one's income ({{lang-fi|sakkovilppi}}, {{lang-sv|bötesfusk}}) is a crime punishable with a fine or up to three months in prison.<ref>[http://www.finlex.fi/fi/laki/ajantasa/1889/18890039001 ''Rikoslaki'' (39/1889)], Chapter 16, 6 §. Retrieved 9-27-2007. {{fi icon}}</ref> The police can, however, access the taxation data of Finnish citizens and permanent residents via a real-time datalink, so the chance of lying successfully is minor. There is no maximum day-fine, which may lead to considerably high fines for high-income persons. For example, in 2001, a Finnish businessman with a yearly income of 10 million euros, received a relatively mild punishment of six day-fines, amounting €26,000, for driving though a red traffic light.<ref>[http://www.iltasanomat.fi/kotimaa/Nokian%20Ala-Pietil%C3%A4n%20208000%20markan%20sakot%20voivat%20viel%C3%A4%20nousta/art-1288335939159.html Nokian Ala-Pietilän 208000 markan sakot voivat vielä nousta] Iltasanomat 11-9-2001. Retrieved 9-27-2001. {{fi icon}}</ref><ref>[http://www.iltasanomat.fi/kotimaa/Nokian%20toimitusjohtaja%20sai%20j%C3%A4ttisakot/art-1288339719135.html Nokian toimitusjohtaja sai jättisakot.] Iltasanomat 9-13-2007. Retrieved 9-27-2001. {{fi icon}}</ref> In 2009 a businessman was fined €112,000 for travelling at 82 kilometres per hour in an area with a speed limit of 60 kilometres per hour.<ref>[http://www.hs.fi/english/article/-/1135244082566 Businessman fined nearly EUR 112,000 for speeding in Eastern Finland] Helsingin Sanomat 6.3.2009. Retrieved 6.3.2009. {{en icon}}</ref> As speeding is punished with a petty fine if the offender is exceeding the speed limit by up to 20 km/h, but with a day-fine if exceeding the limit by 21 km/h or more, the monetary amount of the fine can increase from €115 to over €100,000 although the actual change in speed is less than 1 km/h. This has given rise to some criticism, most vividly expressed by a Finnish member of parliament, avid motorist [[Klaus Bremer]] and other MPs of right-wing parties.<ref>[http://www.riksdagen.fi/faktatmp/utatmp/akxtmp/ptk_73_2000_ke_p_7.shtml ''Täysistunnon pöytäkirja PTK 73/2000 vp'' (The minutes of the plenary session of Finnish parliament, PTK 73/2000 vp.)] Retrieved 9-27-2007. {{fi icon}} {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080615013709/http://www.riksdagen.fi/faktatmp/utatmp/akxtmp/ptk_73_2000_ke_p_7.shtml |date=June 15, 2008 }}</ref>
The fines are subject to recovery proceedings.
===Macao=== Article 45 of the Penal Code ({{zh|刑法典}}, Portuguese: {{lang|pt|Código Penal}}) specifies that a criminal fine ({{zh|罰金}}, Portuguese: {{lang|pt|pena de multa}}) shall normally be at least 10 days and at most 360 days. One day-fine costs at least 50 [[Macanese pataca]]s and at most 10,000 patacas. A court of law imposes the fine based on the economic and financial situations and personal burdens of a convict.<ref>Penal Code of Macao in [http://bo.io.gov.mo/bo/i/95/46/codpencn/codpen0001.asp traditional Chinese] and [http://www.imprensa.macau.gov.mo/bo/i/95/46/codpenpt/codpen0001.asp Portuguese]. Retrieved 2008-05-28.</ref>
===United Kingdom=== [[England and Wales]] experimented with the system for a short period from 1992 to 1993. It was unpopular with both [[magistrate]]s and the general public, and was soon abandoned.<ref> [http://www.scotland.gov.uk/Publications/2004/03/19042/34209 Summary Justice Review Committee]</ref><ref name=BBC>{{cite news |author=<!--Staff writer(s); no by-line.--> |title=Fine plans echo 1991 Tory policy |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/uk_politics/4173913.stm |work=[[BBC]] |location=London |date=January 14, 2015 |access-date=April 7, 2017}}</ref> The scheme was replaced by requirements that magistrates consider an offender's means when imposing a fine, just not according to a mathematical formula.<ref name=BBC/>
===United States=== ''[[The New York Times]]'' reported on an experience with day fines which took place in 1988 in [[Staten Island]], which was a partnership between the local courts and [[District Attorney]], and the [[Vera Institute of Justice]].<ref>{{cite news |author=<!--Staff writer(s); no by-line.--> |title=Criminal Fines, by the Day |url=https://www.nytimes.com/1988/08/29/opinion/criminal-fines-by-the-day.html |work=The New York Times |location=New York |date=August 29, 1988 |access-date=April 7, 2017}}</ref>
==References== {{reflist|2}}
== External links == * [http://www.oikeusrekisterikeskus.fi/en/index.html Legal Register Centre] - agency responsible for handling day-fines in Finland {{DEFAULTSORT:Day-Fine}} [[Category:Criminal law]] [[Category:Finnish law]] [[Category:Punishments]]

== Trevor becker ==

revision.text:
{{ infobox wargame | title = Aeronautica Imperialis | image_link = [[File:Aero-Imp-Cover.jpg|200px]] | image_caption = Cover of the ''Aeronautica Imperialis'' rulebook | designer = [[Forge World]] and others | publisher = [[Games Workshop]] | players = 2+ | ages = 12+ | setup_time = 5 - 30 minutes | playing_time = 30 minutes - 3 hours | random_chance = [[Dice|Dice rolling]] | web = www.forgeworld.co.uk }}
'''''Aeronautica Imperialis''''' is a [[Miniature wargaming|tabletop miniature wargame]] set within the ''[[Warhammer 40,000]]'' universe. The game focuses on aerial combat between the different races of the Warhammer 40,000 universe. Released in January 2007, it was developed and published by [[Forge World]],<ref name="Forge World 2007 Catalogue">{{cite book|title=Forge World 2007 Catalogue|publisher=Forge World, Games Workshop|location=Nottingham|isbn=1-84154-650-X}}</ref> a division of the British gaming company [[Games Workshop]].
Aeronautica Imperialis is a companion game to ''[[Epic (game)|Epic]]'', which emphasises battles between armies on a larger scale than ''Warhammer 40,000''.
==The game== Gameplay-wise, the major difference between ''Epic'' and ''Aeronautica Imperialis'' is that instead of a player moving and firing tanks and troops, they are using aircraft and ground defense weapons.
The ''Aeronautica Imperialis'' rulebook contains not only rules for the games, but also [https://web.archive.org/web/20130109044458/http://www.forgeworld.co.uk/Epic-40000/Rule__and_Accessories/AERONAUTICA-IMPERIALIS-COMBAT-MANOEUVRE-CARDS.html two sheets of cards] which are used to make special manoeuvres. Other content in the rulebook is background material on the individual aircraft, along with full colour plates and suggestions for painting. At the end of the book, there is a 'campaign' section with scenarios for players to recreate.
==Armies and Units==
It makes use of currently available aircraft models designed for ''[[Epic (game)|Epic]]'', which are approximately [[Scale model#Model tanks and wargaming|6mm scale, or 1:285]]. Forge World's [https://web.archive.org/web/20130116114549/http://www.forgeworld.co.uk/Epic-40000 Epic web pages] say that "Epic models are 5 times smaller than their Warhammer 40,000 equivalent". In addition to the use of the miniatures, Forge World also sells special bases for the game to indicate such things as the [[Altitude#Altitude in Aviation|altitude]], [[Airspeed|speed]], and fire arcs of each aeroplane.
The currently supported races or factions are the [[Imperial Navy (Warhammer 40,000)|Imperial Navy]], [[Space Marines (Warhammer 40,000)|Space Marines]], [[Eldar (Warhammer 40,000)|Eldar]], [[Tau (Warhammer 40,000)|Tau]], [[Chaos (Warhammer)|Chaos]] and [[Ork (Warhammer 40,000)|Orks]].
==Storylines==
Aeronautica Imperialis has a strong tie with the [[Black Library]] book ''[https://web.archive.org/web/20070927183846/http://www.blacklibrary.co.uk/product.asp?prod=60100199064&type=Book Double Eagle]'' by [[Dan Abnett]]. This deals with the air war occurring during the [[Sabbat Worlds Campaign]] (the setting for Abnett's ''[[Gaunt's Ghosts]]'' novel series). It has a [[Battle of Britain]] flavour; many of the concepts elucidated in the Aeronautica rules can be seen in Abnett's writing.
==Supplements== In late 2007, Forge World released [https://web.archive.org/web/20130109041807/http://www.forgeworld.co.uk/Epic-40000/Rule__and_Accessories/TACTICA-AERONAUTICA.html Tactica Aeronautica], a collection of extra rules, new aircraft and scenarios for the game.
==References== <references/> *[https://web.archive.org/web/20130109041742/http://www.forgeworld.co.uk/Epic-40000/Rule__and_Accessories/AERONAUTICA-IMPERIALIS.html Forge World Aeronautica Imperialis site] *[https://www.games-workshop.com/gws/content/article.jsp?catId=&categoryId=cat480006a&section=&pIndex=0&aId=2500031&start=1&multiPageMode=true Games Workshop 'specialist games' Epic site] *[http://boardgamegeek.com/boardgame/27359/aeronautica-imperialis A review of Aeronautica Imperialis] {{Warhammer 40,000}}
[[Category:Warhammer 40,000 tabletop games]] [[Category:Games Workshop games]]

Technetium
== About ==
It's Elemental Baby!!!
What is Technetium? Besides being the hottest USA based EDM music act, technetium is number 43 on the periodic table of elements. Technetium was the first element to be produced artificially. All of her isotopes are radioactive and coming to a sound system near you!!!!!! Technetium has a passion for powerful soundscapes, using 'fusion' to combine a diverse range of genres. Technetium's goal is to create tracks so moving that each song can affect the deepest reaches of the mind and inspire people to think beyond the constraints of ideology. Originally written for video games and movies, the Technetium music experience is now expanding to clubs and fans around the world. With Technetium's signature sonic assault on the senses, each track promises to take us to where the 'Wild Things' are!
Fun Facts about Technetium What is her symbol? Tc What is her atomic number? 43 What is her atomic weight? 98 What is her boiling point in Celsius? 4877 What year was she discovered? Don't ask me my age!
Support Your Local Wildlife!! Technetium is an endangered species. Support your local wildlife, email today to find out how. technetiummusic@aol.com === Videos ===
Powersupply: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RUae8BSKiUY
Nosce te Ipsum: http://ia331341.us.archive.org/0/items/Technetium_Nosce_te_Ipsum_Video/NosceTeIpsum.mp4
Mission Control: http://ia311541.us.archive.org/2/items/Technetium_Mission_Control_Video/MissionControlTechnetium.mp4

revision.text: {{WikiProject Cities|class=c|importance=Mid}} {{WikiProject United States|class=start|importance=Low|Boston=yes|Boston-importance=|MA=yes|MA-importance=}} ==Untitled== I'm going to remove "Chelsea is the smallest city in the United States. It is just 1.8 square miles." Reason: Central Falls, RI is 1.3 1.3 mi² ( http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Central_Falls ) , and I am not sure that Central Falls is the smallest == History == {{contradict}} How could Chelsea have been part of [[Boston, Massachusetts|Boston]] in its first few years if Boston did not exist until 1630? -- [[User:Beland|Beland]] 01:07, 27 November 2006 (UTC) Yo. Update this census account in the demographics — Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[Special:Contributions/4.71.183.238|4.71.183.238]] ([[User talk:4.71.183.238|talk]]) 19:10, 5 July 2011 (UTC) == 2010 Census == Can someone please update the demographics? [[User:DeltaRhoPhi|ΔΡΦ]] ([[User talk:DeltaRhoPhi|talk]]) 21:41, 12 December 2011 (UTC) ==Population Density== Chelsea is only 1.8 square miles of land. If you look at the table linked to with US city densities it uses a larger land area. I believe Chelsea should actually be ranked 15th most dense city, not 26th. Looking at other cities on the list (including NYC) they make this land vs land+water distinction when calculating density. — Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[User:Brufleth|Brufleth]] ([[User talk:Brufleth|talk]] • [[Special:Contributions/Brufleth|contribs]]) 20:03, 27 April 2012 (UTC) == Elizabeth Cady Stanton == Elizabeth Cady Stanton (American social activist, abolitionist, and leading figure of the early women's rights movement) spent much of the 1840s in the Boston area; their home (from about 1843 to 1847) was actually not in the city of Boston, but rather in Chelsea, a city in Suffolk County directly across the Mystic River, just north of downtown Boston. "She had married Stanton on May 10, 1840, at the age of 25 and accompanied him immediately thereafter on a journey to the World's Anti-Slavery Convention in London. At the close of the convention, the Stantons traveled around the British Isles and France for several months; in November 1840, they returned to Elizabeth Cady Stanton's childhood home in Johnstown, New York, where Henry Stanton studied law for two years under his father-in-law, Judge Daniel Cady. In 1842, Henry Stanton started a law practice of his own in Boston and the family relocated to a home outside the city of Chelsea. [1] [1. Edward T. James, Janet Wilson James, Paul S. Boyer, eds, Notable American Women, Vol. III (Massachusetts, 1971), pp. 342-3.] Here, Elizabeth Cady Stanton wrote "I spent some of the happiest days of my life, enjoying, in turn, the beautiful outlook, my children, and my books." [2] [2. Stanton, Eighty Years, p. 140.] Through her husband's associations with the leading abolitionist and reform figures of the day she made the acquaintance of many of the liberal, literary, and philosophical lights then illuminating Boston. Stanton took full advantage of her stimulating situation and later wrote that "I attended all the lectures, churches, theaters, concerts, and temperance, peace, and prison-reform conventions within my reach. I had never lived in such an enthusiastically literary and reform latitude before, and my mental powers were kept at the highest tension." [3] [3. Stanton, Eighty Years, p. 133.] Henry Stanton's health, however, was not up to the raw Boston winters, and after four years the decision was made to return to New York state." www.nps.gov/history/history/online_books/wori/shs3.htm -[[Special:Contributions/96.233.27.148|96.233.27.148]] ([[User talk:96.233.27.148|talk]]) 14:57, 6 December 2013 (UTC) == External links modified == Hello fellow Wikipedians, I have just modified {{plural:5|one external link|5 external links}} on [[Chelsea, Massachusetts]]. Please take a moment to review [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?diff=prev&oldid=750656109 my edit]. If you have any questions, or need the bot to ignore the links, or the page altogether, please visit [[User:Cyberpower678/FaQs#InternetArchiveBot|this simple FaQ]] for additional information. I made the following changes: *Added archive https://web.archive.org/web/20130911234518/http://factfinder2.census.gov to http://factfinder2.census.gov *Added archive https://web.archive.org/web/20130911234518/http://factfinder2.census.gov to http://factfinder2.census.gov *Added archive http://www.webcitation.org/6YSasqtfX?url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.census.gov%2Fprod%2Fwww%2Fdecennial.html to http://www.census.gov/prod/www/decennial.html *Added archive https://web.archive.org/web/20130911234518/http://factfinder2.census.gov to http://factfinder2.census.gov *Added archive https://web.archive.org/web/20141218203429/http://factfinder2.census.gov/faces/tableservices/jsf/pages/productview.xhtml?pid=DEC_10_SF1_QTP10&prodType=table to http://factfinder2.census.gov/faces/tableservices/jsf/pages/productview.xhtml?pid=DEC_10_SF1_QTP10&prodType=table When you have finished reviewing my changes, please set the ''checked'' parameter below to '''true''' or '''failed''' to let others know (documentation at {{tlx|Sourcecheck}}). {{sourcecheck|checked=false}} Cheers.—[[User:InternetArchiveBot|'''InternetArchiveBot''']] ([[User talk:InternetArchiveBot|Report bug]]) 02:21, 21 November 2016 (UTC) == External links modified == Hello fellow Wikipedians, I have just modified 2 external links on [[Chelsea, Massachusetts]]. Please take a moment to review [[special:diff/813994073|my edit]]. If you have any questions, or need the bot to ignore the links, or the page altogether, please visit [[User:Cyberpower678/FaQs#InternetArchiveBot|this simple FaQ]] for additional information. I made the following changes: *Added archive https://web.archive.org/web/20090417142349/http://www.chelseand.org/about.chelsea.php to http://www.chelseand.org/about.chelsea.php *Added archive https://web.archive.org/web/20121115074942/http://www.chelseama.gov/Public_Documents/ChelseaMA_WebDocs/pubdocs to http://www.chelseama.gov/Public_Documents/ChelseaMA_WebDocs/pubdocs When you have finished reviewing my changes, you may follow the instructions on the template below to fix any issues with the URLs. {{sourcecheck|checked=false|needhelp=}} Cheers.—[[User:InternetArchiveBot|'''InternetArchiveBot''']] ([[User talk:InternetArchiveBot|Report bug]]) 09:26, 6 December 2017 (UTC)

*[[Juan Botella]] :* Preliminary Round — 69.39 :* Final — 125.45 (→ 10th place)

revision.text: :''The following discussion is an archived debate of the proposed deletion of the article below. '''Please do not modify it.''' Subsequent comments should be made on the appropriate discussion page (such as the article's talk page or in a [[Wikipedia:Deletion review|deletion review]]). No further edits should be made to this page. '' The result was '''no consensus''', I guess. No real discussion about the deletion since the copyvio was identified. If someone writes an original article, or this one gets kept at wp:cp, feel free to nominate it again (if you feel like it). - [[User:Bobet|Bobet]] 21:23, 7 November 2006 (UTC) ===[[Natalie choquette]]=== None of the information in this article is sourced, and although there is a small claim to notability, none of it is verified. Also note: the article's sole contributor is a possible single purpose account. [[User:MonkBirdDuke|MonkBirdDuke]] 19:53, 30 October 2006 (UTC) *'''Keep''' - This one's a toughie. The artist is certainly notable per [[WP:Bio|our guidelines]], but the article seems to exist for publicity purposes (based on the prime editor's comments on the [[Talk:Natalie_choquette|talk page]]). I'm also concerned about how closely the article resembles the artist's biography posted on her official website (the French one, I couldn't open the English version). I would appreciate it if someone with a better command of French took a look at the two to make sure we are not stealing material. That issue aside, we have a notable individual who's bio needs significant clean up, but not deletion. [[User:Robertbcole|-bobby]] 20:32, 30 October 2006 (UTC) *'''Tag as copyvio and close'''. Notable enough, but still a copyvio so tagging it until it gets resolved. [[User:ColourBurst|ColourBurst]] 21:03, 30 October 2006 (UTC) :''The above discussion is preserved as an archive of the debate. '''Please do not modify it.''' Subsequent comments should be made on the appropriate discussion page (such as the article's talk page or in a [[Wikipedia:Deletion review|deletion review]]). No further edits should be made to this page.

== See comments on [[WP:RFI]] == Pat, I've reviewed the edits and commented in detail on the RFI page. One area that I can't comment on is regarding potential subtle vandalism to assorted band pages, and I'm unfamiliar with the genre. -- [[User:Jim Douglas|Jim Douglas]] [[User talk:Jim Douglas|(talk)]] [[Special:Contributions/Jim Douglas|(contribs)]] 17:41, 19 October 2006 (UTC) :I think I've said (and re-said) everything I can on the RFI. Take another look at it when you get a chance. -- [[User:Jim Douglas|Jim Douglas]] [[User talk:Jim Douglas|(talk)]] [[Special:Contributions/Jim Douglas|(contribs)]] 19:30, 19 October 2006 (UTC) ::He seems a bit less active at the moment. I noticed [http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Punk_fashion&diff=prev&oldid=82465468 this] questionable edit yesterday, where he changed ''goth'' to ''mainstream'', but it was later deleted by another editor. I'm still not sure what's supposed to happen on [[WP:RFI]]; it's not clear what it takes to convince an admin to become involved, and I'm not even sure what the remedy is. -- [[User:Jim Douglas|Jim Douglas]] [[User talk:Jim Douglas|(talk)]] [[Special:Contributions/Jim Douglas|(contribs)]] 15:13, 20 October 2006 (UTC) :::Why are you hounding me, Jim Douglas? You call the edit to which you linked 'questionable'...I corrected some shocking grammar, and changed the statement so it more accurately fits the facts. What do you know about 'emo'? I must confess I don't know much about it, but what I do know is enough to realise that claiming it is influenced by gothic fashion is blatantly false, and was obviously added by a misinformed imbecile who can't write a coherent sentence. The influence on 'emo' ''must'' be mainstream fashion, because it is like a watered-down poserish form of commercialised punk. That's a fact - even those who listen to it must be aware of the poser element because they call it 'scenecore', showing that being a 'scenester' and seen as a fashionable member of the group is more important than the aesthetic merit of the music. I am not sure that I have heard 'emo' music, but I am sure it is aesthetically bankrupt, as most of that garbage is. The other editor probably deleted the sentence altogether because pointing out that 'emo' is mainstream is redundant. Note that they didn't revert my edit back to 'gothic' and bad grammar, because it was the edit of ''the anonymous person'', not me, which was questionable. So please explain exactly what is questionable about my change. Show that I am wrong when I think you are harassing me, and trying to pick a fight by saying objectionable things about my actions. Either that, or apologise for insulting me. [[User:The Crying Orc|The Crying Orc]] 14:03, 21 October 2006 (UTC) ::::"Hounding"? Oh, please. I made that comment to Patstuart; you had to come looking for it. Yes, I said it was questionable; you'll also note that ''I'' didn't revert it. The entire sentence, including your change, was [http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Punk_fashion&diff=next&oldid=82465468 removed] 20 minutes later with an edit summary of "deleted unneccessary and questionable content". You've demonstrated a pattern of injecting nonsense into articles, so at the moment, your edits are questionable by default. You have repeatedly displayed bad faith in your short time on Wikipedia. I direct your attention to the bold text in [[WP:AGF]]: '''This policy does not require that editors continue to assume good faith in the presence of evidence to the contrary.''' -- [[User:Jim Douglas|Jim Douglas]] [[User talk:Jim Douglas|(talk)]] [[Special:Contributions/Jim Douglas|(contribs)]] 15:41, 21 October 2006 (UTC) ::Actually, that edit does seem legit. Though I personally believe that emo is influenced by goth, though neither side would readily admit it (a.k.a. crossover bands like Good Charlotte, whose fashion sense is clearly gothic, but whose music is not); emo is considerably more mainstream too than goth. -[[User:Patstuart|Patstuart]][[User_talk:Patstuart|(talk)]][[Special:contributions/Patstuart|(contribs)]] 15:22, 21 October 2006 (UTC) == RC Patroller Mistakes Notice == I borrowed your noticebox and installed it on my [[User_Talk:E. It responds to this person's username, and also gives a link to some comments I made on the IP address. -[[User:Patstuart|Patstuart]][[User_talk:Patstuart|(talk)]][[Special:contributions/Patstuart|(contribs)]] 02:16, 24 October 2006 (UTC) ::BTW, I apologize if this user is a vandal, and you were reverting genuine vandalism. -[[User:Patstuart|Patstuart]][[User_talk:Patstuart|(talk)]][[Special:contributions/Patstuart|(contribs)]] 02:16, 24 October 2006 (UTC) == MuchMusic Countdown number-one videos of 2000 == Hi Thanks for changing the article name. It was a mistake. [[User:Ksrgn]] edited my article [[MuchMusic Countdown number-one videos of 2001]] at the succession box so that the link [[MuchMusic Countdown number-one videos of 2001]] became [[MuchMupoopsic Countdown number-one videos of 2001]]. The contents for [[MuchMusic Countdown number-one videos of 2000]] are now up. I'm pretty new to editing wikipedia articles, —Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[User:Agdonald|Agdonald]] ([[User talk:Agdonald|talk]] • [[Special:Contributions/Agdonald|contribs]]) :No problem. He's been given a preliminary warning. If he does it again, feel free to give me a hollar. -[[User:Patstuart|Patstuart]][[User_talk:Patstuart|(talk)]][[Special:contributions/Patstuart|(contribs)]] 02:21, 24 October 2006 (UTC) == My Auburn Football Team Articles. == I'm trying to go year by year and add the schedule and results. Then go into each one and add more specific facts about that year. —Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[User:Footballfiji|Footballfiji]] ([[User talk:Footballfiji|talk]] • [[Special:Contributions/Footballfiji|contribs]]) Pat, please take a look at [[Wikipedia:WikiProject College Football]] - as a PSU fan you might find the project interesting and you'll also note that Footballfiji was led astray by a typical construct found in the Project's articles (a season navbox) such as [[Auburn Tigers football]] or [[2006 LSU Tigers football team]]. Oh, here's one you might like: [[2006 Penn State Nittany Lions football team]]. [[User:Autiger |AUTiger]] ʃ [[User_talk:Autiger|talk]]/[[Special:Contributions/Autiger|work]] 05:30, 25 October 2006 (UTC) :No problem! Originally, I saw his contributions, and wanted to say something because I thought he wasn't quite doing it right, and I knew someone else would definitely take exception, so I said something. I actually thought they came down on him a little hard for a [[WP:BITE|newbie]]; I didn't think it worth deleting the articles. That being said, I think it makes more sense to make individual articles about contemporary teams then every one of the old ones, don't you? I'll admit, I've even contributed to the 2006 PSU article. If you think I'm in error, feel free to say something. Thanks. -[[User:Patstuart|Patstuart]][[User_talk:Patstuart|(talk)]][[Special:contributions/Patstuart|(contribs)]] 14:18, 25 October 2006 (UTC) ::I agree on the individual articles for new seasons being more prevalent than historic seasons, and there is a talk page discusions at the College football project about guidelines on how to appropriately address historic seasons. Some may be concerned about WP bias towards the new, but the simple fact is there are more referencable sources for what is happening now (and last 20years) than what happened 100 years ago. It's only natural that will happen . [[User:Autiger |AUTiger]] ʃ [[User_talk:Autiger|talk]]/[[Special:Contributions/Autiger|work]] 15:18, 25 October 2006 (UTC) == Re; Baikal Mountains == That's O.K. I accidently saved it too soon. I'm still working on it and will be careful not to save it agin until it is ready. Thanks! [[User:Mattisse|Mattisse]][[User_talk:Mattisse|(talk)]] 03:49, 24 October 2006 (UTC) :I thought it was a little weird warning an established editor like that. Anyway, you know you can create test pages, like [[User:Mattisee/Sandbox]]. A lot of people do that. -[[User:Patstuart|Patstuart]][[User_talk:Patstuart|(talk)]][[Special:contributions/Patstuart|(contribs)]] 03:50, 24 October 2006 (UTC) I can't because old article saved by mistake hasn't been deleted yet. Should I save it under a made up name and change it later? [[User:Mattisse|Mattisse]][[User_talk:Mattisse|(talk)]] 04:38, 24 October 2006 (UTC) :Sure you can. Just put it right in the article. I don't think any admin will be mad for removing a db-empty tag when replacing with valid content. -[[User:Patstuart|Patstuart]][[User_talk:Patstuart|(talk)]][[Special:contributions/Patstuart|(contribs)]] 04:40, 24 October 2006 (UTC) == Re: Smile == My pleasure! :-) [[User:KrakatoaKatie|'''Krakatoa''']][[User talk:KrakatoaKatie|Katie]] 08:09, 24 October 2006 (UTC) == deadsville cobras == hi there, why did you touch the cobras page? defomd [[User:Defomd|Defomd]] 17:01, 24 October 2006 (UTC) :I didn't sense the article showed the notability of the organization. I've removed the deletion request; the rest of the format changes I made will stay though; I think you'll find those for the better anyway. -[[User:Patstuart|Patstuart]][[User_talk:Patstuart|(talk)]][[Special:contributions/Patstuart|(contribs)]] 17:04, 24 October 2006 (UTC) == Mission Page. == Please check your information before you revert a page, then rerevert it to the information that you thought was wrong. I go to Mission and I know everything that goes around; any edits to the page whether recent information about staff or old information as history will be true. I always clear them with another student on ASB or the Principal. Not getting on ya, just giving the information. :] [[User:HackerStyle|HackerStyle]] 18:00, 24 October 2006 (UTC) :You'll notice that as soon as I reverted the page, I undid my reversion, though. On recent-pages patrol, it's easy to get to goof occasionally (see big message at the top of my page), and once the page has been reverted, I can only undo my reversion like I did on that page. Pardon the disruption. -[[User:Patstuart|Patstuart]][[User_talk:Patstuart|(talk)]][[Special:contributions/Patstuart|(contribs)]] 18:03, 24 October 2006 (UTC) :I notice notice too, from your talk page, that I wasn't the only one who goofed and thought your edits were bad. Please understand, high schoolers have an ungodly pension to think it's hilariously funny to vandalize their school page; half the high school pages on this pedia are already corrupt. So we can be very suspicious of changes, especially changing the principal and making the school mascot to be "chippy the chipmunk" and the like. -[[User:Patstuart|Patstuart]][[User_talk:Patstuart|(talk)]][[Special:contributions/Patstuart|(contribs)]] 18:07, 24 October 2006 (UTC) == Updated Jesse_Kornblum article == Hi Pat, I received your note about the [[Jesse_Kornblum]] article and have updated it to show how the subject is notable. Please let me know what you think and if more details are needed. thanks, -- Jesse == [[Michael J. Bassett]] == Hello Paststuart. You left me a notice on my article about [[Michael J. Bassett]]. This estabilished, and well loved director is quite important and critically allaimed. I see no reason why this article should be deleted. If you could help me find a way to somehow prevent this articles deletion, I would be quite grateful. Thanks again. ([[User:Nintendofan 7|Nintendofan 7]] 18:38, 24 October 2006 (UTC)) :The article appears to be doing alright right now. It was not speedy deleted. It looks like it's asserting enough importance as is. Anymore, it will probably not be speedy deleted, only given a ''proposed deletion'' (needs to stay for 5 days) or an ''afd'' tag, which means community members discuss (it's much like a vote, though). I would place information under the dicussion page, however, explaining how you think Mr. Bassett fits the [[WP:BIO]] profile. Good luck. By the way, I thoroughly enjoyed Ned Divine. :Should this fail, you can always go to the [[Wikipedia:Deletion Review]] page; this should help, I think -[[User:Patstuart|Patstuart]][[User_talk:Patstuart|(talk)]][[Special:contributions/Patstuart|(contribs)]] 19:55, 24 October 2006 (UTC) -[[User:Patstuart|Patstuart]][[User_talk:Patstuart|(talk)]][[Special:contributions/Patstuart|(contribs)]] 19:54, 24 October 2006 (UTC) Thanks Pastuart. :] ([[User:Nintendofan 7|Nintendofan 7]] 20:52, 24 October 2006 (UTC)) == Your comment on my talk page == I believe that a {{blp1}} warning to a user who has inserted material that he has been informed is BLP violation no less than five times in a single day is not only appropriate, but necessary. If I was an admin, I would have blocked the user for 24 hours. - [[User:Crockspot|Crockspot]] 18:45, 24 October 2006 (UTC) ==Reply== What have I vandalized? All I did was expand the section. I see no vandalism in that. --[[User:Mikedk9109|'''Mikedk9109''']] ([[User talk:Mikedk9109|sup]]) ([[Special:Contributions/Mikedk9109|stalk me]]) 22:07, 24 October 2006 (UTC) :It wasn't vandalism; sorry; I immediately deleted my entry. :[ -[[User:Patstuart|Patstuart]][[User_talk:Patstuart|(talk)]][[Special:contributions/Patstuart|(contribs)]] 22:08, 24 October 2006 (UTC) Oh, ok. --[[User:Mikedk9109|'''Mikedk9109''']] ([[User talk:Mikedk9109|sup]]) ([[Special:Contributions/Mikedk9109|stalk me]]) 22:10, 24 October 2006 (UTC) == Free speech == Ok, this is a rhetorical question. :-) But why do so many vandals spout off about "free speech!"? Have they ever actually read the Bill of Rights? Wikipedia isn't a branch of the United States government; it doesn't have free speech. I'm sometimes tempted to ask one of those people to point me to where in the Constitution or Bill of Rights it says they have the right to scrawl their personal opinions on private property, but I suspect it would be a waste of time. -- [[User:Jim Douglas|Jim Douglas]] [[User talk:Jim Douglas|(talk)]] [[Special:Contributions/Jim Douglas|(contribs)]] 23:10, 24 October 2006 (UTC) :I don't know man, my heart was just bleeding for his violated rights. He should be able to say whatever he wants, whenver. Granted, Wikipedia ''wouldn't exist'' in that case, but we are talking about human rights. -[[User:Patstuart|Patstuart]][[User_talk:Patstuart|(talk)]][[Special:contributions/Patstuart|(contribs)]] 23:12, 24 October 2006 (UTC) == Personal attack?? == I wasn't attacking him. his tone in discussion was becoming increasingly distasteful, which i felt needed to be brought to his attention. come to think of it, all my discussons with admin. have been a bit distasteful. you guys seem to have a knack for being condescending and underhandedly rude. this of course excludes you, as i have not noticed any particularly rude behaviour from you personally, and for that i thank you. —Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[User:Ianlarson|Ianlarson]] ([[User talk:Ianlarson|talk]] • [[Special:Contributions/Ianlarson|contribs]]) == rvv? == which edit are you refering to ? If you are refering to the last one on [[Saturn]], there was vandalism. [[User:ArthurWeasley|ArthurWeasley]] 00:14, 25 October 2006 (UTC) :No, and older one. Nvm, it probably wasn't any of my business anyway. -[[User:Patstuart|Patstuart]][[User_talk:Patstuart|(talk)]][[Special:contributions/Patstuart|(contribs)]] 00:17, 25 October 2006 (UTC) == re: [[Treasure Box]] == Restored in place but without the text which was an apparent copyvio. It needs some serious expansion, though. And it's been too long since I read the book to attempt it, I'm afraid. [[User:Rossami|Rossami]] [[User talk:Rossami|(talk)]] 01:06, 25 October 2006 (UTC) :Thank you very much. Um... actually, it was only the short thing at the top which was a quote from the book cover. The whole plot I provided on my own. -[[User:Patstuart|Patstuart]][[User_talk:Patstuart|(talk)]][[Special:contributions/Patstuart|(contribs)]] 01:08, 25 October 2006 (UTC) :: Sorry. Grabbed the wrong version from history. Is it fixed now? [[User:Rossami|Rossami]] [[User talk:Rossami|(talk)]] 01:12, 25 October 2006 (UTC) :::Yes it is! I know the English might not be very good (my writing skills are certainly not perfect), but I appreciate that much. Thanks again. -[[User:Patstuart|Patstuart]][[User_talk:Patstuart|(talk)]][[Special:contributions/Patstuart|(contribs)]] 01:13, 25 October 2006 (UTC) :::: By the way, there may still be copyright issues with the article. Remember that the plot itself is covered under the copyright. An article which is exclusively (or even a majority) plot summary can be considered a violation of the fair-use exception. A proper encyclopedia article about a book should primarily include things like analysis, literary influence and social impact. The version you have probably won't be speedy-deleted but we still have to bring the article into balance in a reasonable period. Happy editing. [[User:Rossami|Rossami]] [[User talk:Rossami|(talk)]] 02:22, 25 October 2006 (UTC) :Crap, OK, thanks. -[[User:Patstuart|Patstuart]][[User_talk:Patstuart|(talk)]][[Special:contributions/Patstuart|(contribs)]] 02:23, 25 October 2006 (UTC) == vandalism, just so you know/can pass on the word == The user at IP address [[User talk:220.239.186.227|220.239.186.227]] vandalized the article [[Lithic stage]]. I already reverted the vandalism, but I noticed all the comments on his talk page concerning prior vandalism, so I'm letting you know. You probably know who to contact/what to do about it more than I. [[User:Sdr|Sdr]] 06:30, 25 October 2006 (UTC) == You rock! (Despite being a Steelers fan...) == {| style="border: 1px solid {{{border|gray}}}; background-color: {{{color|#fdffe7}}};" |rowspan="2" valign="middle" | [[Image:Barnstar_of_Reversion2.png|100px]] |rowspan="2" | |style="font-size: x-large; padding: 0; vertical-align: middle; height: 1.1em;" | '''The RickK Anti-Vandalism Barnstar''' |- |style="vertical-align: middle; border-top: 1px solid gray;" | Just about the time when I'm ready to revert vandalism, you beat me to it. I almost decided not to give you this, considering your Steelers stole the Super Bowl from my Seahawks, but your vandalism fighting is ''that good''. -- [[User:SkerHawx|SkerHawx]] 18:14, 25 October 2006 (UTC) |} :Thank you! -[[User:Patstuart|Patstuart]][[User_talk:Patstuart|(talk)]][[Special:contributions/Patstuart|(contribs)]] 19:27, 25 October 2006 (UTC) == Guinea == I am incredibly sorry! I did not know that my comments would actually edit the web page! Thank you for telling me about the sandbox tool, it rocks! —Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[User:68.4.155.26|68.4.155.26]] ([[User talk:68.4.155.26|talk]] • [[Special:Contributions/68.4.155.26|contribs]]) ==Hey== So... do I owe you now? Richardkselby 21:03, 26 October 2006 (UTC) :Nope; I have no desire to have anyone pay me for anything. -[[User:Patstuart|Patstuart]][[User_talk:Patstuart|(talk)]][[Special:contributions/Patstuart|(contribs)]] 21:44, 26 October 2006 (UTC) == Thanks for your welcome, Jim == I greatly appreciate your art and effort[[User:Joanna eye spy|Joanna eye spy]] 21:55, 28 October 2006 (UTC) :Thank you, although my name is Pat. -[[User:Patstuart|Patstuart]][[User_talk:Patstuart|(talk)]][[Special:contributions/Patstuart|(contribs)]] 21:57, 28 October 2006 (UTC) I used to know a guy named Pat and we always called him Jim because he used to break into our house by "Jim"mying open my door. Sorry, about that[[User:Joanna eye spy|Joanna eye spy]] 22:04, 28 October 2006 (UTC) == A little (spammed) thank you == [[Image:Original Barnstar.png|frame|{{{align|left}}}|[[User_talk:Redvers|➨ ]][[User:Redvers|ЯEDVERS]] awards this Barnstar to '''Patstuart''' for reasoned, thoughtful production of ideas when asked for them in [[Wikipedia:Articles for deletion/Mahound|a debate]] that have helped me and others and have thus improved Wikipedia for everybody. Thank you.]]
:Thank you! -[[User:Patstuart|Patstuart]][[User_talk:Patstuart|(talk)]][[Special:contributions/Patstuart|(contribs)]] 21:37, 29 October 2006 (UTC) == Yeah, yeah == I guess I'd better get used to the [[Seattle Seahawks|Seahawks]] losing again. When your starting RB, QB and 3 of the 5 OL are out, it's not going to be a good year. Why couldn't the Steelers just let us have the trophy last year? It'll be another 20 years before we get there again... :) [[User:SkerHawx|SkerHawx]] 22:31, 29 October 2006 (UTC) == John Zarr == I did not create the article, I just added the db-bio template, just wanted to point that out. Keep up the great work! [[User:Bjweeks|BJ]] 02:47, 30 October 2006 (UTC) :I was a little confused, because I looked at the edit history, and only saw your name; but you are the one adding db-bio to articles. I guess there was some confusion; I apologize for the inconvenience. -[[User:Patstuart|Patstuart]][[User_talk:Patstuart|(talk)]][[Special:contributions/Patstuart|(contribs)]] 02:48, 30 October 2006 (UTC) ::Pat, now that you know the warning template was a mistake, you should also remove it or strike it out from [[User talk:Bjweeks]]. -- [[User:Jim Douglas|Jim Douglas]] [[User talk:Jim Douglas|(talk)]] [[Special:Contributions/Jim Douglas|(contribs)]] 02:53, 30 October 2006 (UTC) :*Feels sheepish* Of course :( [[User:Patstuart|Patstuart]][[User_talk:Patstuart|(talk)]][[Special:contributions/Patstuart|(contribs)]] 02:54, 30 October 2006 (UTC) ==[[Roswell, Georgia]]== Please see [[Wikipedia:Profanity]]. Thank you. --[[User:NE2|NE2]] 03:28, 30 October 2006 (UTC) :It says ''In original Wikipedia content, a profanity should either appear in its full form or not at all; words should never be bowdlerized by replacing letters in the word with dashes, asterisks, or other symbols.'' I guess you're right, then. -[[User:Patstuart|Patstuart]][[User_talk:Patstuart|(talk)]][[Special:contributions/Patstuart|(contribs)]] 03:30, 30 October 2006 (UTC) ==Vandalism== Mr Finishwinner has come to this wikipedia to vandalise [[Lucien Petit-Breton]] and Category: Breton Cyclists, and recognizes it on my discussion page.[[User:Shelley Konk|Shelley Konk]] 04:27, 30 October 2006 (UTC) :I've left a note on his talk page about the proper procedure for removing categories. :) -[[User:Patstuart|Patstuart]][[User_talk:Patstuart|(talk)]][[Special:contributions/Patstuart|(contribs)]] 04:41, 30 October 2006 (UTC) == My user page == I was just showing my buddy around Wikipedia :) [[User:Bjweeks|BJ]] 05:07, 30 October 2006 (UTC) :Gosh; I'm bound and determined to get on your bad side somehow tonight! Again, accept my humble apologies. -[[User:Patstuart|Patstuart]][[User_talk:Patstuart|(talk)]][[Special:contributions/Patstuart|(contribs)]] 05:09, 30 October 2006 (UTC) ::No problem, with the amount of vandalism fix your bound to make a few mistakes. Keep up the great work! :-) [[User:Bjweeks|BJ]] 05:13, 30 October 2006 (UTC) == Thank you for the Rv correction on [[Pope Benedict XVI]] == Thank you very much for making the correct revert on [[Pope Benedict XVI]]. I just can't stand vandals screwing up valuable information. I jumped the gun however in thinking he listed the incorrect University. Thank you for your patience.[[User:Persian Poet Gal|¤~Persian Poet Gal]] 05:08, 30 October 2006 (UTC) :No problem; I've been known to jump the gun a bit myself, something I'm trying to work on really hard. But it's understandable, as 75% of IP edits to articles of importance are vandal edits, or people just changing the facts to suit whatever their bias may be. -[[User:Patstuart|Patstuart]][[User_talk:Patstuart|(talk)]][[Special:contributions/Patstuart|(contribs)]] 05:12, 30 October 2006 (UTC) == Revertfesting. == Did you take a look at the [http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template:Horror_Icons&action=history edit history]? It is somewhat rediculous. [[image:smile.gif]] -- [[User:Avraham|Avi]] 05:30, 30 October 2006 (UTC) :I did, that was why it made me laugh so much. I was a little surprised FF7 would actually report the other guy when he was in such blatant violation himself. It's like two kids in the playground, both telling on each other for doing the same thing. -[[User:Patstuart|Patstuart]][[User_talk:Patstuart|(talk)]][[Special:contributions/Patstuart|(contribs)]] 05:32, 30 October 2006 (UTC) Re: Bignole: *[http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3AHorror_Icons&diff=84289973&oldid=84288778 15:57, October 28, 2006] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3AHorror_Icons&diff=84297773&oldid=84295935 16:45, October 28, 2006] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3AHorror_Icons&diff=84308575&oldid=84306552 17:51, October 28, 2006] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3AHorror_Icons&diff=84419117&oldid=84391318 09:57, October 29, 2006] ::Seems like he did. Earlier than the other two, but was caught in the fray, and contributed to it. Re: playground, maybe that's why they call it the [[WP:sandbox|sandbox]]? [[image:smile.png]] -- [[User:Avraham|Avi]] 05:36, 30 October 2006 (UTC) :Gosh, I didn't notice; prob wasn't as guilty as the others, but you're right. [[User:Patstuart|Patstuart]][[User_talk:Patstuart|(talk)]][[Special:contributions/Patstuart|(contribs)]] 05:37, 30 October 2006 (UTC)

revision.text: #redirect[[Ferdinand de Saussure]]

Some of the people, places or things you have written about {{#if:Thesquid|in the article [[Thesquid]]|on Wikipedia}} may not be sufficiently well-known to merit articles of their own. The Wikipedia community [[Wikipedia:welcome, newcomers|welcomes newcomers]], and encourages them to become [[Wikipedia:Wikipedians|Wikipedians]]. On Wikipedia, all users are entitled to a [[Wikipedia:user page|user page]] in which they can describe themselves, and this article's content may be incorporated into that page. However, to merit inclusion in the encyclopedia proper, a subject must be [[WP:BIO|notable]]. We encourage you to write or improve articles on notable subjects. <!-- Template:ConflictOfInterest --> -[[User:FisherQueen|FisherQueen]] 19:55, 30 October 2006 (UTC)

revision.text: Please do not add inappropriate external links to Wikipedia{{{{{subst|}}}#if:{{{1|}}}|, as you did in [[:{{{1}}}]]}}. [[Wikipedia:What Wikipedia is not#Wikipedia_is_not_a_directory|Wikipedia is not a mere directory of links]] nor should it be used for advertising or promotion. Inappropriate links include (but are not limited to) links to personal web sites, links to web sites with which you are affiliated, and links that exist to attract visitors to a web site or promote a product. See [[Wikipedia:External links|the external links guideline]] and [[Wikipedia:Spam|spam policies]] for further explanations of links that are considered appropriate. If you feel the link should be added to the article, then please discuss it on the article's talk page rather than re-adding it. See the [[Wikipedia:Welcome, newcomers|welcome page]] to learn more about Wikipedia. Thank you.<!-- Template:Spam --> [[User:Mwanner|Mwanner]] | [[User talk:Mwanner|Talk]] 19:56, 30 October 2006 (UTC) <br clear="both">

{{Use dmy dates|date=March 2018}} {|{{Infobox ship begin}} {{Infobox ship image |Ship image= |Ship caption=Destroyer ''Ierax'' }} {{Infobox ship career |Hide header= |Ship country=Greece |Ship flag={{shipboxflag|Greece|royalnavy}} |Ship name=''Ierax'' (ΒΠ ''Ιέραξ'') |Ship namesake=[[hawk]] |Ship ordered=1912 |Ship builder=[[Cammell Laird]], [[Birkenhead]] |Ship laid down=1911 |Ship launched=15 March 1911 |Ship acquired= |Ship commissioned=1912 |Ship decommissioned=1946 |Ship in service= |Ship out of service= |Ship struck= |Ship reinstated= |Ship honours= |Ship fate=broken up |Ship status= |Ship notes= }} {{Infobox ship characteristics |Hide header= |Header caption= |Ship class={{sclass2-|Wild Beast|destroyer}} |Ship displacement=880 tons standard |Ship length={{convert|89.4|m|ft|abbr=on}} |Ship beam={{convert|8.3|m|ft|abbr=on}} |Ship draft={{convert|3|m|ft|abbr=on}} |Ship propulsion=*5 × Foster Wheeler boilers (4 coal-fired and 1 oil-fired), replaced by Yarrow oil-fired boilers in 1925 *5 funnels *combined Parsons and Curtis [[steam turbine]]s |Ship speed={{convert|31|kn|km/h}} maximum ({{convert|32|kn|km/h}} after 1925) |Ship range= |Ship complement=58 |Ship sensors= |Ship EW= |Ship armament=*'''As completed:''' *4 × [[EOC 4 inch 50 caliber|{{convert|4|in|mm|sp=us|abbr=on}}]]/50 guns *1 × [[QF 12-pounder 12 cwt naval gun|{{convert|3|in|mm|sp=us|abbr=on}}]] [[Anti-aircraft warfare|anti-aircraft]] gun *6 × {{convert|21|in|mm|0|adj=on}} [[torpedo tube]]s *3 × electric search lights *'''1925:''' *76.2 mm gun removed *37 mm anti-aircraft gun added *four-barrel [[QF 2-pounder naval gun|{{convert|40|mm|in|sp=us|abbr=on}}]] gun added *2 mortars added *Modified for laying 40 [[Naval mine|mines]] *'''1942:''' *3rd and 4th stern torpedo launchers removed *1 × {{convert|3|in|mm|0|adj=on}} anti-aircraft gun added *1 × [[Oerlikon 20 mm cannon|20 mm Oerlikon gun]] added *A/S type 123A detection device added |Ship armor= |Ship aircraft= |Ship notes= }} |}
'''''Ierax''''' ({{lang-el|ΒΠ}} {{lang|el|Ιέραξ|italic=yes}}, "Hawk") was a {{sclass2-|Wild Beast|destroyer}} which served in the Hellenic Royal Navy from 1912–1946.
== Origin == The ship, along with her three [[sister ship]]s {{ship|Greek destroyer|Aetos||2}}, {{ship|Greek destroyer|Panthir||2}} and {{ship|Greek destroyer|Leon||2}}, was ordered from [[England]]. They were purchased in 1912, ready for delivery, each for the sum of £148,000 from the English shipyards [[Cammell Laird]] in [[Birkenhead]], when the [[Balkan Wars]] seemed likely. These ships had originally been ordered by Argentina; ''Ierax'' was originally named ''Santa Fé''. ''Ierax'' was accepted by Captain Ath. Miaoulis, RHN in [[Palermo]], [[Sicily]]. where she arrived manned by foreign crew.
==Service history== During the Balkan Wars, the Royal Hellenic Navy purchased only the minimum amount of ammunitions, 3,000 rounds of torpedoes. Torpedoes were not available for this class of ship, and for this reason these ships were initially named 'scouts' rather than 'destroyers'. On October 21, 1912, under the command of Commander A. Vratsanos, RHN, ''Ierax'' was part of the Greek flotilla that captured the island of [[Psara]] from the [[Ottoman Empire|Ottomans]].<ref>[http://www.hellenicnavy.gr/ierax12_46_en.asp HELLENIC NAVY - IERAX D-36 (1912-1946)<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref>
During [[World War I]], Greece belatedly entered the war on the side of the [[Triple Entente]] and, due to Greece's neutrality the four Beast Class ships were seized by the Allies in October, 1916, taken over by the French in November, and served in the [[French Navy]] from 1917-18. By 1918, they were back on escort duty under Greek colors, mainly in the [[Aegean Sea]].
''Ierax'' participated in the evacuation of Greeks from Russia during the [[Russian Civil War]] in 1918, and saw action in the [[Greco-Turkish War (1919-1922)]] in the [[Sea of Marmara]] and the [[Aegean Sea]].
After the war, ''Ierax'' was refurbished from 1925–1927. She also participated in the [[Second World War]], after surviving the German invasion of April, 1941, ''Ierax'' was based in [[Alexandria, Egypt]]. In April, 1944, a wave of mutiny swept through some of the Hellenic Royal Navy, with seamen agitating in favor of the pro-[[Communist]] guerillas, [[Ellinikos Laïkos Apeleftherotikos Stratos|ELAS]], who were fighting a campaign in Greece against the occupying [[Nazis]]. ''Ierax'' was one of the ships whose crew mutinied and the mutiny was put down in the early morning hours of April 22, 1944.<ref>Vice Admiral G. Mezeviris, "Four Decades in the Service of the Royal Hellenic Navy", Athens, 1971.</ref>
After the end of World War II, ''Ierax'' was stricken (decommissioned) in 1946.
==See also== * [[History of the Hellenic Navy]]
==References== {{reflist}}

revision.text: {{WikiProject Czech Republic|class=Start|importance=Top}} {{WikiProject Politics|class=start|importance=high}} == Composition of the Czech Senate after the 2006 elections == I have updated the table of the Senate election results, as the ones given were still those of the 2004 elections. Now it has the results of the October 2006 elections. However, the Wiki page "Senate of the Czech Republic" still needs to be updated. Also, the Wiki page "Elections in the Czech Republic" (I see now that I finished here), reproduces this table and did already have an update, be it with a slightly different wording, and with a different source link. It would be good if any change in one would automatically appear in the other too - if anyone knows how to do that? [[User:No-itsme|No-itsme]] 19:57, 30 October 2006 (UTC) OK, it turned out I initially made a big mistake. Spotting that this page still had the 2004 Senate composition, I had proceeded to update ''the template'' that was linked in on this page - the template for the 2004 elections, that is - instead of just replacing it with the "Senate election, 2006" template, which did in fact already turn out to exist (that was the one already featured on the Wiki page "Elections in the Czech Republic"). That's solved now: I reverted those changes to the 2004 template, and on this page replaced that template with the 2006 one. I also updated the 2006 template with data from the Czech Statistical Office; and I inserted that table on the Wiki page "Senate of the Czech Republic" as well. So all should be well now.. [[User:No-itsme|No-itsme]] 21:27, 30 October 2006 (UTC) == Important notice == The [[Outline of the Czech Republic#Government and politics of the Czech Republic|government section of the "Outline of the Czech Republic"]] needs to be checked, corrected, and completed -- ''especially the subsections for the government branches''. When the country outlines were created, temporary data (that matched most of the countries but not all) was used to speed up the process. Those countries for which the temporary data does not match must be replaced with the correct information. Please check that this country's outline is not in error. If you have any questions or comments, please contact [[User talk:The Transhumanist|The Transhumanist]] . Thank you. — Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[User:The Transhumanist|The Transhumanist]] ([[User talk:The Transhumanist|talk]] • [[Special:Contributions/The Transhumanist|contribs]]) — Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|undated]] comment added 03:37, 12 December 2011‎ == Government description incomplete == came to the page to understand administrative divisions- since redirected from "Czech government" which is distinctly different from "politics". This isn't covered here, so either needs expansion or separate site.--[[User:Wuerzele|Wuerzele]] ([[User talk:Wuerzele|talk]]) 21:31, 23 January 2015 (UTC) == External links modified == Hello fellow Wikipedians, I have just modified 4 external links on [[Politics of the Czech Republic]]. Please take a moment to review [[special:diff/816453007|my edit]]. If you have any questions, or need the bot to ignore the links, or the page altogether, please visit [[User:Cyberpower678/FaQs#InternetArchiveBot|this simple FaQ]] for additional information. I made the following changes: *Added archive https://web.archive.org/web/20081220003426/http://www.hrad.cz/en/ustava_cr/index.shtml to http://www.hrad.cz/en/ustava_cr/index.shtml *Added archive https://web.archive.org/web/20060718023209/http://www.praguemonitor.com/czech-election-2006/ to http://www.praguemonitor.com/czech-election-2006/ *Added archive https://web.archive.org/web/20060702103322/http://www.ku.edu/%7Eherron/ to http://www.ku.edu/~herron/ *Added archive https://web.archive.org/web/20081210080250/https://www.cia.gov/library/publications/world-leaders-1/world-leaders-c/czech-republic.html to https://www.cia.gov/library/publications/world-leaders-1/world-leaders-c/czech-republic.html When you have finished reviewing my changes, you may follow the instructions on the template below to fix any issues with the URLs. {{sourcecheck|checked=false|needhelp=}} Cheers.—[[User:InternetArchiveBot|'''InternetArchiveBot''']] ([[User talk:InternetArchiveBot|Report bug]]) 12:30, 21 December 2017 (UTC)

==[[:Berezka.net]]== A tag has been placed on [[:Berezka.net]], requesting that it be speedily deleted from Wikipedia. This has been done because it is an article about a certain web site, blog, forum, or other community of web users that does not assert the importance or significance of that web location. If you plan to provide more notable material to the article, I advise you to do so immediately, and also put a note on [[Talk:Berezka.net]]. An administrator should check for such edits before deleting the article. Feel free to leave a note on my talk page if you have any questions about this. Please read our criteria for speedy deletion, particularly item 1 under Articles. Please note that articles must be on notable subjects and should provide references to reliable sources which verify their content. Please do not remove the speedy deletion tag yourself. To contest the tagging and request that administrators wait a while for you to add contextual material, please affix the template {{tl|hangon}} to the page, and then immediately add such material.-- [[User:Omicronpersei8|Omicronpersei8]] ([[User talk:Omicronpersei8|talk]]) 20:08, 30 October 2006 (UTC)

Hi! I hate to do this, but I put up [[Katisha]] for deletion, since it's probably easier to understand the plot if not just from her perspective, and, as she doesn't appear in any other operas, it's hard to see how it could be expanded further (also, it's a little bit too enthusiastic, perhaps: I agree she's a great character, but it's an odd tone for an encyclopeda).
However, I don't mean to put you off: Could I invite you into [[Wikipedia:WikiProject Gilbert and Sullivan]]? [[User:Adam Cuerden|Adam Cuerden]] <sup>[[User_talk:Adam Cuerden|talk]]</sup> 19:57, 30 October 2006 (UTC)
