==Edit summary== My edit summary for my recent edit was cut off due to bumping the enter key while typing it in. It should be: "Fixing height/weight. When rounding, 138.636363.... should be rounded up to 139 kg, not down to 138 kg." [[User:Darryl Hamlin|Darryl Hamlin]] 19:25, 11 September 2006 (UTC)
== Undertake and making appearances on other shows == How come the Undertaker never appears on the Late Night Show, Conan, Saturday Night Live, etc. like a lot of the other Main Event wrestlers sometimes do?
It doesn't fit his character. For sure part of the reason why his character excels in longetivity. - Dave
Why doesn't it fit his career? Wouldn't more people come to know him and he would get more popular, like Hulk Hogan did. I mean, I've seen Randy Orton on one of those late night talk shows and his career hasn't gone on nearly as long as the Undertaker's. Why can't the lights go out on the late night show, smoke arise, the Undertaker brings the lights back. And it could be real funny. that guy with the big-ass chin is really scared as he is asking Taker questions. He doesn't understand a word the Undertaker is saying because Undertaker's like "For life has no purpose without the dawning of the dead. They whome fear do not seek the eyes of those" and stuff. And J Leno is just like "whaaaaaaat? uhhh yeeaaaa' I mean, it could be so hilarious. Why hasn't Taker done this? frankly, I just think he hasn't thought of this idea before. It could be similar to what the Ultimate Warrior did on R Cineo Hall or however you spell it [[User:TareTone|TareTone]] 04:31, 13 September 2006 (UTC)
:Two points, TareTone. One, it might fit his career, but it wouldn't fit his '''character'''. The Deadman gimmick doesn't work with going on Leno. Two, it's spelled Arsenio Hall. -[[User:Darryl Hamlin|Darryl Hamlin]] 21:33, 13 September 2006 (UTC)
:judging from the pretty ignorant comments, Taretone is either 15 or a troll. And FYI, Undertaker has done a few talkshow appearances in his first 2 years of his WWE career. The fact that he 'doesn't do talkshows' has the same reason as why you won't see him during tribute shows. The WWE protects his image like a mother lion her cubs. For a character that has risen repeatedly from the death, who can let lightning strike (..) talkshow appearances just don't work. Apart from that, I doubt if Calaway seeks more popularity, he is rather to himself contrary to Hogan. Not to mention that the man is hugely popular already, talkshows won't help that one bit. [[User:84.81.226.215|84.81.226.215]] 20:23, 14 September 2006 (UTC)Marcello
I am not going to respond or acknowledge the post above mine because I don't like that user. Anyway, Darryl, I just gave you a great thing that Undertaker could do if he went on the Late Night Show. I think he might have done that throughout the 90s but didn't think of that idea. Ultimate Warrior did it even though character didn't fit the Arsenio Hall. Thank you for the spelling by the way. [[User:TareTone|TareTone]] 04:27, 15 September 2006 (UTC)
:The thing is, the WWE is '''very''' protective of the characters of Kane and the Undertaker, to the point where Glen Jacobs had to be in character to an extent on the set of See No Evil, and that neither of them has ever been on tribute shows. -[[User:Darryl Hamlin|Darryl Hamlin]] 06:55, 17 September 2006 (UTC)
The Undertaker gimmick is already hugely popular, crowds love seeing Taker in action he doesn't need to enhance his image by appearing on talk shows. The whole fact you don't see Taker at every show really adds to the whole mystic of the gimmick, TareTone haven't you ever heard the expression "less is more"? [[User:Night_Bringer|Night Bringer]] 23:11, 20 September 2006 (GMT +10).
== Quality of this Wiki ==
Needless to say that not only the annoying fanboy additions, but also the relentless trimming of the article have resulted in a serious decline in quality. Relevant information is left out. If you decide to trim text, have the courtesy to first run things past the rest here at
I don't know what this is about exactly, but you aren't being very polite about it. Your sentence isn't finished and you didn't bother to right your name afterward. I suggest you read some wikipedia rules [[User:TareTone|TareTone]] 04:51, 13 September 2006 (UTC)
== Photos ==
I think that more photos should be added to this section. [[User:Son of Kong|Son of Kong]]
==1991 Survivor Series== The Undertaker that participated at the 1991 Survivor Series looks different from the one after 1994 summerslam with Ted DiBiase's Undertaker vs. Paul Bearer's Undertaker. I have absolutely no proof that they are different people. But can anyone comfirm that it's the same person? [[User:Kingjeff|Kingjeff]] 06:07, 25 September 2006 (UTC)
:I can guarantee you that there has been only one person 'using' the Undertaker gimmick, and that is Mark Calaway. Keep in mind that aging and a new look/outfit and haircut can do a lot to ones appearance. Already the undertaker that lost the casket match against Yokozuna looks different from a 'green' Calaway starting out in the main event WWF. [[User:211.136.7.178|211.136.7.178]] 12:00, 28 September 2006 (UTC) Jim

revision.text:
{{nobots}} {{align|right|{{User physician}}
{{Master Editor Userbox}} }} __TOC__ ==User description== [[File:Mikael Häggström at Wikimania 2016 (cropped).jpg|thumb|Mikael Häggström at [[Wikimania 2016]].]] Mikael Häggström is a [[Doctor of Medicine]]. He graduated from [[Uppsala University Faculty of Medicine|Uppsala University, Faculty of Medicine]] in 2013. He is currently working as a physician under [[Specialty_(medicine)#Training|specialist training]] in [[radiology]] at the [[NU Hospital Group]], [[Sweden]]. He was born in [[Gothenburg]], and grew up in nearby [[Uddevalla]] by the coast. He decided to become a doctor while [[backpacking]] for half a year in 2005, taking the [[Trans-Siberian Railway|Trans-Siberian train]] to [[China]] and crossing the [[Himalayas]] from [[Tibet]] to [[Nepal]]. He has contributed to Wikipedia since 2006. He is the creator and editor-in-chief of [[Wikiversity:WikiJournal of Medicine|WikiJournal of Medicine]], a new Wikipedia-integrated, peer-reviewed, [[open-access]] academic journal.{{cite web|last1=Masukume|first1=Gwinyai|last2=Heilman|first2=James|last3=Häggström|first3=Mikael|title=Why getting medical information from Wikipedia isn’t always a bad idea|url=http://theconversation.com/why-getting-medical-information-from-wikipedia-isnt-always-a-bad-idea-59708|website=[[The Conversation (website)|The Conversation]]|accessdate=26 May 2016|date=24 May 2016}} ==Publication of images== ===Attribution=== For editors wanting to know what [[Attribution (copyright)|attribution]] to use when including one of my pictures in a work, essentially all my images up to 2014 are included in [[Wikiversity:WikiJournal of Medicine/Medical gallery of Mikael Häggström 2014|an image collection]] which may be attributed as: *Häggström, M (2014). "[https://en.wikiversity.org/wiki/WikiJournal_of_Medicine/Medical_gallery_of_Mikael_H%C3%A4ggstr%C3%B6m_2014 Medical gallery of Mikael Häggström 2014]". ''WikiJournal of Medicine'' 1 (2). [https://doi.org/10.15347/wjm/2014.008 doi:10.15347/wjm/2014.008]. ISSN 2002-4436. [https://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/deed.en Creative Commons CC0 1.0 Universal Public Domain Dedication]. Used with permission. or *''By Mikael Häggström, used with permission.'' Later images as well as collaboarations can be reached at: [[User:Mikael Häggström/Gallery]], with attributions described at that page. If the license (as given under the "Licensing" section of the image description page) has "[[share-alike]]" in its name, then a license description should be included in the attribution as well, such as "''released under the Attribution-Share Alike 3.0 Unported license''". If there the image description mentions several authors, an addition such as "''Created by [other image author(s)] and Mikael Häggström, MD''". ===High resolution versions=== The image version of highest resolution is generally found by clicking the "Full resolution" link, located below the image on its description page. ==Contributions== I am now most active in [[Wikiversity]], as editor-in-chief of [[Wikiversity:Wikiversity Journal of Medicine/About|Wikiversity Journal of Medicine]]. In Wikipedia, I frequently add [[medical imaging|radiologic images]] (with written consent from the subjects), and I often correct or add to the prose of articles. *[https://tools.wmflabs.org/supercount/index.php?user=Mikael+H%C3%A4ggstr%C3%B6m&project=en.wikipedia Edit counts and user rights (according to Wikimedia Tool Labs)] ===Pictures=== {{for|more examples|User:Mikael Häggström/Gallery}} I use [[Inkscape]], [[GIMP]] and [[Paint (software)|MS Paint]] to create images. ====My featured pictures==== Image:Computed tomography of human brain - large.png|[[Computed tomography]] of [[human brain]], from [[base of the skull]] to top. File:Steroidogenesis.svg|Human [[steroidogenesis]] File:Basal ganglia circuits.svg|Main circuits of the [[basal ganglia]] {{wide image|Blood values sorted by mass and molar concentration.png|1200px}} ====Photographs by me==== File:Tibetan equestrian.JPG|Young Tibetan [[equestrianism|equestrian]]. File:Beggars at Drepung Monastery.png|Two women at Drepung Monastery, Tibet, wearing U-Tsang [[chuba]]s. File:Drepung Monastery.png|Monks at the entrance to the Prayer Hall of [[Drepung Monastery]]. File:Kathmandu from Monkey Temple.png|[[Kathmandu]], viewed from the [[Swayambhunath]] Temple File:Midsommar_på_Årsnäs.png|[[Midsummer]] celebrations at Årsnäs, Sweden ====Some other pictures==== File:Glycogen structure.svg|[[Glycogen]] structure File:Hematopoiesis simple.png|[[Hematopoiesis]] File:Relations of the aorta, trachea, esophagus and other heart structures.png|Relations of the [[aorta]], [[vertebrate trachea|trachea]], [[esophagus]] and other heart structures. File:Spinal cord tracts - English.svg|Tracts of the [[spinal cord]] File:External carotid artery.png|(labeled) Branches of [[external carotid artery]] File:Side effects of nicotine.svg|Side effects of [[nicotine]] File:Thyroid hormone synthesis.png|[[Thyroid hormone]] synthesis File:3D CT of thorax, annotated.jpg|[[Pulmonary circulation]] File:Movements at gestational age of 9 weeks.gif|[[Fetal movements|Movements]] at a [[gestational age]] of 9 weeks ===Articles=== 1629 articles created as per July 2017, exluding [[Wikipedia:Redirect|redirects]], for example: *[[Reference ranges for blood tests]] (more than 90% of the text and numbers, and all the images) *[http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Table_of_muscles_of_the_human_body&oldid=164285131 Table of muscles of the human body] *[[Pathogenic bacteria]] *[[Childhood cancer]] ''Entire list can be viewed at: [https://tools.wmflabs.org/sigma/created.py?name=Mikael+H%C3%A4ggstr%C3%B6m&server=enwiki&max=500&startdate=&ns=&redirects=none List of article creations]'' ==Accounts on sister projects== {| class="wikitable" ! Project !! Username |- | Wikipedia | '''w:User:Mikael Häggström''' |- | Wiktionary | [[wikt:User:Mikael Häggström]] |- | Wikibooks | [[b:User:Mikael Häggström]] |- | Wikiquote | [[q:User:Mikael Häggström]] |- | Wikisource | [[s:User:Mikael Häggström]] |- | Wikiversity | [[v:User:Mikael Häggström]] |- | Wikimedia Commons | [[commons:User:Mikael Häggström]] |- | Metawiki | [[meta:User:Mikael Häggström]] |- | wikimediastrategy | [[strategy:User:Mikael Häggström]] |} {{Babel|sv|en-4|de-1}} ==Edit summary terminology== In my [[Help:Edit summary|edit summaries]], '''+''' means "addition of ..." and '''–''' (a [[dash]]) means "removal of ...". For verbs that may not be found in a standard dictionary, those ending with the past tense suffix '''-ed''' should correlate with a common noun or verb after removal of that suffix. Similarly, a prefix of '''de-''' should mean an opposite, a negation or a removal of whatever verb follows. For still incomprehensible terminology, please notify me on [[User_talk:Mikael_H%C3%A4ggstr%C3%B6m|talk page]]. ==Contact== *[http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=User_talk:Mikael_H%C3%A4ggstr%C3%B6m&action=edit§ion=new My talk page] ==See also== *[https://www.linkedin.com/in/drhaggstrom LinkedIn page] *[[User:Mikael Häggström/Why I'm a Wikipedian]] *[[User:Mikael Häggström/Funny edits]] *[http://sv.wikipedia.org/wiki/Användare:Mikael_Häggström Swedish account] ==Footnotes and links== {{Authority control|ORCID=0000-0002-2732-7631}} [[da:User:Mikael Häggström]] [[de:Benutzer:Mikael Häggström]] [[sv:Användare:Mikael Häggström]]

revision.text:
{| class="wikitable" |- | rowspan="1" | <center>Hello</center> <center>Bonjour</center> <center>Buenos días</center> |- | rowspan="1" | <center><font size=4>{{PAGENAME}}</font></center>
<center>and...</center> |- | rowspan="1" | <center>Welcome</center> <center>Bienvenue</center> <center>Bienvenido/Bienvenida</center> |- | colspan="3" | <center><font size=5>to [[Wikipedia]], the free encyclopedia!</font></center> |- | colspan="3" | Wikipedia is a free-content encyclopedia [[m:List of Wikipedias|written in 250 languages]] by thousands of users like you and me from all walks of life. As a member of the [[WP:Wc|Welcoming Committee]], I would like to say thanks for being a part of this project.
Here are some links to help you, the new user, on your Wikipedia journey:
*[[Wikipedia:Introduction|Introduction]] *[[Wikipedia:Sandbox|Sandbox]] *[[Help:Editing|Editing a page]] *[[Wikipedia:Bootcamp|Bootcamp]] *[[Wikipedia:Manual of Style|Manual of Style]] *[[Wikipedia:Five pillars|Five pillars]]
Whether you're new to the project or have helped us for a while, remember to use [[Help:Edit summary|edit summaries]] when you're done with a page. Summaries are important because, with those, other editors will understand what you have done with the content. '''REMEMBER''': think twice before clicking "'''Save page'''" below the editing box, since whatever you write in the summary box will permamently go in the [[Help:Page history|history of any page]]. (Spellchecking is important; you cannot change the summary data after you have finished editing.)
Remember, also, to sign your name with four tildes (<nowiki>~~~~</nowiki>) or by pressing this button ([[Image:Button sig2.png|Signature button]]) above the box, whenever leaving comments on [[Wikipedia:Talk page|talk pages]].
If you want to know how you're doing on Wikipedia, feel free to check out [[Special:Contributions/Ilikevideogames|your list of contributions]].
If you don't know how to do something, type <nowiki>{{helpme}}</nowiki> on your talk page, and [[Wikipedia:Administrators|administrators]] will come to solve your problems.
After you've stayed here for a while, you might want to take an [[Wikipedia:Editor review|editor review]], or, even better, take a chance at [[Wikipedia:Requests for adminship|adminship]].
Wherever the journey takes you, I wish you the best of luck and respect on Wikipedia. If you have any questions about my expertise or this site, you can [[Special:Emailuser/Slgrandson|e-mail me]] or [[User talk:Slgrandson|talk to me]], and I will see about the situation as best as possible.
In the meantime, happy editing!
<div style="text-align: right;">Slgr<font color="#228B22">[[Wikipedia:Esperanza|@]]</font>ndson <small>([[User:Slgrandson|page]] - [[User talk:Slgrandson|messages]] - [[Special:Contributions/Slgrandson|contribs]])</small> 20:04, 30 October 2006 (UTC)<div> |}

revision.text: {{WikiProject Veterinary medicine |class=C |importance=Low}} {{WikiProject Animals |class=C |importance=mid}} ==Ecological Role== [[User:Zebadiahjones|Zebadiahjones]] ([[User talk:Zebadiahjones|talk]]) 23:27, 17 February 2008 (UTC) I know this isn't very important, but that whole "ecological role" part sounds ridiculous. References would be nice. My old merck vet manual was a lot more helpful than this. Planning on deleting the ecological role if it stays like it is. :*That's a legitimate objection. I'm trying to find some sources to substantiate it. Heck, some sources for ANYTHING. This whole article is on a well-documented organism, but inexplicably sourceless. I'd freely encourage you or anyone else to feel free to axe that section if nobody (including me) succeeds at sourcing it. Might be [[WP:Original research|OR]]. - [[User:Vianello|Vianello]] ([[User talk:Vianello|talk]]) 20:37, 3 July 2008 (UTC) On a related side-note, the word "avoid" was changed to "are kept away from" in this section. I'm not sure it's clear which meaning is intended, though. Do cattle instinctively avoid it, or are they logically kept from it by keepers? The section doesn't really make it clear whether the original sense or the new one is correct. - [[User:Vianello|Vianello]] ([[User talk:Vianello|talk]]) 08:36, 10 July 2008 (UTC) ===Removal=== I've gone ahead and axed this section, which has continued to go unsourced. Here's an archival copy for in case sources are found, so we can re-add it: ---- The lancet flukes are important to [[grassland]]s. To prevent infestation, cattle are kept away from patches of the greenest grass, which has been fertilized by [[manure]]. The danger for them is not the feces itself, but rather the possibility that tiny ants might be at the tops of the blades, carrying the parasite. Therefore, those patches grow undisturbed as cows feed on the remaining grass, which is not enough for all of them. The cows are then forced to eat the green grass, and for a while the cow population rises. Eventually, the parasites infect the cows. Infected cows eat less and fail to reproduce as frequently. The cow population drops, allowing the grass to regrow. The cow population eventually recovers and returns to being wary of the greenest grass, completing the cycle. ---- ---- ---- == 5th ref (to CUP) == ...is gone from the web. I cannot find this anywhere. Just reporting. [[User:Vinne2|Vinne2]] ([[User talk:Vinne2|talk]]) 08:48, 20 February 2012 (UTC) == External links modified == Hello fellow Wikipedians, I have just modified {{plural:1|one external link|1 external links}} on [[Dicrocoelium dendriticum]]. Please take a moment to review [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?diff=prev&oldid=754447049 my edit]. If you have any questions, or need the bot to ignore the links, or the page altogether, please visit [[User:Cyberpower678/FaQs#InternetArchiveBot|this simple FaQ]] for additional information. I made the following changes: *Added archive https://web.archive.org/web/20080820210738/http://workforce.cup.edu/Buckelew/dicrocoelium_dendriticum_is_a_bi.htm to http://workforce.cup.edu/Buckelew/dicrocoelium_dendriticum_is_a_bi.htm When you have finished reviewing my changes, please set the ''checked'' parameter below to '''true''' or '''failed''' to let others know (documentation at {{tlx|Sourcecheck}}). {{sourcecheck|checked=false}} Cheers.—[[User:InternetArchiveBot|'''InternetArchiveBot''']] ([[User talk:InternetArchiveBot|Report bug]]) 18:28, 12 December 2016 (UTC)

page.title: Wikipedia:Articles for deletion/The World of Torr

revision.text: :''The following discussion is an archived debate of the proposed deletion of the article below. '''Please do not modify it.''' Subsequent comments should be made on the appropriate discussion page (such as the article's talk page or in a [[Wikipedia:Deletion review|deletion review]]). No further edits should be made to this page. '' The result was '''delete'''. - [[User:Bobet|Bobet]] 21:19, 7 November 2006 (UTC) ===[[The World of Torr]]=== Non-notable mod software for a videogame. Doesn't meet [[WP:SOFTWARE]]. Wikipedia is [[WP:NOT|not]] for stuff you made one day. My vote is '''Delete'''. [[User:Ju66l3r|ju66l3r]] 20:05, 30 October 2006 (UTC) * Note: This debate has been added to the [[Wikipedia:WikiProject Computer and video games/Deletion|list of CVG deletions]]. -- [[User:Moeron|''moe.'']]'''[[moe.|RON]]''' [[User talk:Moeron|'''''Let's talk''''']] | [[Special:Contributions/Moeron|'''''done'']] 01:16, 31 October 2006 (UTC) *'''Strong Delete''' - An awfully written article. Pure vanity and advertising. Possible notability with the Hall of Fame, but without a legitimate source for that information it's so much hot air. [[User:The Kinslayer|The Kinslayer]] 10:44, 31 October 2006 (UTC) * NWN: World of Torr accepts donations in violation of the Bioware's EULA and brags about the $2000 its raised since inception on their website. Bioware has consistently pressed legal action against any server that accepts money to play. Some sites have tried to skirt this by taking payment as "donations" but this is covered under their "exploit commercially" clause. They've notably kept off the main Bioware forums possibly to escape censure from the company. I've quoted the EULA on the discussion page for that article. This looks like wikitizing for their server and if the end up getting money then this is oh so much spam.~LD — Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[User:12.152.181.251|12.152.181.251]] ([[User talk:12.152.181.251|talk]] • [[Special:Contributions/12.152.181.251|contribs]]) *'''Delete'''. The controversial portion, if verified, might warrant a mention in the [[Neverwinter Nights]] article, but otherwise this mod doesn't seem particularly notable. --[[User:Alan Au|Alan Au]] 22:52, 5 November 2006 (UTC) *'''Delete'''. As above. —[[User:Wrathchild-K|Wrathchild]] ([[User talk:Wrathchild-K|talk]]) 16:38, 7 November 2006 (UTC) :''The above discussion is preserved as an archive of the debate. '''Please do not modify it.''' Subsequent comments should be made on the appropriate discussion page (such as the article's talk page or in a [[Wikipedia:Deletion review|deletion review]]). No further edits should be made to this page.

revision.text:
==Welcome to Wikipedia!!!== {| style="border-spacing:8px;margin:0px -8px" width="100%" |class="MainPageBG" style="width: 55%; border:1px solid #084080; background-color:#F5FFFA; vertical-align:top;color:#000000;font-size: 85%"| {| width="100%" cellpadding="2" cellspacing="5" style="vertical-align:top; background-color:#F5FFFA" !
Hello Arcette! [[Wikipedia:Welcome, newcomers|Welcome]] to Wikipedia! Thank you for [[Special:Contributions/Arcette|your contributions]]. If you decide that you need help, check out [[Wikipedia:Where to ask a question]], ask me on my talk page, or place '''{{helpme}}''' on your talk page and someone will show up shortly to answer your questions. Please remember to [[Wikipedia:Sign your posts on talk pages|sign your name]] on talk pages using four tildes (~~~~); this will automatically produce your name and the date. You may also push the signature button [[Image:Button sig2.png]] located above the edit window. Finally, please do your best to '''always fill in the [[Help:Edit summary|edit summary]] field'''. This is considered an important guideline in Wikipedia. Even a short summary is better than no summary. Below are some recommended guidelines to facilitate your involvement. Happy Editing! -- Slgr[[Wikipedia:Esperanza|@]]ndson ([[User:Slgrandson|page]] - [[User talk:Slgrandson|messages]] - [[Special:Contributions/Slgrandson|contribs]]) 20:05, 30 October 2006 (UTC) |} {| style="border-spacing:8px;margin:0px -8px" width="100%" |class="MainPageBG" style="width: 55%; border:1px solid #FFFFFF; background-color:#F5FFFA; vertical-align:top"| {| width="100%" cellpadding="2" cellspacing="5" style="vertical-align:top; background-color:#F5FFFA" !
Getting Started

revision.text:
{{WikiProjectBannerShell|collapsed=No|1= {{WikiProject Companies|class=Start|importance=Low}} {{WikiProject Switzerland|class=Start|importance=Low}} {{WikiProject Watches|class=Start}} }} ==Untitled== Not sure how much creditability there is in the last paragraph. ETA movements are used in high-end watchs, such as Omega, Breitling, etc...ETA. In fact, being that Omega is owned by Swatch as well as ETA...stands to reason that they would use ETA movement. Just an odd commentary. —Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[User:65.104.118.90|65.104.118.90]] ([[User talk:65.104.118.90|talk]] • [[Special:Contributions/65.104.118.90|contribs]]) 22:06, 30 October 2006 REPLY: Actually many non Swatch brands use ETA 2892.A2 movements (and 775X movements) in their high end watches. Bretiling is one, but if you look at the following link, you will find many. http://www.orbita.net/pages/17101.htm —Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[User:Jimr18|Jimr18]] ([[User talk:Jimr18|talk]] • [[Special:Contributions/Jimr18|contribs]]) 18:29, 18 March 2007 Added: Since you are approaching this from a business/economics POV, this should be of interest: http://today.reuters.com/news/articleinvesting.aspx?type=marketsNews&storyID=2007-03-19T101307Z_01_L19171676_RTRIDST_0_SWATCH-RESULTS-UPDATE-3.XML&pageNumber=0&imageid=&cap=&sz=13&WTModLoc=InvArt-C1-ArticlePage3 —Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[User:Jimr18|Jimr18]] ([[User talk:Jimr18|talk]] • [[Special:Contributions/Jimr18|contribs]]) 12:20, 21 March 2007 ==Elegance, Technology and Accuracy== ETA does not stand for "Elegance, Technology and Accuracy" or anything else, I have therefore removed the reference.[[Special:Contributions/202.131.190.96|202.131.190.96]] ([[User talk:202.131.190.96|talk]]) 00:13, 13 December 2007 (UTC) You may be correct but if you go here: http://www.eta.ch/ and allow the "flash" to play you may be surprized. [[User:Luger229|Luger229]] ([[User talk:Luger229|talk]]) 23:38, 14 December 2007 (UTC) ==Fair use rationale for Image:ETA.SA Logo.JPG== [[Image:Nuvola apps important.svg|70px|left]] '''[[:Image:ETA.SA Logo.JPG]]''' is being used on this article. I notice the image page specifies that the image is being used under [[Wikipedia:Fair use|fair use]] but there is no [[Wikipedia:Fair use rationale guideline|explanation or rationale]] as to why its use in '''this''' Wikipedia article constitutes fair use. In addition to the [[Wikipedia:Image copyright tags/Fair use|boilerplate fair use template]], you must also write out on the image description page a specific explanation or rationale for why using this image in each article is consistent with [[WP:FU|fair use]]. Please go to [[:Image:ETA.SA Logo.JPG|the image description page]] and edit it to include a [[Wikipedia:Fair use rationale guideline |fair use rationale]]. Using one of the templates at [[Wikipedia:Fair use rationale guideline]] is an easy way to insure that your image is in compliance with Wikipedia policy, but remember that you must complete the template. Do not simply insert a blank template on an image page. If there is other fair use media, consider checking that you have specified the fair use rationale on the other images used on this page. Note that any fair use images uploaded after 4 May, 2006, and lacking such an explanation will be deleted one week after they have been uploaded, as described on [[Wikipedia:Criteria for speedy deletion#Images.2FMedia|criteria for speedy deletion]]. If you have any questions please ask them at the [[Wikipedia:Media copyright questions|Media copyright questions page]]. Thank you. [[User:BetacommandBot|BetacommandBot]] 00:24, 26 July 2007 (UTC) ==Moved for discussion: Brands using ETA movements== This list, with a single, poor source, is a magnet for promotion. Without proper sourcing by [[WP:IS|independent]], [[WP:RS|reliable sources]], I've moved it here. The one reference appears to be from a promotional piece for IWC. --[[User:Ronz|Ronz]] ([[User talk:Ronz|talk]]) 17:56, 9 January 2009 (UTC)
Mechanical ETA movements are commonly used in many "mid-range" brands such as [[Bulova]], [[Hamilton Watch Company|Hamilton]], [[Markus Ruby]], [[Mido (watch)|Mido]], [[Oris (Watches)|Oris]], [[Fortis Uhren AG|Fortis]], [[Tissot]] and [[Certina]], and also in many "high-end" watch brands such as [[Breitling]], [[International Watch Company|IWC]], [[Longines]], [[Officine Panerai]], [[TAG Heuer]], [[Omega SA|Omega]], [[Porsche Design]], [[Rado (watch)|Rado]] among others. ETA's Quartz Movement lines are used in both "high-end" quartz brands as well as more affordable brands, such as Calvin Klein, flik-flak, Swatch and Swiss Army among others. At the very least, the ETA movements usually carry the watch brands' name on the automatic rotor or otherwise on the top plate if the watch is a manual-wind movement. The more prestigious brands such as Omega and IWC undertake significant modifications of the basic ETA movement. The numerous modifications and the great care taken completely transform the original, mass-produced movement by ETA into something new. [http://www.pmwf.com/Watches/Series/IWCGSTChronoBeachHuaHin/UhrenjournalIWCUseOfBaseMovements.html Uhrenjournal (Austria) on IWC's Use of ETA Base Movements]
== External links modified == Hello fellow Wikipedians, I have just modified 2 external links on [[ETA SA]]. Please take a moment to review [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?diff=prev&oldid=800801069 my edit]. If you have any questions, or need the bot to ignore the links, or the page altogether, please visit [[User:Cyberpower678/FaQs#InternetArchiveBot|this simple FaQ]] for additional information. I made the following changes: *Added archive https://web.archive.org/web/20070305075713/http://www.horlogerie-suisse.com/Complications/2892/2892-A2.html to http://www.horlogerie-suisse.com/Complications/2892/2892-A2.html *Added archive https://web.archive.org/web/20070926224817/http://www.horlogerie-suisse.com/Complications/7750/7750.html to http://www.horlogerie-suisse.com/Complications/7750/7750.html When you have finished reviewing my changes, you may follow the instructions on the template below to fix any issues with the URLs. {{sourcecheck|checked=false|needhelp=}} Cheers.—[[User:InternetArchiveBot|'''InternetArchiveBot''']] ([[User talk:InternetArchiveBot|Report bug]]) 19:12, 15 September 2017 (UTC) == External links modified == Hello fellow Wikipedians, I have just modified one external link on [[ETA SA]]. Please take a moment to review [[special:diff/817111561|my edit]]. If you have any questions, or need the bot to ignore the links, or the page altogether, please visit [[User:Cyberpower678/FaQs#InternetArchiveBot|this simple FaQ]] for additional information. I made the following changes: *Added archive https://web.archive.org/web/20120922104112/http://www.nationaljeweler.com/nj/watches/a/~29149-Swatch-approved-to-reduce-movements to http://www.nationaljeweler.com/nj/watches/a/~29149-Swatch-approved-to-reduce-movements When you have finished reviewing my changes, you may follow the instructions on the template below to fix any issues with the URLs. {{sourcecheck|checked=false|needhelp=}} Cheers.—[[User:InternetArchiveBot|'''InternetArchiveBot''']] ([[User talk:InternetArchiveBot|Report bug]]) 06:18, 26 December 2017 (UTC)

revision.text: == Welcome == '''Welcome!''' Hello, {{BASEPAGENAME}}, and [[Wikipedia:Welcome, newcomers|welcome]] to Wikipedia! Thank you for your contributions. I hope you like the place and decide to stay. Here are some pages that you might find helpful: *[[Wikipedia:Five pillars|The five pillars of Wikipedia]] *[[Wikipedia:How to edit a page|How to edit a page]] *[[Help:Contents|Help pages]] *[[Wikipedia:Tutorial|Tutorial]] *[[Wikipedia:Article development|How to write a great article]] *[[Wikipedia:Manual of Style|Manual of Style]] I hope you enjoy editing here and being a [[Wikipedia:Wikipedians|Wikipedian]]! Please [[Wikipedia:Sign your posts on talk pages|sign your name]] on talk pages using four tildes (~~~~); this will automatically produce your name and the date. If you need help, check out [[Wikipedia:Questions]], ask me on my talk page, or place {{helpme}} on your talk page and someone will show up shortly to answer your questions. Again, welcome!  --[[User:Golden Wattle|Golden Wattle ]] [[User_talk:Golden Wattle|talk]] 20:06, 30 October 2006 (UTC)

|goals2 = 34 | years3 = 2009–2011 |clubs3 = [[FC Porto|Porto]] |caps3 = 51 |goals3 = 41 | years4 = 2011–2013 |clubs4 = [[Atlético Madrid]] |caps4 = 68 |goals4 = 52 | years5 = 2013– |clubs5 = [[AS Monaco FC|Monaco]] |caps5 = 70 |goals5 = 49 | years6 = 2014–2015 |clubs6 = → [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]] (loan) |caps6 = 26 |goals6 = 4 | years7 = 2015–2016 |clubs7 = → [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] (loan) |caps7 = 10 |goals7 = 1 | nationalyears1 = 2001–2005 |nationalteam1 = [[Colombia national under-17 football team|Colombia U17]] |nationalcaps1 = 4 |nationalgoals1 = 1 | nationalyears2 = 2005–2007 |nationalteam2 = [[Colombia national under-20 football team|Colombia U20]] |nationalcaps2 = 3 |nationalgoals2 = 2 | nationalyears3 = 2007– |nationalteam3 = [[Colombia '''Radamel Falcao García Zárate''' ({{IPA-es|raðaˈmel falˈkao}}; 10 February 1986), also known as '''Radamel Falcao''', or simply '''Falcao''', is a Colombian professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[Forward (association football)#Striker|striker]] for [[Ligue 1]] club [[AS Monaco FC|AS Monaco]], for whom he also serves as captain, and the [[Colombia national football team|Colombia national team]]. He is sometimes nicknamed "''El Tigre''" (Spanish for ''The Tiger'') or "King of the [[UEFA Europa League|Europa League]]".<ref>{{cite news |first=Graham |last=MacAree |title=On Radamel Falcao, King of the Europa League |url=https://www.sbnation.com/soccer/2012/5/11/3014138/radamel-falcao-europa-league |publisher=Sbnation.com |date=5 November 2012 |accessdate=2 January 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.talksport.co.uk/magazine/features/120510/where-next-europa-league-king-radamel-falcao-171739 |title=Magazine: Where next for Europa League king Radamel Falcao? |publisher=talkSPORT|accessdate=2 January 2013}}</ref>
Falcao began his career at [[Lanceros Boyacá]], before moving to Argentinian club [[Club Atlético River Plate|River Plate]] where he won the [[2007–08 Argentine Primera División|2007–08]] [[Apertura and Clausura in Argentine football|Clausura]] tournament. In 2009, he joined Portuguese club [[FC Porto|Porto]] where he won several trophies, including the [[2010–11 UEFA Europa League|Europa League]] and [[2010–11 Primeira Liga|Primeira Liga]] double in [[2010–11 FC Porto season|2011]]. Falcao became their all-time [[List of FC Porto records and statistics#Goalscorers|top goalscorer in international club competitions]] and set the record for [[UEFA Cup and Europa League records and statistics#Most goals in a single season|most goals]] (17) in a European campaign. He also became the first Colombian to receive the [[Portuguese Golden Ball]] award.<ref>http://www.atleticofans.com/11854/falcao-awarded-the-portuguese-golden-ball/</ref> In August 2011, Falcao transferred to [[Atlético Madrid]] for a club record €40 million, leading them to [[2011–12 UEFA Europa League|Europa League]] and [[2012 UEFA Super Cup|Super Cup]] victories in 2012. Falcao finished as top goalscorer for the second straight year and became the first player to win consecutive Europa League titles with two different teams.<ref name="autogenerated1">[https://www.fifa.com/worldfootball/clubfootball/news/newsid=1628393.html?intcmp=newsreader_news_box_2 Falcao shines again as Atletico rule Europa]. FIFA.com. Retrieved 10 May 2012.</ref>
In May 2013, Falcao joined newly promoted Monaco for a club record €60 million; however, an [[Anterior cruciate ligament injury|ACL injury]] ruled him out for several months.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.leonmeadmd.com/an_acl_injury_the_falcao_case/ |title=Leon Mead MD |date= |accessdate=1 September 2014 |website= |publisher= }}</ref> Falcao spent the next two seasons on loan at [[Premier League]] clubs [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]] and [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]], eventually rejoining Monaco in 2016 and leading them to [[Ligue 1]] title for the 2016–17 season.
Falcao made his senior debut for Colombia in 2007 and has since earned over 70 caps and scored 29 goals, making him their [[Colombia national football team#Top scorers|all-time top scorer]]. He represented the country at the [[2011 Copa América|2011]] and [[2015 Copa América]], but missed the [[2014 FIFA World Cup]] through injury.
==Club career== ===Lanceros Boyacá=== Falcao made his debut for [[Lanceros Boyacá]] in the Colombian [[Categoría Primera B]] (second tier) on 28 August 1999 at the age of 13 years and 199 days, thus becoming the youngest debutant at that level of Colombian professional football.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.eltiempo.com/archivo/documento/CMS-7295310 |title=En Colombia se vive la 'Falcaomanía' |language=Spanish |trans-title='Falcaomania' is rife in Colombia |first1=Jimmy |last1=Montes |first2=José Orlando |last2=Ascencio |last-author-amp=yes |work=[[El Tiempo (Colombia)|El Tiempo]] |location=Colombia |date=20 February 2010 |accessdate=26 December 2012}}</ref> In 2000, Lanceros' coach, Hernán Pacheco, began to consider the 14-year-old more seriously; Falcao played seven matches that year.<ref name=LancerosFalcao>{{cite web |url=http://dimayor.com/noticias/radamel_falca_garcia_jugo_en_la_segunda_division_en_colombia_540.html |title=Radamel Falcao García jugó en la Segunda División en Colombia |language=Spanish |trans-title=Radamel Falcao García played in the Colombian Second Division |first=William J. |last=Marín S. |publisher=División Mayor del Fútbol Profesional Colombiano |date=12 April 2012 |accessdate=26 December 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20121120064037/http://dimayor.com/noticias/radamel_falca_garcia_jugo_en_la_segunda_division_en_colombia_540.html |archivedate=20 November 2012 |df=dmy-all }}</ref> On 25 July, at the Estadio Olímpico del Sol at [[Sogamoso]], he scored his first and only goal for the club, to seal a 2–0 win against Club El Cóndor that took Lanceros off the bottom of the table.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.eltiempo.com/archivo/documento/MAM-1247214 |title=Lanceros frenó al Cóndor |language=Spanish |trans-title=Lanceros put the brakes on Cóndor |work=El Tiempo |date=25 April 2000 |accessdate=26 December 2012}}</ref> In his two years with the club, he played eight matches and scored once.<ref name=LancerosFalcao/>
===River Plate=== After training with [[Millonarios F.C.|Millonarios]], who did not take up their option to purchase the player,<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.elpais.com.co/elpais/deportes/noticias/falcao-garcia-podra-vestir-camiseta-millonarios |title=Falcao García no podrá vestir camiseta de Millonarios |language=Spanish |trans-title=Falcao García couldn't wear the Millonarios shirt |work=[[El País (Cali)|El País]] |location=Cali |date=15 May 2012 |accessdate=26 December 2012}}</ref> Falcao was sold to [[Club Atlético River Plate|River Plate]] of Argentina in February 2001 for a $500,000 fee.<ref name=LancerosFalcao/><ref name=RiverFalcao>{{cite news |url=http://www.lanacion.com.ar/EdicionImpresa/deportiva/nota.asp?nota_id=949050 |title=San Falcao, la experiencia religiosa a la que se aferra River |language=Spanish |trans-title=Saint Falcao, the religious experience that River clings to |first=Juan Pablo |last=Varsky |work=[[La Nación]] |location=Buenos Aires |date=1 October 2007 |accessdate=26 December 2012}}</ref> He began his River career in the youth team, playing in the eighth division of Argentine football.<ref name=RiverFalcao/> River coach [[Leonardo Astrada]] gave Falcao his professional debut in the [[2004–05 Argentine Primera División#Torneo Clausura|2005 Torneo Clausura]], on 6 March 2005, in a game that the club won 3–1 to [[Instituto Atlético Central Córdoba|Instituto de Córdoba]].<ref>{{cite web | url=http://espndeportes.espn.go.com/futbol/reporte?juegoId=178475 | title=River ganó con autoridad y sigue arriba | publisher=ESPN | date=6 March 2005 | accessdate=19 March 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite web | url=http://canchallena.lanacion.com.ar/1589245-historias-y-anecdotas-de-cuando-falcao-llego-a-river-con-15-anos | title=Historias y anécdotas de cuando Falcao llegó a River con 15 años | publisher=La Nación | date=7 June 2013 | accessdate=19 March 2016}}</ref>
Falcao became a regular in the first team during the [[2005–06 Argentine Primera División#Torneo Apertura|2005 Torneo Apertura]]. He scored twice in a match for the first time in Argentina, on 2 October in a game against [[Independiente de Avellaneda|Independiente]] that finished as a 3–1 win for River.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.infobae.com/notas/nota.php?Idx=214029&IdxSeccion=100795 |title=Falcao hizo festejar a River |language=Spanish |trans-title=Falcao had a ball at River |work=Infobae |date=3 October 2005 |accessdate=26 December 2012}}</ref> He repeated the feat twice more during the Apertura: against [[Club Atlético Lanús|Lanús]], his brace contributed to a 4–1 home win,<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.diariodecuyo.com.ar/home/new_noticia.php?noticia_id=126467 |title=El colombiano Falcao Garcia se consolida como goleador de River |language=Spanish |trans-title=The Colombian Falcao García establishes himself as River's goalscorer |work=Diario de Cuyo |location=San Juan, Argentina |date=9 November 2005 |accessdate=26 December 2012}}</ref> and against [[San Lorenzo de Almagro|San Lorenzo]], River won 5–1.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.terra.com/deportes/articulo/html/fox209973.htm |title=Falcao García marca dos tantos en goleada de River a San Lorenzo |language=Spanish |trans-title=Falcao García scores two in River's goalfest at San Lorenzo |agency=EFE |work=[[Terra Networks|Terra]] |date=17 November 2005 |accessdate=26 November 2012}}</ref> This brought his total for the competition to seven from as many games<ref name=ESPNstats>{{cite web |url=http://soccernet.espn.go.com/player/_/id/87706/radamel-falcao?cc=5739#ui-tabs-2 |title=Radamel Falcao: Appearances |publisher=ESPN Soccernet |accessdate=26 December 2012}} Select season required via dropdown menu.</ref> under the management of [[Reinaldo Merlo]], who gave Falcao the trust he needed to establish himself in the team.
In the match against [[San Lorenzo de Almagro|San Lorenzo]] in November, Falcao injured the ligaments of his right knee and missed the remainder of the Apertura; then, during pre-season training in January 2006, he sustained more serious damage to the same knee, which required surgery and was expected to keep him out for at least six months.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.cooperativa.cl/noticias/deportes/futbol/liga-argentina/river-plate-perdio-a-falcao-garcia-para-el-resto-del-apertura-2005/2005-11-23/120610.html |title=River Plate perdió a Falcao García para el resto del Apertura 2005 |language=Spanish |trans-title=River Plate lost Falcao García for the rest of the 2005 Apertura |publisher=[[Radio Cooperativa]] |date=23 November 2005 |accessdate=26 December 2012}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.terra.com/deportes/articulo/html/fox220456.htm |title=Grave lesión de colombiano Falcao |language=Spanish |trans-title=Serious injury to the Colombian Falcao |work=Terra |date=20 January 2006 |accessdate=26 December 2012}}</ref> He returned to the field in September, soon after the start of the [[2006–07 Argentine Primera División#Torneo Apertura|2006 Torneo Apertura]], in which he made 12 appearances, mainly as a [[substitute (association football)|substitute]]; he scored just once, to seal a 2–0 win against [[Rosario Central]] that took River clear at the top of the table.<ref name=ESPNstats/><ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.infobae.com/notas/nota.php?Idx=282428&IdxSeccion=100803 |title=River construyó una victoria que lo llevó a la punta |language=Spanish |trans-title=River constructed a victory that took them to the top |work=Infobae |date=23 October 2006 |accessdate=26 December 2012}}</ref> A few days earlier, he made his debut in [[CONMEBOL]] competition, in the last eight of the [[2006 Copa Sudamericana]] against [[Atlético Paranaense]] of Brazil. He was replaced at half-time, and the match finished 2–2, so River were eliminated on aggregate, having lost the home leg 1–0.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.lostiempos.com/diario/actualidad/deportes/20061013/eliminan-a-river_22989_22989.html |title=Eliminan a River |language=Spanish |trans-title=River go out |work=Los Tiempos |location=Bolivia |date=12 October 2006 |accessdate=26 December 2012}}</ref>
He was sent off in his only outing in the [[2007 Copa Libertadores]], against [[Colo-Colo]] in February 2007.<ref name=ESPNstats/> Domestically, he made little impression on the [[2006–07 Argentine Primera División#Torneo Clausura|2007 Torneo Clausura]]. He scored in only one of the eight games he played: River's first two goals as they beat [[Racing Club de Avellaneda|Racing Club]] 4–2 away from home.<ref name=ESPNstats/><ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.eluniverso.com/2007/02/25/0001/15/D53357A5AC704AC69961E6235F9A05C8.html |title=River ganó 4–2 y lidera con Arsenal el torneo argentino |language=Spanish |trans-title=River won 4–2 and lead the Argentina league alongside Arsenal |work=[[El Universo]] |location=Ecuador |date=25 February 2007 |accessdate=26 December 2012}}</ref> Falcao scored his first professional [[hat-trick]] on 28 September 2007, as River made a historic comeback against [[Botafogo de Futebol e Regatas|Botafogo]] to progress in the 2007 Sudamericana.<ref name=ESPNstats/> The following week, he scored his first goal in a ''[[Superclásico]]'', the first of River's goals as they beat [[Boca Juniors]] 2–0.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.elpais.com.uy/07/10/07/ultmo_306950.asp |title=River gana el clásico y Pasarella respira |language=Spanish |trans-title=Rover win the derby and Passarella breathes |work=El País |location=Uruguay |date=7 October 2007 |accessdate=26 December 2012}}</ref>
River Plate were reported to have rejected a $15 million offer from [[A.C. Milan|Milan]] for Falcao in early 2008, as well as bids from clubs including [[Aston Villa F.C.|Aston Villa]] and [[Fluminense FC|Fluminense]]. He was a key player as [[Diego Simeone]] led River to the [[2007–08 Argentine Primera División#Torneo Clausura|2008 Torneo Clausura]] championship, his first domestic title, and his performances meant he was linked with moves to a variety of clubs.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.goal.com/en/news/8/main/2008/07/02/759413/madrid-man-united-chase-falcao |title=Madrid, Man United Chase Falcao |first=Gregory |last=Sica |publisher=Goal.com |date=2 July 2008 |accessdate=26 December 2012}}</ref> Nevertheless, he remained with River as they suffered the worst campaign in their history, finishing bottom of the [[2008–09 Argentine Primera División#Torneo Apertura|2008 Torneo Apertura]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.ole.clarin.com/notas/2008/12/14/futbollocal/01822237.html |title=¡Guau! River último |language=Spanish |trans-title=Wow! River last |first=Martín |last=Blotto |work=[[Olé (sports newspaper)|Olé]] |date=14 December 2008 |accessdate=26 December 2012}}</ref>
In 2009, River Plate had a difficult start: they were eliminated in the group stage of the [[Copa Libertadores 2009]] and won few games at the beginning of the [[2008–09 Argentine Primera División#Torneo Clausura|2009 Torneo Clausura]]. Falcao retained his eye for goal and was instrumental in [[Nestor Gorosito]]'s plans, having matured as a striker over the previous two years; he finished as top scorer with 43 goals.<ref name="ESPN profile"/>
===Porto===
====2009–10 season==== [[File:2010–11 UEFA Europa League - SK Rapid Wien vs F.C. Porto (01).jpg|thumb|Falcao playing for [[FC Porto]] in 2010]]
Falcao moved to Europe when he joined [[FC Porto|Porto]] of the Portuguese [[Primeira Liga]] on 15 July 2009 for a €3.93 million transfer fee for 60% of his economic rights<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.fcporto.pt/IncFCP/PDF/Investor_Relations/FactosRelevantes/CompraFalcao_150709.pdf|title=Acordo de princípio para a compra do atleta Falcao|trans-title=Agreement in principle to purchase the athlete Falcao|date=19 July 2009|accessdate=12 March 2011|work=FC Porto|language=Portuguese}}</ref> after Porto sold striker [[Lisandro López]] to [[Olympique Lyonnais|Lyon]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.fcporto.pt/Noticias/Futebol/noticiafutebol_futcomunicadolisandro_070709_44582.asp |title=Acordo com o Lyon para a transferência de Lisandro |trans-title=Agreement with Lyon for Lisandro's transfer |publisher=[[FC Porto]] |language=Portuguese |date=7 July 2010 |accessdate=12 December 2010 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090710014807/http://www.fcporto.pt/Noticias/Futebol/noticiafutebol_futcomunicadolisandro_070709_44582.asp |archivedate=10 July 2009 |df=dmy-all }}</ref> In the transaction, Porto also sold [[Mario Bolatti]] for €1.5 million to a third party owner, Natland Financier B.V., in exchange for 35% of the economic rights of Falcao.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.fcporto.pt/IncFCP/PDF/Investor_Relations/RCConsolidado20092010.pdf|title=FC Porto 2009–10 Annual Report|date=25 October 2010|accessdate=18 May 2011|work=FC Porto|format=PDF|language=Portuguese}}</ref> Falcao was about to sign for Porto rivals [[S.L. Benfica|Benfica]] days before, but the reluctance of its leaders to pay an additional €700,000 requested by Falcao dictated the end of negotiations; days later, Falcao joined Porto.<ref>[http://www.scn.pt/futebol/noticia.php?menu=4&id=16j8cbI6rQc Benfica desiste de Falcão | scn sportcanal]. Scn.pt. Retrieved 10 May 2012.</ref> He made his debut against [[F.C. Paços de Ferreira|Paços de Ferreira]] on the opening day of the season and scored an important goal to earn the team a draw.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.footballzz.co.uk/jogo.php?id=852946 |title=P. Ferreira 1–1 FC Porto |publisher=footballzz.co.uk |date=16 August 2008 |accessdate=12 December 2010 }}</ref> He went on to score three goals in as many games, making him one of the few to score four goals in the first four matchdays in the [[2009–10 Primeira Liga|Portuguese league]].
On 15 September, he made his [[2009–10 UEFA Champions League|UEFA Champions League]] debut in a 1–0 away defeat against [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.worldfootball.net/spielbericht/champions-league-2009-2010-gruppe-d-chelsea-fc-fc-porto/ |title=Match details / line-up: Chelsea FC – FC Porto (Champions League 2009/2010) |publisher=worldfootball.net|date=15 September 2009 |accessdate=15 December 2010 }}</ref> Two weeks later, on 30 September, he scored his first Champions League goal in a group stage win over [[Atlético Madrid]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.worldfootball.net/spielbericht/champions-league-2009-2010-gruppe-d-fc-porto-atletico-madrid/ |title=Match details / line-up: FC Porto – Atlético Madrid (Champions League 2009/2010) |publisher=worldfootball.net|date=30 September 2009 |accessdate=15 December 2010 }}</ref> On 12 December, Falcao scored a header to defeat rivals [[Sporting Clube de Portugal]] in a 1–0 home victory.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.footballzz.co.uk/jogo.php?id=852983 |title=FC Porto 1–0 Sporting |publisher=footballzz.co.uk|date=26 September 2009 |accessdate=12 December 2010 }}</ref> On 2 February 2010, Falcao scored twice in a [[2009–10 Taça de Portugal|Taça de Portugal]] quarter-finals victory against rivals Sporting CP.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.footballzz.co.uk/jogo.php?id=1154534 |title=FC Porto 5–2 Sporting |publisher=footballzz.co.uk|date=2 February 2010 |accessdate=12 December 2010 }}</ref> In the same month, he scored the winning goal against [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] in a [[2009–10 UEFA Champions League knockout phase#Round of 16|UEFA Champions League round of 16]] match,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.worldfootball.net/spielbericht/champions-league-2009-2010-achtelfinale-fc-porto-arsenal-fc/ |title=Match details / line-up: FC Porto – Arsenal FC (Champions League 2009/2010) |publisher=worldfootball.net|date=17 February 2010 |accessdate=15 December 2010 }}</ref> his fourth goal in the tournament. On 3 April, Falcao scored a brace against [[C.S. Marítimo|Marítimo]] to lead the scoring charts with 20 goals,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.eltiempo.com/archivo/documento/CMS-7527019 |title=Doblete de Falcao García en la victoria del Porto contra Marítimo en el fútbol portugués |trans-title=Falcao Garcia double in Porto's victory against Maritimo in the Portuguese League |publisher=[[El Tiempo (Colombia)|El Tiempo]] |language=Spanish |date=3 April 2009 |accessdate=15 December 2010 }}</ref> however he would finish the season as the second-highest league scorer with 25 goals, behind only Benfica's [[Óscar Cardozo]], who had 26. He scored in his last game of the season, the [[2009–10 Taça de Portugal]], where Porto won 2–1 against [[G.D. Chaves|Chaves]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.footballzz.co.uk/jogo.php?id=1230135 |title=Chaves 1–2 FC Porto |publisher=footballzz.co.uk|date=16 May 2010 |accessdate=12 December 2010 }}</ref> Falcao wrapped up the campaign with a career-high 34 goals in all competitions.<ref name="ESPN profile"/>
====2010–11 season==== [[File:Radamel Falcao 6333.jpg|thumb|200px|Falcao playing for FC Porto in 2011]]
Falcao made an impressive start to the [[2010–11 Primeira Liga|2010–11 season]], scoring a goal in the [[2010 Supertaça Cândido de Oliveira|2010 Portuguese SuperCup]] 2–0 victory over Benfica.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.footballzz.co.uk/jogo.php?id=1242054 |title=FC Porto 2–0 Benfica |publisher=footballzz.co.uk|date=8 August 2010 |accessdate=12 December 2010 }}</ref> He scored his first two league goals on the second matchday of the season against [[S.C. Beira-Mar|Beira-Mar]] on 22 August 2010.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.footballzz.co.uk/jogo.php?id=1270486 |title=FC Porto 3–0 Beira-Mar|publisher=footballzz.co.uk|date=22 August 2010 |accessdate=12 December 2010 }}</ref> On 7 November, he scored twice (one of them a backheel goal) in a 5–0 victory against the defending champions Benfica.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.footballzz.co.uk/jogo.php?id=1270550 |title=FC Porto 5–0 Benfica |publisher=footballzz.co.uk|date=7 November 2010 |accessdate=12 December 2010 }}</ref> On 2 December, Falcao scored his first [[hat-trick]] for Porto against [[SK Rapid Wien|Rapid Wien]] during a [[UEFA Europa League]] clash, becoming the top goal scorer with seven goals.
On 7 April 2011, Falcao scored another hat-trick in the quarter-final of the Europa League against Russian side [[FC Spartak Moscow|Spartak Moscow]], an eventual 5–1 victory, to bring his goal tally in the tournament to ten. {{Quote box |quote=I'd like to play with him. Falcao is a great player and is at a very high level. He has won everything in a season in which he scored many goals. He is, today, the great reference of Colombian football. |source=[[Lionel Messi]], June 2011.<ref name="ESPN profile">[http://www.espnfc.com/player/_/id/87706/radamel-zarate-falcao-garcia?cc=5739 "Radamel Falcao profile"]. ESPN. Retrieved 17 May 2014</ref> |align=left |quoted=1 |width=33% }} In the [[2010–11 Primeira Liga|2010–11 season]], Porto won the league title in round 25 of the league against rivals and defending champions Benfica at the [[Estádio da Luz]]. Falcao played a key role in that match, winning his team a penalty when the match was tied at 1–1; the penalty was scored by teammate [[Hulk (footballer)|Hulk]]. In the match against Spartak Moscow in the Europa League, Falcao scored a hat-trick and provided an assist in a 5–1 win. In the second leg, he scored another goal and provided another assist that took Porto to the tournament's semi-final stage. He further added to his position as top scorer in the competition by scoring four goals in the semi-final first leg against [[Villarreal CF|Villarreal]], a game which finished 5–1 in favour of Porto.
In the [[2011 UEFA Europa League Final|Europa League final]] against domestic rivals [[S.C. Braga|Braga]], Falcao scored the only goal of the game with a header after a cross from [[Fredy Guarín]], giving the title to Porto.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://soccernet.espn.go.com/report/_/id/316536?cc=5739|title=Prolific Falcao leads Porto to glory|date=18 May 2011|work=ESPN Soccernet|accessdate=24 May 2011}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.maisfutebol.iol.pt/taca-uefa/fc-porto-falcao-maisfutebol-futebol-iol-golos/1214795-1499.html |title=Falcao: o primeiro "hat-trick" de dragão ao peito |trans-title=Falcao: the first hat-trick for the dragons |publisher=maisfutebol.iol.pt |language=Portuguese |date=2 December 2010 |accessdate=12 December 2010 }}</ref> He set a new goalscoring record of 17 goals in 14 games during the [[2010–11 UEFA Europa League|Europa League campaign]], surpassing [[Jürgen Klinsmann]]'s previous record of 15 goals.<ref name="10-11record">{{cite web|url=http://soccernet.espn.go.com/report?id=315652&cc=5739|title=Falcao record as Porto progress|date=5 May 2011|publisher=ESPN|accessdate=10 May 2011}}</ref>
In July 2011, Falcao extended his contract with an added €45 million buy-out clause.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.fcporto.pt/IncFCP/PDF/Investor_Relations/FactosRelevantes/ir_renovacaoFalcao_14072011.pdf|title=COMUNICADO|trans-title=Communication|date=14 July 2011|accessdate=19 August 2011|publisher=FC Porto official site|language=Portuguese}}</ref> Porto paid a commission of €6,585,150 to extend the contract.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.fcporto.pt/IncFCP/PDF/Investor_Relations/RelatoriosContas/ir_RelatorioContas1S11Consolidado_290212.pdf |title=RELATÓRIO E CONTAS CONSOLIDADO 1º SEMESTRE 2011/2012 |trans-title=Half-Year Report and Accounts on 31 December 2011 |date=29 February 2012 |accessdate=22 March 2012 |publisher=FC Porto |language=Portuguese |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120523112110/http://www.fcporto.pt/IncFCP/PDF/Investor_Relations/RelatoriosContas/ir_RelatorioContas1S11Consolidado_290212.pdf |archivedate=23 May 2012 |df= }}</ref>
===Atlético Madrid=== [[File:Falcao Presentación Atletico (cropped).JPG|thumb|Falcao with [[Atlético Madrid]] in 2011]]
====2011–12 season==== On 18 August 2011, Porto announced they had agreed a fee with Atlético Madrid for the transfer of Falcao.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/transfers/atletico-sign-portos-16335m-falcao-to-plug-aguero-gap-2340364.html |title=Atletico sign Porto's £35m Falcao to plug Aguero gap |work=The Independent |date=19 August 2011 }}</ref> The [[List of most expensive association football transfers|transfer fee was €40 million]] with the fee potentially rising to €50 million based on performance-based clauses, making him the most expensive player in the club's history.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2011/aug/19/atletico-madrid-radamel-falcao-porto|title=Atleico sign striker Radamel Falcao from Porto for £34.7m|date=18 August 2011|work=The Guardian|accessdate=20 August 2011}}</ref> Falcao made his Atlético debut on 10 September away to [[Valencia CF|Valencia]], playing the full 90 minutes in a 1–0 defeat.<ref>[http://www.ligabbva.com/co01/ Página oficial de la mejor liga del mundo, la liga BBVA]. LigaBBVA.com. Retrieved 22 September 2011.</ref><ref>[http://www.ligabbva.com/co02/ Spanish Soccer – Official site of the best league in the world]. LigaBBVA.com. Retrieved 22 September 2011.</ref> On 3 November, Falcao netted a goal in Atlético's 4–0 triumph over [[Udinese Calcio|Udinese]] – the goal meant that Falcao had scored 19 goals in his last 18 Europa League games.<ref>[http://soccernet.espn.go.com/report?id=332119&cc=5901 Report: Atlético Madrid v Udinese – UEFA Champions League – ESPN Soccernet]. Soccernet.espn.go.com (3 November 2011). Retrieved 10 May 2012.</ref>
Falcao's second hat-trick in [[La Liga]] came on 21 January 2012, when he led his team to a 4–0 victory against [[Real Sociedad]] at the [[Anoeta Stadium]]. On 16 February, Falcao scored twice and assisted a goal in an away game against [[S.S. Lazio|Lazio]] to progress to the round of 16 in the Europa League.<ref>[http://www.uefa.com/uefaeuropaleague/season=2012/matches/round=2000273/match=2007427/postmatch/quotes/index.html UEFA Europa League 2012 – Lazio-Atlético –]. Uefa.com. Retrieved 10 May 2012.</ref> In the second leg of Atlético's Round of 16 clash against Turkish club [[Beşiktaş J.K.|Beşiktaş]], Falcao scored one goal and provided another in a 3–0 victory, advancing 6–1 on aggregate.<ref>[http://www.uefa.com/uefaeuropaleague/season=2012/matches/round=2000274/match=2007466/postmatch/report/index.html UEFA Europa League 2012 – Beşiktaş-Atlético –]. Uefa.com (15 March 2012). Retrieved 10 May 2012.</ref> On 21 March, Falcao netted a second half double to propel his side to a 2–1 victory over [[Athletic Bilbao]] and keep Atlético in the race for European places.<ref>[http://soccernet.espn.go.com/report?id=323769&cc=5901 Report: Atlético Madrid v Athletic Bilbao – Spanish Primera División – ESPN Soccernet]. Soccernet.espn.go.com (21 March 2012). Retrieved 10 May 2012.</ref> Falcao scored another goal sealing a 3–0 victory over [[Getafe CF|Getafe]]. In both legs of the Europa League quarter-final tie versus [[Hannover 96]], Falcao managed to score a goal for each leg, helping Atlético seal a 4–2 aggregate victory and increasing his goal tally to eight in the competition.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.uefa.com/uefaeuropaleague/season=2012/matches/round=2000275/match=2007471/postmatch/report/index.html |title=Salvio strike tips balance in Atlético's favour |publisher=UEFA |date=29 March 2012 }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.uefa.com/uefaeuropaleague/season=2012/matches/round=2000275/match=2007475/postmatch/report/index.html |title=Atlético edge through against dogged Hannover |publisher=UEFA |date=5 April 2012 }}</ref>
[[File:Falcao Celebración Europa League 2012.JPG|thumb|left|Falcao celebrates winning the [[2011–12 UEFA Europa League]] with Atlético Madrid]]
Falcao played his first [[Madrid Derby]] against [[Real Madrid C.F.|Real Madrid]] on 11 April 2012. He had missed the first match at the [[Santiago Bernabéu Stadium]] due to injury, and scored Atlético's only goal as his side fell 4–1 due to a [[Cristiano Ronaldo]] hat-trick. He scored his 22nd goal of the season against [[Rayo Vallecano]] in a crucial 1–0 victory for Atlético. For the first leg of the 2011–12 Europa League semi-finals against Valencia, Falcao scored a double in a 4–2 victory while making Atlético the first team to win ten consecutive matches in a single Europa League season.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.uefa.com/uefaeuropaleague/season=2012/matches/round=2000276/match=2007476/postmatch/report/index.html |title=Atlético in control against rivals Valencia |publisher=UEFA |date=19 April 2012 }}</ref> Falcao added to his Europa League tally in the [[2012 UEFA Europa League Final|final]] against fellow [[2011–12 La Liga|Liga]] side Athletic Bilbao, netting Atlético's opening two goals in a 3–0 triumph at the [[Arena Națională]] in [[Bucharest]] on 9 May 2012.<ref name="autogenerated5">{{cite web|url=http://www.uefa.com/uefaeuropaleague/season=2012/matches/round=2000277/match=2007480/postmatch/report/index.html |title=Falcao at double as Atlético march to title |publisher=UEFA |date=9 May 2012 }}</ref> In so doing, Falcao not only became the top goal scorer in a Europa league season again, but became the first player in history to win two consecutive Europa League titles with two different teams.<ref name="autogenerated1"/>
====2012–13 season==== Falcao scored two hat-tricks at the start of the [[2012–13 Atlético Madrid season|2012–13 season]]; first in the La Liga game against 2012 Europa League finalists Athletic Bilbao,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://soccernet.espn.go.com/report?id=348487&cc=5901 |title=Falcao stars in Atletico romp |publisher=ESPNFC |date=27 August 2012 }}</ref> and the second in the defeat of Chelsea, winning the [[2012 UEFA Super Cup]] 4–1 on 31 August 2012.<ref name="Supercup">{{cite web|url=http://www.uefa.com/uefasupercup/season=2012/matches/round=2000278/match=2007694/postmatch/report/index.html#falcao+fires+atletico+glory |title=Falcao fires Atlético to Super Cup glory |publisher=UEFA |date=31 August 2012 }}</ref> At the same time, Falcao became the first player in history to score a hat trick in a UEFA Super Cup final in its current format; the original format was two legged before turning into a single legged final format in 1998. On 16 September, Falcao scored what turned out to be the decisive goal from the penalty spot in a 4–3 win over [[Rayo Vallecano]], and did the same a week later against [[Real Valladolid]], before going off at half-time in order to avoid a possible groin injury.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://es.fifa.com/worldfootball/clubfootball/news/newsid=1706585.html?intcmp=newsreader_news_box_3 |title=Atlético, en puestos de Champions – FIFA.com |publisher=FIFA |accessdate=2 January 2013}}</ref> Falcao scored a double in a 4–2 away victory over [[Real Betis]], converting a cross for the first and then converting a penalty, putting him to the top of the goal scoring charts in La Liga with seven goals.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://uk.eurosport.yahoo.com/football/spanish-liga/2012-2013/real-betis-atletico-madrid-526567.html |title=Real Betis 2 – 4 Atlético Madrid |publisher=Yahoo Sports |date=26 September 2012 }}</ref>
Falcao scored a header against [[Málaga CF|Málaga]], forcing Málaga defender [[Weligton Oliveira|Weligton]] to score an own goal, pushing Atlético to victory in the final minute. He scored once again in an away fixture to Real Sociedad, this time with a rare free-kick – his first professional free kick-goal – in the 90th minute, winning the match 1–0.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://uk.eurosport.yahoo.com/news/liga-brilliant-falcao-grabs-late-win-atletico-213126062.html |title=Liga – Brilliant Falcao grabs late win for Atletico |publisher=Yahoo Sport |date=21 October 2012}}</ref> In a match against [[Sevilla FC|Sevilla]], Falcao scored a penalty and assisted another goal in a 4–0 victory; the strike marked his 50th goal for Atlético.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.insidespanishfootball.com/atletico-madrid-4-0-sevilla-falcao-marks-50th-goal-from-the-spot/ |title=Atlético Madrid 4–0 Sevilla: Falcao marks 50th goal from the spot |publisher=Inside Spanish Football |accessdate=2 January 2013}}</ref> In the match against [[Deportivo de La Coruña]] on 9 December, Falcao scored an astonishing five goals, becoming the first player in La Liga in over a decade to net five goals in a match.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://sports.yahoo.com/news/soccer-five-goal-falcao-hails-unforgettable-la-liga-232115185--sow.html |title=Soccer-Five-goal Falcao hails unforgettable La Liga night |publisher=Yahoo Sports |date=9 December 2012}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://espnfc.com/us/en/report/348372/report.html?soccernet=true&cc=5901 |title=Five-star show from Falcao |publisher=ESPNFC |date=9 December 2012 }}</ref>
Falcao missed the first La Liga match of 2013 due to an injury but returned in the second match against [[Real Zaragoza]], where he scored a penalty. It was noted that Falcao struggled to maintain form during the match. In the first leg of the [[Copa del Rey]] quarter-finals against Betis, Falcao scored a header in a 2–0 victory.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://msn.foxsports.com/foxsoccer/laliga/story/atletico-madrid-2-0-real-betis-match-report-copa-del-rey-radamel-falcao-011713 |title=Radamel Falcao helped Atletico Madrid defeated Real Betis 2–0 |publisher=Msn.foxsports.com |date=18 January 2013 |accessdate=13 May 2013}}</ref>
In the Copa del Rey semi-finals, Falcao scored against Sevilla in a 2–2 draw, although Atlético advanced to the finals with a 4–3 aggregate scoreline as well as scoring twice before Sevilla. In the league match against Valencia, Falcao scored again in a 1–1 draw. Falcao scored a double against [[Granada CF|Granada]] in a comfortable 5–0 victory. The second goal marked Falcao's 200th career goal (counting both club and nation).<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.marca.com/2013/04/15/en/football/spanish_football/1366015836.html |title=Falcao roars to 200-goal mark |publisher=MARCA.com |date= |accessdate=13 May 2013 }}</ref> In an away match against Sevilla, Falcao scored the only goal in a 0–1 victory. In the Madrid Derby against Real Madrid, Falcao scored Atlético's only goal once more, albeit in a 1–2 home loss.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.fifa.com/worldfootball/clubfootball/news/newsid=2065072.html?intcmp=newsreader_news_box_3 |title=Di Maria earns Real victory at Atletico |publisher=FIFA.com |date=27 April 2013 |accessdate=13 May 2013}}</ref> Falcao scored the last goal for Atlético in a 3–1 away victory over [[Celta de Vigo]]. The win assured Atlético Madrid would appear in the Champions League for next season for the first time in four years.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://asia.eurosport.com/football/la-liga/2011-2012/celta-vigo-v-atletico-madrid-live_sto3748089/story.shtml |title=Falcao grabs winner as Atlético beat Celta Vigo |publisher=Asia.eurosport.com |date= |accessdate=13 May 2013 }}</ref>
{{Quote box |width=30% |align=right |quote="It's an unbelievable feeling. Now we have to enjoy it. This win feels awesome. We're happy with the effort we put in and that we can celebrate this win like the people wanted." |source=<small>Falcao, on winning the Copa del Rey with Atlético Madrid and helping Atlético defeat Real Madrid for the first time in 14 years.<ref>{{cite web|last=Coerts |first=Stefan |url=https://sports.yahoo.com/news/falcao-delighted-copa-del-rey-111700328--sow.html;_ylt=A2KJ2UaYiZdR41EA_7vQtDMD |title=Falcao delighted with Copa del Rey win – Yahoo! Sports |publisher=Sports.yahoo.com |date=18 May 2013 |accessdate=24 May 2013}}</ref></small>}} In the [[2013 Copa del Rey Final]], Atlético were trailing 1–0 when Falcao delivered a timely assist to [[Diego Costa]] to tie the game. They went on to win 2–1 and defeat their arch-rivals Real Madrid for the first time in 14 years.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.fifa.com/worldfootball/clubfootball/news/newsid=2081266.html?intcmp=newsreader_news_box_2 |title=Atleti stun Real in extra time |publisher=FIFA.com |date=17 May 2013 |accessdate=24 May 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.uefa.com/memberassociations/association=esp/news/newsid=1953423.html?rss=1953423+Atl%C3%A9tico+deny+rivals+Madrid+to+lift+Copa+del+Rey |title=Atlético deny rivals Madrid to lift Copa del Rey |publisher=UEFA.com |date=18 May 2013 |accessdate=24 May 2013}}</ref> This was Falcao's first and only domestic cup title with Atlético.
===Monaco=== {{Quote box |quote=It makes me laugh at times when I get asked why I didn't stay at a particular club or why I haven't moved to another side, as if the player has a choice in the matter. I'd say back to journalists: why don't you work at CNN or ESPN? It's the same in football; on very few occasions can the player make the decision to move from one club or to another. There have been occasions when I've not been able to live in the way I want, many times. I want to go to a particular club and in finally I end up at another. |source=Falcao in 2014 speaking on his move from Atlético Madrid to Monaco.<ref>[http://www.espnfc.com/atletico-madrid/story/2217441/radamel-falcao-i-knew-i-would-be-leaving-atletico-after-just-four-months Radamel Falcao: I knew I would be leaving Atletico after just four months]. ESPN (27 December 2014)</ref> |align=right |quoted=1 |width=33%}}
On 31 May 2013, Atlético Madrid general manager Miguel Ángel Gil Marín announced that the club would not stand in the way if Falcao decided to leave in the next summer transfer window. Despite being linked with various clubs such as Atlético Madrid's city rivals Real Madrid, he signed for newly promoted [[Ligue 1]] side [[AS Monaco FC|Monaco]] on 31 May 2013. Falcao subsequently signed a five-year contract for an undisclosed fee,<ref name="autogenerated4">{{cite web|url=http://www.uefa.com/memberassociations/association=fra/news/newsid=1957875.html |title=Falcao pens five-year deal with ambitious Monaco |publisher=UEFA.com |date=11 May 2013 |accessdate=1 June 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.asm-fc.com/en/news/team/agreement-with-atletico-madrid-for-radamel-falcao|title=Monaco agree deal with Atlético Madrid for Falcao|date=31 May 2013|accessdate=31 May 2013|publisher=AS Monaco|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://archive.is/20130615054640/http://www.asm-fc.com/en/news/team/agreement-with-atletico-madrid-for-radamel-falcao|archivedate=15 June 2013|df=dmy-all}}</ref> [[List of most expensive association football transfers|believed to be around €60 million]], with his net annual salary at Monaco being reported to be around €18.2 million.<ref name="autogenerated4"/><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.espn.co.uk/football/sport/story/209948.html|title=Monaco confirm £50m Falcao signing|date=31 May 2013|accessdate=31 May 2013|publisher=ESPN.co.uk}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.fifa.com/worldfootball/clubfootball/news/newsid=2089672.html?intcmp=fifacom_hp_module_news |title=Monaco owner announces Falcao signing |publisher=FIFA.com |date= |accessdate=1 June 2013 }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.bangkokpost.com/news/sports/352901/monaco-president-announces-falcao-signing |title=Monaco president announces Falcao signing |publisher=Bangkok Post |date= |accessdate=1 June 2013 }}</ref> Despite the Colombian showing optimism about his Monaco future, Falcao gave an emotional farewell to Atlético during a press interview,<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.marca.com/2013/06/01/futbol/equipos/atletico/1370103331.html |title=Emoción y lágrimas en la despedida de Falcao |publisher=MARCA.com |date= |accessdate=1 June 2013 }}</ref> expressing his enjoyment with the club and considering it to be "the best time of his career".<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.fifa.com/worldfootball/clubfootball/news/newsid=2096855.html |title=Falcao leaves Atletico after 'best years' of career |publisher=FIFA.com |date=19 May 2012 |accessdate=1 June 2013 }}</ref> It is commonly believed that his third-party ownership had a stronger influence on his decision.<ref>{{cite web |author=Chris Harty |url=http://www.therichest.com/sports/soccer-sports/selling-your-soul-radamel-falcao-controlled-by-third-party-ownership/ |title=Selling Your Soul: Radamel Falcao Controlled by Third-Party Ownership |publisher=TheRichest |date= |accessdate=14 June 2014 }}</ref> Falcao went on to say that part of his reason for choosing Monaco was to follow the footsteps of his idol, [[Thierry Henry]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.butfootballclub.fr/411935-as-monaco-falcao-a-signe-grace-a-thierry-henry/|title=AS Monaco : Falcao a signé grâce à Thierry Henry !His first ever goal for AS Monaco was in a friendly match against|date=2 June 2013|accessdate=6 June 2013|publisher=But! Football Club|language=French}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://metro.co.uk/2013/06/02/radamel-falcao-crying-all-the-way-to-the-bank-as-he-says-tearful-farewell-to-atletico-madrid-video-3825415/|title=Radamel Falcao crying all the way to the bank as he says tearful farewell to Atletico Madrid – video|date=2 June 2013|accessdate=6 June 2013|publisher=Metro}}</ref> Monaco sporting director [[Vadim Vasilyev (manager)|Vadim Vasilyev]] said that the club hoped to build a team around Falcao and provide a direct challenge in Ligue 1 to Qatari backed PSG.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.dailystar.com.lb/Sports/Football/2013/Jul-10/223151-falcao-aims-to-take-monaco-to-european-peak.ashx |title=Falcao aims to take Monaco to ‘European peak’ | Sports, Football |publisher=Daily Star |date= |accessdate=15 November 2013 }}</ref>
====2013–14 season==== [[File:Radamel Falcao 2014.jpg|thumbnail|Falcao warming-up for [[AS Monaco]] in 2014]]
Falcao made his Ligue 1 debut in the first match against [[FC Girondins de Bordeaux|Bordeaux]], where he managed to score in the 88th minute, sealing a 2–0 victory. Against [[Montpellier HSC|Montpellier]], Falcao opened the scoring board with a penalty kick. Monaco went on to win the game 4–1.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://sports.yahoo.com/news/soccer-riviere-outshines-falcao-hat-trick-monaco-cruise-142707516.html |title=Soccer-Riviere outshines Falcao with hat-trick as Monaco cruise – Yahoo Sports |publisher=Sports.yahoo.com |date=18 August 2013 |accessdate=15 November 2013}}</ref> In a match against [[Olympique de Marseille|Marseille]], Falcao scored the equalizer in a 2–1 victory.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2013/sep/01/radamel-falcao-monaco-marseille |title=Radamel Falcao on target as Monaco beat Marseille to top the table | Football |publisher=The Guardian |date= |accessdate=15 November 2013 }}</ref> In a match against [[FC Lorient|Lorient]], Falcao scored an early penalty kick, the winner in a 1–0 victory. Falcao managed to equalize with a diving header in a tough away match against French champions [[Paris Saint-Germain F.C.|Paris Saint-Germain]]; the game would end 1–1 and keep Monaco on top of the league table. Days later, Falcao scored a double against [[SC Bastia|Bastia]] in a 3–0 victory. This also brought his goal tally to seven and making him top goal scorer in [[2013–14 Ligue 1|Ligue 1]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.uefa.com/memberassociations/association=fra/domesticleague/season=2014/matches/match=200101250/live/index.html |title=Member associations – France – League – |publisher=Uefa.com |date=25 September 2013 |accessdate=15 November 2013}}</ref>
Falcao ended his four-game goal drought for Monaco in a 2–1 win over [[Olympique Lyonnais|Lyon]], scoring with an impressive chip.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://au.sports.yahoo.com/football/news/article/-/19572316/falcao-swoops-again-as-monaco-back-top-of-ligue-1/ |title=PSG stay unbeaten, top after controversial draw – Yahoo!7 Sport |publisher=Au.sports.yahoo.com |date=28 October 2013 |accessdate=15 November 2013}}</ref> In a match against [[Evian Thonon Gaillard F.C.|Evian]], Falcao scored the equalizer in a 1–1 draw.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.thestar.com.my/Sport/Football/2013/11/09/Falcao-strikes-back-as-Monaco-avoid-third-defeat.aspx |title=Falcao strikes back as Monaco avoid third defeat – Football | The Star Online |publisher=Thestar.com.my |date=9 November 2013 |accessdate=15 November 2013}}</ref> On 27 November, it was reported that Falcao failed to fully recover from a thigh injury prior to his last match for the club, and he was forced to miss the next four league matches.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.football.co.uk/monaco/falcao_remains_on_injured_list_for_nice_trip_rss4513344.shtml |title=Falcao remains on injured list for Nice trip – Monaco News from |publisher=football.co.uk |date=2 December 2013 |accessdate=9 January 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.givemesport.com/408841-falcao-out-for-monaco |title=Falcao out for Monaco |publisher=GiveMeSport |date= |accessdate=9 January 2014 }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|author=etienne ballerini |url=http://www.thestar.com.my/Sport/Football/2013/12/12/Falcao-still-on-Monacos-injured-list.aspx |title=Falcao still on Monaco's injured list – Football | The Star Online |publisher=Thestar.com.my |date=12 December 2013 |accessdate=9 January 2014}}</ref> Falcao made his return after being brought on within the second half against [[Valenciennes FC|Valenciennes]], where he missed a penalty kick as Monaco lost 2–1.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.uefa.com/memberassociations/association=fra/domesticleague/season=2014/matches/match=200101368/live/index.html |title=Member associations – France – League – |publisher=Uefa.com |date=20 December 2013 |accessdate=9 January 2014}}</ref>
