Falcao started 2014 by making his [[Coupe de France]] debut in a match against [[Vannes OC|Vannes]], where he both assisted and scored a goal in a 3–2 victory.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.sportsmole.co.uk/football/vannes-oc/coupe-de-france/live-commentary/live-commentary-vannes-oc-2-3-as-monaco-as-it-happened_128499.html |title=Live Commentary: Vannes OC 2–3 AS Monaco – as it happened |publisher=Sports Mole |date=5 January 2014 |accessdate=9 January 2014}}</ref> Falcao's second goal of the month came in the Coupe de France once more, where he scored a goal before being substituted due to an injury in the first half against [[Monts d'Or Azergues Foot]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.sportsmole.co.uk/football/monts-dor-azergues/coupe-de-france/live-commentary/live-commentary-monts-dor-azergues-vs-as-monaco_132091.html |title=Live Commentary: Monts D'or Azergues 1–3 AS Monaco – as it happened |publisher=Sports Mole |date= |accessdate=14 June 2014 }}</ref>
On 23 January, it was confirmed that Falcao had suffered a severe [[Anterior cruciate ligament injury|ACL injury]] and would miss the [[2014 FIFA World Cup]], while effectively ending his 2013–14 season entirely.<ref name="chilevision.cl">{{cite web|url=http://www.chilevision.cl/noticias/deportes/futbol-internacional/examenes-medicos-indican-que-falcao-se-perderia-el-mundial/2014-01-23/113031.html |title=Exámenes médicos indican que Falcao se perdería el Mundial – Chilevisión – Te Ve de Verdad |publisher=Chilevision.cl |date=23 January 2014 |accessdate=14 June 2014}}</ref> Falcao went on to say that he was confident in a speedy recovery.<ref name="abola.pt">{{cite web|url=http://www.abola.pt/nnh/ver.aspx?id=455447 |title=abola.pt |publisher=abola.pt |date=6 June 2014 |accessdate=14 June 2014}}</ref> Falcao also went on to say that he wanted to play in the match himself, and that Monaco head coach [[Claudio Ranieri]] did not force him to.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.golcaracol.com/futbol-internacional/otras-ligas-internacionales/ligue-1-francia/video-282793-tecnico-del-monaco-asegura-falcao-le-pidio-jugar-e |title=Técnico del Mónaco asegura que Falcao le pidió jugar ante el Chasselay | Ligue 1 (Francia) |publisher=Golcaracol.com |date= |accessdate=14 June 2014 }}</ref>
====2014–15 season==== Falcao's full recovery was confirmed in mid-July, where he would play regularly in pre-season matches for Monaco after six months sidelined.<ref>[http://comutricolor.com/radamel-falcao-regresa-canchas-despues-seis-meses/ Radamel Falcao regresa a la canchas despúes de seis meses]. ComuTricolor.com (17 July 2014). Retrieved on 8 November 2015.</ref> He returned on the field at the [[2014 Emirates Cup|Emirates Cup]] coming on as a substitute for [[Dimitar Berbatov]] in the 72nd minute as Monaco drew 2–2 against Spanish side Valencia.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.arsenal.com/news/news-archive/20140802/valencia-2-2-monaco-report |title=Valencia 2–2 Monaco – Report |publisher=Arsenal.com |date=2 August 2014}}</ref> The next day, he played the first hour of the match against [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] and scored the only goal of the game in the 36th minute.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.arsenal.com/match/report/1415/post/first-team/arsenal-v-as-monaco-match-report |title=Arsenal 0 – 1 Monaco |publisher=Arsenal.com |date=4 August 2014}}</ref>
On 10 August, in his first competitive match since his injury, Falcao came on for [[Lucas Ocampos]] after 59 minutes and scored a penalty, though Monaco lost 2–1 at home to Lorient.<ref>{{cite news|title=Monaco 1–2 Lorient|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/28687991|accessdate=2 September 2014|work=BBC Sport|date=10 August 2014}}</ref> Two weeks later, he started away to [[FC Nantes|Nantes]] and scored the only goal of the game, heading in [[Layvin Kurzawa]]'s cross before half-time for the club's first points of the season.<ref>{{cite news|title=Nantes 0–1 Monaco|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/28920092|accessdate=2 September 2014|work=BBC Sport|date=24 August 2014}}</ref> Amidst rumours of a transfer, Falcao was not included in Monaco's next match against [[Lille OSC|Lille]], and watched from the stands next to club owner Vadim Vasilyev.<ref>{{cite news|title=Monaco 1–1 Lille|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/28985917|accessdate=2 September 2014|work=BBC Sport|date=30 August 2014}}</ref>
====Manchester United (loan)==== [[File:Chelsea 1 Man Utd 0 (16578195303).jpg|thumbnail|left|Falcao playing for [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]] in 2015]]
{{Quote box |quote=Every football player wants to play, that's very normal, but I respect the manager and the decisions he makes. I keep working hard in training, learning every day how to play in different systems, in different styles of football. Manchester United is a great club, I am very happy to be here and because of this I am happy to be patient.|source=Falcao in 2015 speaking on his development under [[Louis van Gaal]].<ref>[http://www.espnfc.com/manchester-united/story/2389555/falcao-i-want-to-play-for-man-utd-but-i-respect-louis-van-gaals-decisions Falcao I want to play for Man Utd but I respect Louis van Gaal's decisions]. Espn Fc (2015-04-09). Retrieved on 2015-11-08.</ref> |align=right |quoted=1 |width=31%}} On 1 September 2014, [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]] agreed to sign Falcao on loan for £6 million subject to a medical examination with an option to sign permanently for £43.5 million (€55 million) at season's end.<ref name=united/> The deal saw him earn £265,000 per week at the club.<ref>{{cite news|title=Radamel Falcao: Is his time at Manchester United running out?|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/31497997|accessdate=17 February 2015|work=BBC Sport|issue=BBC Sport|publisher=BBC Sport|date=17 February 2015}}</ref> [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] had previously opted out of signing him due to squad size.<ref name=united>{{cite news|last1=Stone|first1=Simon|title=Radamel Falcao: Man Utd agree transfer deadline day loan move|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/29011493|accessdate=1 September 2014|work=BBC Sport|date=1 September 2014}}</ref> United confirmed the transfer in the early hours of 2 September.<ref>{{cite news|title=Manchester United sign Falcao on loan|url=http://www.manutd.com/en/News-And-Features/Football-News/2014/Sep/radamel-falcao-signs-for-manchester-united-on-loan.aspx|accessdate=2 September 2014|publisher=Manchester United F.C.|date=2 September 2014}}</ref> Despite joining temporarily under a loan contract, Falcao said he would fight to stay at United for many years and become a legend at the club.<ref>{{cite news|title=Falcao: I want to stay at Manchester United for many years|url=http://www.goal.com/en-gb/news/2896/premier-league/2014/09/11/5097965/falcao-i-want-to-stay-at-manchester-united-for-many-years|accessdate=17 September 2014|work=Goal.com|publisher=Goal.com|date=11 September 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Radamel Falcao – Extended Interview|url=http://www1.skysports.com/watch/video/sports/football/9470366/radamel-falcao-extended-interview|accessdate=17 September 2014|work=Sky Sports|publisher=Sky Sports|date=14 September 2014}}</ref>
Falcao made his debut at [[Old Trafford]] on 14 September, playing the final 23 minutes of a 4–0 win over [[Queens Park Rangers F.C.|Queens Park Rangers]] in place of [[Juan Mata]], as United won for the first time in the season.<ref>{{cite news|title=Man Utd 4–0 QPR|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/29098240|work=[[BBC Sport]]|date=14 September 2014}}</ref> His debut was marked by rapturous applause from the club's supporters as they continuously chanted his name both while he was warming up and on the pitch.<ref>{{cite news|title=Falcao thanks United fans for warm welcome|url=http://www.manutd.com/en/News-And-Features/Football-News/2014/Sep/Radamel-Falcao-thanks-United-fans.aspx|accessdate=17 September 2014|publisher=Manchester United Official Website|date=15 September 2014}}</ref> On 5 October, he scored his first goal for United, the winner in a 2–1 home victory against [[Everton F.C.|Everton]].<ref>{{cite news|last1=Henson|first1=Mike|title=Man Utd 2–1 Everton|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/29398862|accessdate=5 October 2014|work=BBC Sport|date=5 October 2014}}</ref> On 20 December, Falcao made his return for the first time in the starting line-up to score a goal in the second half in a 1–1 draw with Aston Villa.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/30459793 |title=Aston Villa 1–1 Manchester United |publisher=BBC Sport |date=20 December 2014 |accessdate=6 January 2015}}</ref> Six days later, he provided an assist for [[Wayne Rooney]] against [[Newcastle United F.C.|Newcastle United]], and United went on to win the match 3–1.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/30544155 |title=Manchester United 3–1 Newcastle United|publisher=BBC Sport |date=26 December 2014 |accessdate=6 January 2015}}</ref> On 1 January 2015, Falcao equalised against [[Stoke City F.C.|Stoke City]] in a 1–1 draw.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/30600756 |title=Stoke City 1–1 Manchester United |publisher=BBC Sport |date=1 January 2015 |accessdate=6 January 2015}}</ref>
His future at United was put under doubt when his agent, [[Jorge Mendes]], stated at the start of the year that his client "may not be at Old Trafford at the start of next season but will play in one of the very best clubs in the world". After failing to offer any shots, either on or off target, against a [[Football League One|League One]] side [[Preston North End F.C.|Preston North End]], a [[List of British football commentators|BBC commentator]], [[Martin Keown]] described his struggling performance as "another night of nothing from Falcao".<ref>{{cite news|last1=Bevan|first1=Chris|title=Radamel Falcao: Is his time at Manchester United running out?|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/31497997|accessdate=17 February 2015|publisher=BBC Sport|date=17 February 2015}}</ref>
On 10 March, a day after being an unused substitute as United were knocked out of the FA Cup at home by [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]], Falcao played for their under-21 team in a 1–1 draw with [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]], being substituted after 72 minutes.<ref>{{cite news|title=Radamel Falcao: Man Utd striker faces Tottenham Under-21s|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/31825953|accessdate=10 March 2015|work=BBC Sport|date=10 March 2015}}</ref> The demotion was publicly criticised by former footballers [[Dietmar Hamann]] and [[Willem van Hanegem]], whom had described the decision Van Gaal made to be "disrespectful" and "disgraceful".<ref>Anwar, Daniel. (11 March 2015) [http://www.squawka.com/news/dietmar-hamann-louis-van-gaal-cant-treat-radamel-falcao-like-chris-smalling-or-jonny-evans/326445 Dietmar Hamann: Louis van Gaal can't treat Radamel Falcao like Chris Smalling or Jonny Evans]. ''Squawka News''. Retrieved on 8 November 2015.</ref><ref>Falcao 'Turun Kelas' ke MU U-21, Van Gaal Dikecam</ref>
At season's end, he was adjudged by many to be among the worst signings of the season.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Jenkins|first1=Will|title=Worst 5 Signings Of The 2014/2015 Premier League Season So Far|url=http://www.thesportbible.com/articles/worst-5-signings-of-the-2014-2015-premier-league-season-so-far|publisher=Sport Bible|accessdate=4 November 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=20 worst Premier League signings of the 2014/15 season|url=http://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/competitions/premier-league/11616110/20-worst-Premier-League-signings-of-the-201415-season.html?frame=3257609|work=The Daily Telegraph|accessdate=4 November 2015|date=4 June 2015}}</ref> On 24 May 2015, United announced their decision to not exercise their buy option on Falcao, ending a spell at the club in which he scored 4 goals in 29 appearances.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Stone|first1=Simon|title=Radamel Falcao: Manchester United decide not to sign striker|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/32865649|work=[[BBC Sport]]|accessdate=24 May 2015|date=24 May 2015}}</ref>
====Chelsea (loan)==== [[File:Falcao_vs_Arsenal.jpg|thumb|150px|Falcao playing for [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] in 2015]]
{{Quote box |quote=If I can help Falcao reach his level again, I will do it. It hurts me people in England think that the real Falcao is the one we saw at United.|source=Chelsea manager [[José Mourinho]] to the press prior to the signing.<ref>Mokbel, Sami. (2015-07-03) [http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-3148862/Manchester-United-flop-Radamel-Falcao-takes-145-000-cut-wages-join-Jose-Mourinho-Chelsea.html Manchester United flop Radamel Falcao takes £145,000 cut in wages to join Jose Mourinho at Chelsea | Daily Mail Online]. Dailymail.co.uk. Retrieved on 2015-11-08.</ref> |align=left |quoted=1 |width=31%}} On 3 July 2015, Chelsea signed Falcao on a season-long loan deal with the option of a permanent transfer at the end of the season. It was later revealed that the fee to make the move permanent was set at £38 million (€50 million).<ref>{{Cite web|title = Falcao's Chelsea loan deal from Monaco 'sets transfer fee at £38million'|url = http://www.belfasttelegraph.co.uk/sport/football/premier-league/falcaos-chelsea-loan-deal-from-monaco-sets-transfer-fee-at-38million-34394826.html|website = Belfast Telegraph|access-date = 26 January 2016}}</ref> The move briefly reunited him with his Colombia teammate [[Juan Cuadrado]] and former Atlético Madrid teammates [[Diego Costa]] and [[Thibaut Courtois]]. Midfielder [[Mario Pašalić]] went to Monaco on loan in exchange for Falcao joining Chelsea.<ref>{{cite news |title=Radamel Falcao: Chelsea sign Monaco striker on loan |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/33384795 |publisher=BBC Sport (British Broadcasting Corporation) |date=3 July 2015 |accessdate=3 July 2015 }}</ref>
Falcao made his debut on 2 August in the [[2015 FA Community Shield]] at [[Wembley Stadium]], replacing [[Loïc Rémy]] at half time as Chelsea lost 1–0 to [[Arsenal F.C.–Chelsea F.C. rivalry|rivals]] Arsenal.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Cryer|first1=Andy|title=Arsenal 1–0 Chelsea|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/33667216|accessdate=2 August 2015|publisher=BBC Sport|date=2 August 2015}}</ref> His league debut came six days later in a 2–2 home draw with [[Swansea City A.F.C.|Swansea City]], playing the final six minutes in place of [[Willian (footballer)|Willian]].<ref>{{cite news|last1=Johnston|first1=Neil|title=Chelsea 2–2 Swansea|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/33744668|accessdate=8 August 2015|publisher=BBC Sport|date=8 August 2015}}</ref> On 29 August, again as a replacement for Willian, Falcao scored his first Chelsea goal, equalising in an eventual 1–2 home defeat to [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]].<ref>{{cite news|last1=Rose|first1=Gary|title=Chelsea 1–2 Crystal Palace|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/34025310|accessdate=29 August 2015|publisher=BBC Sport|date=29 August 2015}}</ref>
On 3 November, Falcao picked up a muscular injury in training, and was ruled out for a "few weeks",<ref>{{Cite web|title = Chelsea's Falcao out for 'few weeks,' Ivanovic, Pedro resume training|url = http://www.espnfc.com/chelsea/story/2695494/chelsea-striker-radamel-falcao-out-for-a-few-weeks|website = ESPNFC.com|access-date = 26 January 2016}}</ref> however on 15 January 2016, new manager [[Guus Hiddink]] confirmed that Falcao's latest injury setback was "very serious".<ref>{{Cite web|title = Radamel Falcao's latest injury 'very serious' - Guus Hiddink|url = http://www.espnfc.com/chelsea/story/2787644/radamel-falcaos-latest-injury-very-serious-guus-hiddink|website = ESPNFC.com|access-date = 26 January 2016}}</ref> He was dropped from the team's Champions League squad the following month, in favour of new addition [[Alexandre Pato]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Radamel Falcao: Chelsea striker dropped from Champions League squad|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/35488481|accessdate=4 February 2016|publisher=BBC Sport|date=3 February 2016}}</ref>
====2016–17 season==== At the end of the [[2015–16 Chelsea F.C. season|2015–16 season]], Falcao returned to Monaco.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.mid-day.com/articles/radamel-falcao-returns-to-monaco-after-chelsea-decline-purchase-option/17231154|title=Radamel Falcao returns to Monaco after Chelsea decline purchase option|work=mid-day|access-date=15 March 2017|language=en}}</ref> Upon his return, Falcao was made team captain by coach [[Leonardo Jardim]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.uefa.com/uefachampionsleague/news/newsid=2444049.html|title=Radamel Falcao part two: Atlético and Monaco success|date=12 March 2017|work=UEFA}}</ref>
On 27 July 2016, Falcao scored for Monaco in his first appearance for the club in two seasons; a [[2016–17 UEFA Champions League qualifying phase and play-off round|Champions League qualifier]] against [[Fenerbahçe S.K. (football)|Fenerbahçe S.K.]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.goal.com/en-us/news/174/uefa-champions-league/2016/07/27/26001552/falcao-scores-as-monaco-return-ends-in-defeat-to-fenerbahce|title=Falcao scores as Monaco return ends in defeat to Fenerbahce|date=27 July 2016|work=Goal.com}}</ref> On 17 September 2016, he scored his first Ligue 1 goal of the season in a 3–0 win over [[Stade Rennais F.C.|Stade Rennais]] at the [[Stade Louis II]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.espnfc.com.au/french-ligue-1/story/2953204/ligue-1-radamel-falcao-scores-in-monaco-win-over-rennes|title=Radamel Falcao scores in Monaco win over Rennes|date=17 September 2017|work=ESPN}}</ref>
On 5 November 2016, he scored twice in the first half as Monaco defeated [[AS Nancy|Nancy]] 6–0 in a [[2016–17 Ligue 1|Ligue 1]] match, following his two first-half goals against [[PFC CSKA Moscow|CSKA Moscow]] in a [[2016–17 UEFA Champions League group stage|2016–17 Champions League group stage]] match three days earlier.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.goal.com/en/news/1722/ligue-1/2016/11/05/29224542/falcao-highlights-monaco-ambition-after-nancy-thrashing|title=Falcao highlights Monaco ambition after Nancy thrashing|publisher=www.goal.com|date=5 November 2016}}</ref>
On 10 December 2016, Falcao scored his first hat-trick in Ligue 1 in a 4–0 win against Bordeaux which boosted his [[2016–17 AS Monaco FC season|2016–17 season]] tally to 14 goals in 15 competitive games, and 10 goals in Ligue 1 with just 579 minutes of Ligue 1 playing time, meaning that Falcao scored an average of one Ligue 1 goal in every 58 minutes of Ligue 1 playing time.<ref>http://www.ligue1.com/ligue1/article/el-tigre-falcao-back-on-prowl-for-monaco.htm</ref>
On 21 February 2017, Falcao scored two goals, the first with a diving header from [[Fabinho (footballer, born 1993)|Fabinho]]'s cross from the right and the second with a chip over [[Willy Caballero]], but missed a penalty in a 5–3 away loss to Manchester City in the Champions League's [[2016–17 UEFA Champions League knockout phase|round of 16 first leg match]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/39030973|title=Manchester City 5–3 Monaco|website=BBC Sport|date=21 February 2017|accessdate=23 February 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ligue1.com/autresCompetitions/article/monaco-go-down-to-city-in-eight-goal-thriller.htm|title=Monaco go down to City in eight-goal thriller|publisher=www.ligue1.com|date=21 February 2017}}</ref> Despite him missing out at the second leg at home due to injury, Monaco eventually won the match 3–1 and eventually qualified to the quarter-finals with away goals rule after a 6–6 aggregate score.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.skysports.com/football/monaco-vs-man-city/368244|title=Monaco 3-1 Man City (Agg: 6-6): City out of Champions League on away goals|work=Sky Sports|access-date=2018-02-04|language=en}}</ref> On 19 April 2017, he scored in Monaco's 3–1 victory over [[Borussia Dortmund]] to put the team into the Champions League semi-finals for the first time since [[2003–04 UEFA Champions League|2004]].<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/live/2017/apr/19/monaco-v-borussia-dortmund-champions-league-quarter-final-live|title=Monaco 3-1 Dortmund|date=19 April 2017|work=The Guardian}}</ref> Falcao ended the season claiming the Ligue 1 title and as the club's top scorer with 30 goals in 43 appearances. <ref>http://www.squawka.com/news/how-monaco-goal-machine-radamel-falcao-has-evolved-since-man-utd-and-chelsea-spells-analysis/994201#qwWhTh07CruVYuUJ.97</ref>
====2017–18 season==== Falcao started off the season with a goal in Monaco's first league match, Monaco's second in a 3–2 win at home to [[Toulouse FC|Toulouse]]. Two weeks later, he scored the first hat-trick of the Ligue 1 season against [[Dijon FCO|Dijon]].<ref>http://www.espnfc.com/video/highlights/114/video/3179010/watch-radamel-falcaos-hat-trick</ref> He then scored a double – including a penalty – against Marseille, raising his tally to seven goals in four matches.<ref>http://www.espnfc.com/french-ligue-1/story/3190542/falcao-scores-brace-mbappe-sits-as-monaco-pound-marseille</ref> Falcao's form led him to being nominated for [[Ballon d'Or 2017|Ballon D'Or 2017]]. <ref>https://www.standard.co.uk/sport/football/ballon-dor-nominees-in-full-harry-kane-joins-lionel-messi-and-cristiano-ronaldo-in-30man-shortlist-a3654071.html</ref>
==International career== {{see also|List of international goals scored by Radamel Falcao}}
===Youth career=== Falcao played for the [[Colombia national under-17 football team|Colombia national under-17 team]] at the [[2001 South American Under-17 Football Championship]], where he played four matches<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.eltiempo.com/archivo/documento/MAM-599410 | title=Un castigo demasiado alto | publisher=El Tiempo | date=4 March 2001 | accessdate=19 March 2016 |language=Spanish}}</ref><ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.colombia.com/futbol/noticias/DetalleNoticia4247.asp | title=Selección Colombia goleó 4-1 a una extenuada Bolivia | publisher=Colombia.com | date=8 March 2001 | accessdate=19 March 2016 |language=Spanish}}</ref><ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.eltiempo.com/archivo/documento/MAM-594433 | title=Triunfo con lo justo | publisher=El Tiempo | date=10 March 2001 | accessdate=19 March 2016 |language=Spanish}}</ref><ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.colombia.com/futbol/noticias/DetalleNoticia4307.asp | title=Eliminada la selección sub 17 en Arequipa Perú | publisher=Colombia.com | date=11 March 2001 | accessdate=19 March 2016 |language=Spanish}}</ref> and scored one goal against [[Bolivia national under-17 football team|Bolivia]].
Falcao's first calling to the [[Colombia national under-20 football team|under-20 team]] was for the friendly tournament [[Copa Simón Bolívar]] in Venezuela in 2003.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.colombia.com/futbol/noticias/DetalleNoticia17792.asp | title=La Sub-17 se concentra para torneo internacional en Venezuela | publisher=Colombia.com | date=7 January 2003 | accessdate=19 March 2016 |language=Spanish}}</ref><ref>{{cite web | url=http://wvw.nacion.com/ln_ee/2003/junio/27/udeportes-la3.html | title=Convocada selección Sub'17 para la Copa Simón Bolívar venezolana | publisher=Nación.com | date=27 June 2003 | accessdate=19 March 2016 |language=Spanish}}</ref> He played in the 2004 [[Toulon Tournament]], scoring his only goal at the tournament against [[Turkey national under-23 football team|Turkey]].<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.rsssf.com/tablest/toulon04.html | title=Tournoi Espoirs de Toulon 2004 | publisher=RSSSF | date=15 June 2005 | accessdate=19 March 2016 | author=Zea, Antonio }}</ref> In the [[2005 South American U-20 Championship]], where he was champion with his team, he played five matches<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.colombia.com/futbol/noticias/DetalleNoticia25114.asp | title=Colombia 5 - Bolivia 0: Café dulce para Rodallega | publisher=Colombia.com | date=13 January 2005 | accessdate=20 March 2016 |language=Spanish}}</ref><ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.colombia.com/futbol/noticias/DetalleNoticia25258.asp | title=Colombia 1 - Argentina 1: Se conformaron con el empate | publisher=Colombia.com | date=21 January 2005 | accessdate=20 March 2016 |language=Spanish}}</ref><ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.colombia.com/futbol/noticias/DetalleNoticia25468.asp | title=Colombia 1- Argentina 1: El Campeón se definirá en Manizales | publisher=Colombia.com | date=2 February 2005 | accessdate=20 March 2016 |language=Spanish}}</ref><ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.colombia.com/futbol/noticias/DetalleNoticia25324.asp | title=Colombia 4 - Chile 3: Goles, emociones y fútbol | publisher=Colombia.com | date=25 January 2005 | accessdate=20 March 2016 |language=Spanish}}</ref><ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.eltiempo.com/archivo/documento/MAM-1675399 | title=Llorar es cosa de hombres! | publisher=El Tiempo | date=7 February 2005 | accessdate=20 March 2016 | author=Viana Rojas, Jaime |language=Spanish}}</ref> and scored once, on 23 January in the 1–1 draw against [[Argentina national under-20 football team|Argentina]]. In the [[2005 FIFA World Youth Championship]], Falcao played three matches and scored twice, against [[Canada national under-20 football team|Canada]] and [[Syria national under-20 football team|Syria]].<ref>[https://www.fifa.com/fifa-tournaments/players-coaches/people=229444/#career Falcao's profile at FIFA.com]</ref>
===2011 Copa América=== After missing the [[2007 Copa América|2007 edition]] due to injuries, Falcao's first major international tournament was the [[2011 Copa América]] in Argentina. After failing to score against [[Costa Rica national football team|Costa Rica]] and [[Argentina national football team|the hosts]], he netted both goals in a 2–0 win against [[Bolivia national football team|Bolivia]], the second a penalty, causing Colombia to top their group.<ref>{{cite news|title=Colombia vence a Bolivia 2–0 y va a cuartos de final en Copa América|trans-title=Colombia defeat Bolivia 2–0 and advance into the Copa América quarter-finals|url=http://mexico.cnn.com/deportes/2011/07/10/colombia-vence-a-bolivia-2-0-y-va-a-cuartos-de-final-en-copa-america|accessdate=24 May 2015|agency=Reuters|publisher=CNN|date=10 July 2011|language=Spanish}}</ref> In the quarter-finals, Falcao missed a penalty kick against [[Peru national football team|Peru]], which would have won the game had it gone in, and the opponents were able to score two goals in extra time to eliminate his team.<ref>{{cite news|title=Perú venció 2–0 a Colombia y jugará las semifinales de la Copa América|trans-title=Peru win 2–0 against Colombia and will play in the semi-finals of the Copa América|url=http://www.rpp.com.pe/2011-07-16-peru-vencio-2-0-a-colombia-y-jugara-las-semifinales-de-la-copa-america-noticia_385405.html|accessdate=24 May 2015|publisher=RPP|date=18 July 2015|language=Spanish}}</ref>
===2014 World Cup=== [[File:Radamel Falcao.jpg|thumb|Falcao playing for [[Colombia national football team|Colombia]] in 2013]]
Falcao's first match in the [[2014 FIFA World Cup qualification (CONMEBOL)|2014 FIFA World Cup qualifiers]] started off with a goal against [[Bolivia national football team|Bolivia]] in the last minute of added time, giving Colombia the win. Under new management of the national team led by Argentine [[José Pékerman]], Falcao scored a goal against [[Mexico national football team|Mexico]] in a friendly that ended 2–0.
Falcao's talents were shown against [[Uruguay national football team|Uruguay]], scoring in the second minute to help Colombia win 4–0. In the same match, he assisted [[Juan Camilo Zúñiga]], sealing the 4–0 victory in the final minutes of stoppage time. Falcao scored again days later as well as providing an assist against [[Chile national football team|Chile]] to help give Colombia a 3–1 away win which put them second in the table, one point behind [[Argentina national football team|Argentina]]. On 12 October 2012, Falcao scored both goals in a 2–0 victory over [[Paraguay national football team|Paraguay]].
In Falcao's first game for 2013, he played in the qualifying match against Bolivia. Falcao scored in the final minutes of the game scoring the fourth goal.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.fifa.com/worldcup/preliminaries/news/newsid=2042862/index.html |title=Five-star Colombia go second |publisher=FIFA.com |date=22 March 2013 |accessdate=13 May 2013}}</ref> Falcao scored a penalty against Peru in the 13th minute where Colombia won 2–0.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.fifa.com/worldcup/preliminaries/news/newsid=2106183/index.html |title=Argentina held by Ecuador, Colombia win |publisher=FIFA.com |date=11 June 2013 |accessdate=15 November 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.fifa.com/worldcup/preliminaries/news/newsid=2106440/index.html |title=Uruguay rebound, Colombia on the verge |publisher=FIFA.com |date=12 June 2013 |accessdate=15 November 2013}}</ref>
On 11 October 2013, in the penultimate World Cup qualifying match against [[Chile national football team|Chile]], Falcao scored twice from [[Penalty kick (association football)|penalty kick]]s to tie 3–3 after trailing 0–3. This result ensured Colombia qualified for the World Cup for the first time since [[1998 FIFA World Cup|1998]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.eltiempo.com/deportes/futbol/ARTICULO-WEB-NEW_NOTA_INTERIOR-12990546.html |title=Colombia se prueba sin Falcao, en amistoso contra Serbia – Noticias de Fútbol Internacional |publisher=Eltiempo.Com |date=13 August 2013 |accessdate=15 November 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.fifa.com/worldcup/preliminaries/news/newsid=2194779/index.html?intcmp=newsreader_news_box_3 |title=Colombia progress with thrilling fightback |publisher=FIFA.com |date=12 October 2013 |accessdate=15 November 2013}}</ref>
Falcao ended the [[2014 FIFA World Cup qualification]] campaign as Colombia's [[2014 FIFA World Cup qualification (CONMEBOL)#Goalscorers|top scorer]] with nine goals.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.fifa.com/worldcup/preliminaries/southamerica/statistics/topscorers.html|title=Top scorers|accessdate=16 October 2013|work=FIFA}}</ref>
{{Quote box |width=30% |align=left |quote="When they told me at first that I had a serious injury and there was only a small chance of participating (in Brazil), I didn’t care whether it was 10, 20 or 50 percent; I was counting on THAT chance. This is my hope and with this dream, I will work every day. A lot has to do with my emotional state. This is something that I can manage each day."|source=<small>Falcao on his injury and a possible chance to make it to the [[2014 FIFA World Cup]].<ref>{{cite web|last=Coerts |first=Stefan |url=http://espnfc.com/news/story/_/id/1695186/radamel-falcao-optimistic-world-cup-chances-acl-surgery?cc=5901 |title=Falcao and his injury before the 2014 world cup – ESPN FC |publisher=ESPN FC.com |date=18 May 2013 |accessdate=24 May 2013}}</ref></small>}}
On 23 January 2014, due to a severe ACL injury, it was announced that Falcao would likely miss the World Cup. However, Falcao expressed his optimism, believing that it was possible to make a speedy recovery.<ref name="chilevision.cl"/><ref name="abola.pt"/> Falcao received tremendous support worldwide in social media for a speedy recovery; a social media movement entitled 'Fuerza Tigre' (meaning 'stay strong Tiger' in Spanish) rapidly grew popularity.
On 5 February, Falcao was included in José Pékerman's 30-man squad list (later to be narrowed to 23 in May) for the World Cup.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://hereisthecity.com/en-gb/2014/02/05/tmb-colombia-striker-falcao-could-be-set-for-world-cup-after-all/ |title=Colombia striker Falcao could be set for World Cup after all – HITC Sport |publisher=Hereisthecity.com |date=23 January 2014 |accessdate=14 June 2014}}</ref> On 25 May, Falcao arrived in Argentina to train with the rest of the squad.<ref>{{cite web|last=Drayton |first=John |url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/worldcup2014/article-2639746/Radamel-Falcao-trains-Colombia-squad-ahead-2014-World-Cup.html |title=Radamel Falcao trains with Colombia squad ahead of 2014 World Cup | Mail Online |publisher=Dailymail.co.uk |date=26 May 2014 |accessdate=14 June 2014}}</ref> However, he eventually made the decision not to join the squad as he did not feel right taking up a position if not at full health.<ref>{{cite web|author=Featured Columnist |url=http://bleacherreport.com/articles/2083816-radamel-falcao-reportedly-left-off-colombias-world-cup-roster |title=Radamel Falcao Left off Colombia's World Cup Roster |publisher=Bleacher Report |date=2 June 2014 |accessdate=14 June 2014}}</ref>
===2015 Copa América=== Falcao would score his first international goal in 11 months after starting for the first time since his injury against [[El Salvador national football team|El Salvador]] on 10 October 2014. It was his first ever headed goal for his country while influencing the other two goals in a 3–0 victory.<ref>Richards, Alex. (11 October 2014) [http://www.mirror.co.uk/sport/football/news/manchester-uniteds-radamel-falcao-nets-4419139 Manchester United's Radamel Falcao nets first Colombia goal in 11 months in win over El Salvador – Mirror Online]. Mirror.co.uk. Retrieved on 8 November 2015.</ref> In a friendly against [[Bahrain national football team|Bahrain]] on 26 March 2015, Falcao assisted one goal and scored a double in a 6–0 win, making him one goal shy of [[Arnoldo Iguarán]]'s record as Colombia's top scorer.<ref>[http://www.manutd.com/en/News-And-Features/Football-News/2015/Mar/radamel-falcao-captains-colombia-against-bahrain.aspx Skipper Falcao stars for Colombia against Bahrain – Official Manchester United Website]. Manutd.com (26 March 2015). Retrieved on 8 November 2015.</ref> Four days later, he drew level on 24 goals with Iguarán with a penalty in a 3–1 win over [[Kuwait national football team|Kuwait]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Radamel Falcao: Manchester United striker equals goal record|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/32125464|accessdate=30 March 2015|work=BBC Sport|date=30 March 2015}}</ref>
On 6 June, he broke the record as Colombia's top scorer by scoring the only goal to defeat [[Costa Rica national football team|Costa Rica]] in a friendly in [[Buenos Aires]] ahead of the [[2015 Copa América]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Falcao, máximo goleador de la selección colombiana|trans-title=Falcao, highest goalscorer in the Colombian national team|url=http://www.marca.com/2015/06/07/futbol/copa-america/1433699163.html|accessdate=8 June 2015|work=Marca|date=7 June 2015|language=Spanish}}</ref> He captained the team at the tournament<ref>{{cite news|url=http://colombiareports.com/falcao-named-team-captain-over-james-despite-shoddy-season/|title=Falcao named team captain over James despite shoddy season|date=2 June 2015|work=Colombia Reports}}</ref> but failed to score in three group matches and he came on as a substitute for [[Jackson Martínez]] in the 74th minutes of the [[2015 Copa América knockout stage|quarter-final]] against [[Argentina national football team|Argentina]] on 26 June; Colombia lost the match in a penalty shootout.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://sports.yahoo.com/news/colombia-captain-falcao-dropped-argentina-clash-235122942--sow.html|title=Colombia captain Falcao dropped for Argentina clash|date=26 June 2015|work=Yahoo}}</ref>
===2018 World Cup=== On 4 November 2016, Falcao was recalled to the Colombia squad for the first time in 388 days for Colombia's next two [[2018 FIFA World Cup qualification (CONMEBOL)|2018 FIFA World Cup qualifying matches]] against Chile on 10 November and Argentina on 15 November. He had last played for Colombia on 13 October 2015, in a 3–0 loss to Uruguay in a [[2018 FIFA World Cup qualifying]] match in [[Montevideo]], and had not been selected in Colombia's squad for the [[Copa América Centenario]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.goal.com/en-gb/news/3526/world-cup-2018/2016/11/05/29206332/falcao-thrilled-with-special-colombia-recall|title=Falcao thrilled with 'special' Colombia recall|publisher=www.goal.com|date=5 November 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.supersport.com/football/south-america/news/161105/Falcao_gets_Colombia_recall|title=Falcao gets Colombia recall|publisher=www.supersport.com|date=5 November 2016}}</ref>
On 7 June 2017, Falcao became the Colombian national team's all-time top-goalscorer, scoring his 26th goal in a 2–2 draw with [[Spain national football team|Spain]].<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.fourfourtwo.com/news/falcao-becomes-colombias-all-time-top-goalscorer|title=Falcao becomes Colombia's all-time top goalscorer|date=7 June 2017|work=FourFourTwo}}</ref> He went on to score twice in the team's four remaining World Cup qualifying matches, as Colombia confirmed their qualification for the [[2018 FIFA World Cup]] on 10 October 2017.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.fifa.com/worldcup/news/y=2017/m=10/news=una-noche-magica-para-uruguay-argentina-y-colombia-2913140-2913296.html|title=Night to remember for Uruguay, Argentina and Colombia|date=11 October 2017|work=FIFA}}</ref>
==Style of play== Falcao has been described as a "natural goal scorer" and a striker with the "ability to bag a goal from nothing".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.topoulakitsiou.eu/2012/05/radamel-falcao-garcia-zarate.html |title=Radamel Falcao García Zárate | topoulakitsiou |publisher=Topoulakitsiou.eu |date=10 February 1986 |accessdate=2 January 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.totalfootballmag.com/features/world-football/the-worlds-current-top-5-strikers |publisher=totalfootballmag.com |title=The world’s top 5 strikers |accessdate=24 January 2013}}</ref><ref name="fifa.com">{{cite web|url=https://www.fifa.com/ballondor/news/newsid=1804906/ |title=Falcao: Several players deserve the Ballon d’Or |publisher=FIFA |date=30 October 2012 |accessdate=2 January 2013}}</ref> His abilities to adapt to most positions and scoring goals with various parts of his body has resulted in goals. Described as a "poacher", Falcao is often labeled as a "pure striker", often playing as a traditional "number 9" and capitalizing on less amount of chances that are given to him than the typical goal scorer. His footing and curves are highly noticeable through his games regardless of distance and/or positions. Falcao is well known for having a strong weak foot (left) that is on equals with his right foot (preference), allowing him to be flexible with goal scoring. Falcao controls a well-balanced pace, helping him keep his stamina in check and allowing him to often outrun other players in the most critical battling-for-the-ball moments. The strength of his shots is often well controlled, in terms of distance and angles, as shown throughout his career.<ref name="fifa.com"/><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.soccernews.com/simeone-falcao-is-the-best/105724/ |title=Simeone: Falcao is the best |publisher=Soccer News |date=27 October 2012 |accessdate=2 January 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last=Dotinga |first=Renger |url=http://sg.sports.yahoo.com/news/falcao-urges-focus-world-cup-qualifiers-095400926--spt.html |title=Falcao urges focus in World Cup qualifiers – Yahoo! Sports Singapore |publisher=Yahoo! |date=13 October 2012 |accessdate=2 January 2013}}</ref> While Falcao is only of average height, his header technique has given him an edge in aerial battles for balls. His most impressive goals tend to be headers, with the majority of his goals coming from the air.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://worldsoccer.about.com/od/players/p/Radamel-Falcao.htm |title=Radamel Falcao – Profile of Atletico Madrid Soccer Player Radamel Falcao |publisher=Worldsoccer.about.com |date=10 February 1986 |accessdate=2 January 2013}}</ref>
Falcao's talents have been recognized by former and current football players. Former [[FC Barcelona|Barcelona]] and current Manchester City manager [[Pep Guardiola]] described him as "sensational" and as one of the most talented in the world.<ref>{{cite web|last=Mott |first=Alex |url=https://sports.yahoo.com/news/people-were-criticizing-falcao-january-181900210--sow.html |title=People were criticizing Falcao in January, says Atletico chief – Yahoo Sports |publisher=Sports.yahoo.com |date=4 September 2012 |accessdate=15 November 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.colombia.com/futbol/colombianos-en-el-exterior/sdi26/13392/manager-de-falcao-es-el-mismo-de-cristiano-ronaldo-y-jose-mourinho |title=Manager de Falcao es el mismo de Cristiano Ronaldo y José Mourinho – Colombianos en el Exterior – Fútbol |publisher=Colombia.com |date= |accessdate=15 November 2013 }}</ref><ref>[http://feeds.univision.com/feeds/article/2012-02-25/guardiola-falcao-es-el-mejor Guardiola: Falcao es "el mejor jugador de área" del mundo – Univision Feeds]. Feeds.univision.com (25 February 2012). Retrieved 10 May 2012.</ref> [[Fabio Capello]] has considered him to be on the same level as [[Lionel Messi]] and Cristiano Ronaldo. Former Atlético Madrid teammate [[Gabi (footballer)|Gabi]] said in 2012 that he thought Falcao was the best header in the world.<ref name=autogenerated3>{{cite web |url=https://www.fifa.com/worldfootball/clubfootball/news/newsid=1713487.html |title=Cerezo would not swap Falcao |publisher=FIFA |date=2 October 2012 |accessdate=2 January 2013 }}</ref><ref name="autogeneratedcc">{{cite web|url=http://soccernet.espn.go.com/news/story/_/id/1158248/'radamel-falcao-as-impressive-as-lionel-messi,'-says-fabio-capello?cc=5901 |title='Radamel Falcao as impressive as Lionel Messi,' says Fabio Capello – ESPN FC |publisher=ESPN FC |date=13 September 2012 |accessdate=2 January 2013}}</ref><ref name="autogenerated2">{{cite web|url=http://soccernet.espn.go.com/news/story/_/id/1155047/atletico-madrid's-gabi-hails-falcao-as-world's-best-no.-9?cc=5901 |title=Atletico Madrid's Gabi hails Falcao as world's best No. 9 – ESPN FC |publisher=ESPN FC |date=10 September 2012 |accessdate=2 January 2013}}</ref><ref name="sport1">{{cite web|url=http://www.sport.co.uk/news/Football/81523/Top_10_Strikers_in_the_world_2012_5_-_Radamel_Falcao.aspx |title=Top 10 Strikers in the world 2012: 5 – Radamel Falcao 14 Sep 2012 09:59:46 |publisher=Sport.co.uk |date=14 September 2012 |accessdate=2 January 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://colombiareports.com/colombia-news/sports/24443-fc-barcelona-interested-in-falcao.html |title=FC Barcelona 'interested in Falcao' – Colombia news |publisher=Colombia Reports |date=6 June 2012 |accessdate=2 January 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.marca.com/2012/05/01/futbol/equipos/atletico/1335862111.html |title=Falcao es el mejor fichaje del siglo XXI – |work=Marca (newspaper) |date=2 May 2012 |accessdate=2 January 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://colombiareports.com/colombia-news/sports/23807-falcao-best-soccer-signing-of-21st-century-spanish-press.html |title='Falcao Spain's best soccer signing of 21st century' – Colombia news |publisher=Colombia Reports |date=1 May 2012 |accessdate=2 January 2013}}</ref>
==Personal life== [[File:Radamel Falcao García Signature.svg|thumb|Falcao's signature]] Falcao is a second generation footballer, with his father Radamel García having played professionally as a defender in Colombia and Venezuela, moving to the latter country when Falcao was five. At first, he was picked on in Venezuela for not being good at the country's most popular sport, [[baseball]].<ref name=worswick/>
His name derives from the 1980s [[Brazil national football team|Brazil national team]], [[Sport Club Internacional|Internacional]] and [[A.S. Roma|Roma]] legend [[Paulo Roberto Falcão]], as a tribute from his father Radamel García. Despite being named Radamel, he prefers to use his middle name in interviews. Falcao is married to Argentinean singer Lorelei Taron. In early 2013, it was revealed that Falcao was expecting his first child with her.<ref>{{cite web|last=Hashim |first=Ash |url=http://sg.sports.yahoo.com/blogs/futbolita/atletico-madrid-falcao-liverpool-pepe-reina-embrace-fatherhood-044619487.html |title=Atletico Madrid’s Falcao and Liverpool’s Pepe Reina embrace fatherhood |publisher=Yahoo! Sports Singapore |date=4 April 2013 |accessdate=13 May 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.marca.com/2013/03/23/en/football/international_football/1364079356.html |title=Falcao to become a father |publisher=MARCA.com |date=23 March 2013 |accessdate=13 May 2013}}</ref> Dominique García Taron was born on 13 August 2013, at the [[The Princess Grace Hospital Centre|Princess Grace Hospital]] in [[La Colle, Monaco|La Colle]], [[Monaco]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ntn24.com/noticias/falcao-confirma-traves-de-instagram-el-nacimiento-de-su-hija-dominique-garcia-102520 |title=Falcao celebra el nacimiento de su hija Dominique García con foto en Instagram |publisher=NTN24 |date= |accessdate=15 November 2013 }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://trome.pe/deportes/1616985/noticia-radamel-falcao-ya-papa |title=¡Radamel Falcao ya es papá!, Noticias Perú | Trome |publisher=Trome.pe |date= |accessdate=15 November 2013 }}</ref> His second daughter, Desirée García Taron, was born in February 2015.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://instagram.com/p/zS9e2wp-7G/?modal=true |title=@falcao on instagram : Mi princesa Desirée... }}</ref> Falcao is a [[Christianity|Christian]].<ref>{{cite news|title=For Mata and Falcao, a Fresh Start and an Early Finish|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2014/01/27/sports/soccer/for-mata-and-falcao-a-fresh-start-and-an-early-finish.html?_r=0}}</ref>
He is partially of [[English people|English]] descent; George King, one of his great-grandfathers, emigrated from the [[North Yorkshire]] village of [[Burn, North Yorkshire|Burn]] near [[Selby]] in 1932 to work as an accountant for the [[United Fruit Company]] in Colombia. Owing to this ancestry, Falcao's father attempted to make it easier for his son to play in Europe by obtaining a [[British passport]] for him, however this was rejected.<ref name=worswick>{{cite news|last1=Worswick|first1=Carl|title=Radamel Falcao has Yorkshire roots... his great-grandfather was an accountant from Selby, says Manchester United star's dad as he reveals striker's tough childhood|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-2794356/radamel-falcao-s-blood-makes-proud-yorkshire-roots-man-united-dream-come-true-says-dad.html|accessdate=1 November 2014|work=[[Daily Mail]]|date=15 October 2014}}</ref>

===International=== {{updated|23 March 2018}}.<ref>{{NFT player|id=20705|name=García, Radamel Falcao|accessdate=5 June 2012}}</ref>

{{reflist|group=fn}}
==Honours==
===Club=== ;River Plate<ref name="SW"/> * [[Argentine Primera División]]: [[2007–08 Argentine Primera División|2007–08 Clausura]]
;Porto<ref name="SW"/> * [[Primeira Liga]]: [[2010–11 Primeira Liga|2010–11]] * [[Taça de Portugal]]: [[2009–10 Taça de Portugal|2009–10]], [[2010–11 Taça de Portugal|2010–11]] * [[Supertaça Cândido de Oliveira]]: [[2010 Supertaça Cândido de Oliveira|2010]], [[2011 Supertaça Cândido de Oliveira|2011]] * [[UEFA Europa League]]: [[2010–11 UEFA Europa League|2010–11]]
;Atlético Madrid<ref name="SW"/> * [[Copa del Rey]]: [[2012–13 Copa del Rey|2012–13]] * [[UEFA Europa League]]: [[2011–12 UEFA Europa League|2011–12]] * [[UEFA Super Cup]]: [[2012 UEFA Super Cup|2012]]
;Monaco *[[Ligue 1]]: [[2016–17 Ligue 1|2016–17]]
===International=== ;Colombia * [[South American Youth Championship]]: [[2005 South American U-20 Championship|2005]]<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.fifa.com/u20worldcup/news/y=2005/m=5/news=opportunity-knocks-again-for-radamel-falcao-97614.html|title=Opportunity knocks again for Radamel Falcao|date=16 May 2005|accessdate=6 February 2016}}</ref>
===Individual=== * South American Team of the Year: 2007<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.rsssf.com/miscellaneous/sam-toy.html |title=South American Team of the Year |date=16 January 2009 |accessdate=10 March 2015 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150121064015/http://www.rsssf.com/miscellaneous/sam-toy.html |archivedate=21 January 2015 |df= }}</ref> * [[Portuguese Golden Ball]]: [[2010–11 Primeira Liga|2010–11]]<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.atleticofans.com/11854/falcao-awarded-the-portuguese-golden-ball/|title=Falcao awarded the Portuguese Golden Ball|date=7 February 2012|publisher=AtléticoFans|accessdate=8 February 2016}}</ref> * [[UEFA Europa League]] [[List of UEFA Cup and Europa League top scorers|Top Scorer]]: [[2010–11 UEFA Europa League|2010–11]] (17 goals),<ref name="10-11record"/> [[2011–12 UEFA Europa League|2011–12]] (12 goals)<ref name="autogenerated1"/> * [[List of UEFA Cup and Europa League finals|UEFA Europa League Final]] Man of the Match (2): [[2011 UEFA Europa League Final|2011]], [[2012 UEFA Europa League Final|2012]]<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.zimbio.com/pictures/M8ERD0A43iI/Atletico+Madrid+v+Athletic+Bilbao+UEFA+Europa/dOz6OlX8gKm/Falcao |title=Atletico Madrid v Athletic Bilbao – UEFA Europa League Final |work=Zimbio |date=8 May 2012 |accessdate=12 September 2014}}</ref> * [[UEFA Super Cup]] Man of the Match: [[2012 UEFA Super Cup|2012]]<ref name="Supercup"/> * [[FIFPro#FIFA FIFPro World XI|FIFA FIFPro World XI]]: [[2012 FIFA Ballon d'Or#FIFA/FIFPro World XI|2012]]<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.fifpro.org/fifpro_world/award_history/2012|title=FIFA FIFPRO WORLD XI 2012}}</ref> * [[FIFPro#FIFA FIFPro World XI|FIFA FIFPro World XI]] 2nd team: 2013<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/news-and-comment/fifpro-announces-reserve-teams-of-the-year-but-luis-suarez-and-arjen-robben-wont-be-laughing-while-9062047.html#gallery |title=FifPro announces reserve Teams of the Year - but Luis Suarez and Arjen Robben won't be laughing while Iker Casillas is somehow named the second best goalkeeper of 2013 |publisher=Independent.co.uk |date=15 January 2014 |access-date=1 October 2017}}</ref> * [[Globe Soccer Awards|Globe Best Footballer]]: 2012<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.globesoccer.com/awards/awards-2012/ |title=GLOBE SOCCER AWARDS 2012 |publisher=Globe Soccer |accessdate=22 March 2016}}</ref> * [[UNFP Player of the Month]]: August 2017<ref name=POTM>{{cite web|url=http://www.unfp.org/2017/09/radamel-falcao-et-zinedine-ferhat-joueurs-du-mois-daout/|title=Radamel Falcao et Zinedine Ferhat, joueurs du mois d'Août !|website=UNFP|date=19 September 2017|accessdate=19 September 2017}}</ref>
====Records==== * [[Colombia national football team|Colombia]] all-time top scorer: 28 goals<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.rsssf.com/miscellaneous/col-recintlp.html |title=Colombia - Record International Players |author=Frank Ballesteros |publisher=RSSSF |accessdate=4 November 2015 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20081230210624/http://www.rsssf.com/miscellaneous/col-recintlp.html |archivedate=30 December 2008 |df= }}</ref> * Highest goal record in the [[UEFA Europa League]] single tournament (17 goals)<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.uefa.com/uefaeuropaleague/news/newsid=1630637.html|title=Seventeen-goal Falcao signs off with record|date=18 May 2011|accessdate=8 February 2016}}</ref> * Only player to win two consecutive [[UEFA Europa League]] titles with two different teams.<ref name="autogenerated1"/> * Top goal scorer of the [[UEFA Super Cup]]: 3 goals {{small|(shared with [[Arie Haan]], [[Oleg Blokhin]], [[Gerd Müller]], [[Rob Rensenbrink]], [[François Van der Elst]], [[Terry McDermott]], and [[Lionel Messi]])}}<ref>{{cite web |first=Paul |last=Saffer |title=Messi, Alves among Super Cup Record-Breakers |publisher=UEFA |date=11 August 2015}}</ref>

revision.comment: Notification of altered sources needing review #IABot (v1.6.1) ([[User:Balon Greyjoy|Balon Greyjoy]])
revision.text: {{WikiProjectBannerShell|1= {{WikiProject Biography|living=no|class=Start|musician-work-group=yes|musician-priority=|listas=Hazarika, Bhupen}} {{WikiProject India|class=start|importance=mid|assam=yes|assam-importance=high|music=yes|music-importance=high|assess-date=July 2012|image-needed=yes}} {{WikiProject Assam}} }}{{Controversial-issues}} ==File:Bhupen Hazarika Signature.png Nominated for Deletion== {| |- | [[File:Image-x-generic.svg|100px]] | An image used in this article, [[commons:File:Bhupen Hazarika Signature.png|File:Bhupen Hazarika Signature.png]], has been nominated for deletion at [[Wikimedia Commons]] in the following category: ''Deletion requests November 2011'' ;What should I do? ''Don't panic''; a discussion will now take place over on Commons about whether to remove the file. This gives you an opportunity to contest the deletion, although please review Commons guidelines before doing so. * If the image is [[WP:NFCC|non-free]] then you may need to upload it to Wikipedia (Commons does not allow fair use) * If the image isn't freely licensed and there is no [[WP:FUR|fair use rationale]] then it cannot be uploaded or used. ''This notification is provided by a Bot'' --[[User:CommonsNotificationBot|CommonsNotificationBot]] ([[User talk:CommonsNotificationBot|talk]]) 09:36, 10 November 2011 (UTC) |} == Edit Lock == '''Ref: The following message.''' ========================================= {| style="background-color: #fdffe7; border: 1px solid #fceb92;" |rowspan="2" style="vertical-align: middle; padding: 5px;" | [[File:Trophy.png|100px]] |style="font-size: x-large; padding: 3px 3px 0 3px; height: 1.5em;" | '''Contribution''' |- |style="vertical-align: middle; padding: 3px;" | Thanks for your contributions to Dr. Hazarikas's article. I'd like to mention that it's been attacked by vandalism practices. Please help me, making the article good enough or it will get "Locked" with any proper information. Thanks. Regards [[User:Wrix24x7|Wrix24x7]] ([[User talk:Wrix24x7|talk]]) 14:48, 11 November 2011 (UTC) |} :Regasrds. I didn't quite understand clearly, will you please specifically mention the part of my editing which you disapprove? However checking history, I found you mafe the following change. Is the '''bold part'' there you disapprove? Please confirm. If it is so, then it needs discussion.Thank you. Waiting for your reply- ''''Prabhakar Sarma Neog'''' 15:41, 11 November 2011 (UTC) (cur | prev) 14:42, 11 November 2011‎ Wrix24x7 (talk | contribs)‎ m (14,803 bytes) '''(Repeated vandalism. added "Indian" as he's was a citizen of India. Removed Kalapana Lajmi as wife wife. She's 28 years younger almost as young as his son Tej Hazarika. and was a director of movies where Dr. Hazarika gave music direction etc.) (undo)''' (cur | prev) 12:43, 11 November 2011‎ Ged UK (talk | contribs)‎ (14,877 bytes) () (undo) (cur | prev) 12:43, 11 November 2011‎ Ged UK (talk | contribs)‎ m (14,845 bytes) (Protected Bhupen Hazarika: excessive, repeated copyvios, and vandalism, fancruft etc ([edit=autoconfirmed] (expires 12:43, 21 November 2011 (UTC)) [move=autoconfirmed] (expires 12:43, 21 November 2011 (UTC)))) (undo) (cur | prev) 10:33, 11 November 2011‎ Psneog (talk | contribs)‎ (14,845 bytes) (undo) ============Re: My dis approvals========== Hello, [[User:Psneog|Sir]], I just wanted to clear some points here, Dr. Hazarika basically born in Sadiya, Assam, British Inida. Since, currently Assam is a part of Republic of India technically Dr. Hazarika is an Indian rather than an Assamese. Assamese is a culture/language rather than a nationality. That I wanna make clear. Someone is editing it very often I'm unable to get who as many are actually not loged in. This actually creating a confusion on the word '''Assamese''' and also Dr. Hazarika's nationality for foreigners, it's okay for the Assamese people but many fan of him from other parts of India will also object. Secondly, respected Kalpana Lajmi is not his wife in any sense. She also told NewLive that it's yellow journalism. She was his manager, friend and directed movies where his gave voice of music direction etc. I don't know from where this is also coming but we need to stop this. Finally, the formatting and punctuation is poor on many edits. It's hard to find who's doing what in a Wiki but we active users must take it on our hands as a responsibility to improve this article. Regards, [[User:Wrix24x7|Wrix]] —Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|undated]] comment added 18:08, 11 November 2011 (UTC). : * Regarding Kalpana Lajmi, you are right. I misinterpreted the "spouse" word and confused it with the "partner" parameter. (Lajmi was his live in partner, they have openly stated it in many press appearances. There is multiple stories from independent sources. Probably you have overlooked the ref.s 12, 13, 14, from different sources: : * ^ http://ibnlive.in.com/blogs/rituparnachatterjee/2802/62880/kalpana-lajmibhupen-hazarika-a-40yearold-love-story.html : * ^ http://www.deccanchronicle.com/channels/nation/northeast/hazarika-funeral-put-fans-keep-pouring-063 : * ^ http://movies.ndtv.com/movie_story.aspx?Section=Movies&ID=ENTEN20110187485&subcatg=MOVIESINDIA&keyword=music&nid=147290 Sri Neog,Reference from news channels and are never credible so are the blogs.I dont think they are of much importance.Moreover I dont think the name "Kalpana Lazmi" be mentioned under the vital statistics of Dr. Bhupen Hazarika without approval from his wife or son. This page was created only after the demise of the legend. You could have done that when he was still alive and talking. --D.Borah — Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[User:D.Borah|D.Borah]] ([[User talk:D.Borah|talk]] • [[Special:Contributions/D.Borah|contribs]]) 10:12, 21 November 2011 (UTC) : It should have been spouse: Priyambada (1950-1963) and partner: Kalpana.So maybe we should have corrected it accordingly, instead of removing it altogether? : Regarding Priyambada Patel, his ex wife, what was the problem? Was it necessary to remove? If there were no ref.s, we could've done it with a {{citation needed}}? : Are you sure that India at that time called "Indian Empire?" I've came across "British India" but never heard "Indian Emoire", so please clear my doubt. : Images: Was it necessary to remove them? If so why? What about the signature image? Please check. :'''Here is what I'd like you to consider: # Revert the page to [http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Bhupen_Hazarika&oldid=460164299 this revision] # Then make the following changes: ## Spouse = {{marriage|Priyambada Patel|1950|1963}} and partner = [[Kalpana Lajmi]]. I'll provide references. ## Change "Indian Empire" to "British India", or "Pre Independence India. # Then we stop modifying the article page, discuss on this page and put information on the article page only after we all agree. # '''Until we all agree on the above, we should refrain from editing from now on, and keep it as it is right now.''' Thanks [[User:Psneog|''''Prabhakar Sarma Neog'''']] ([[User talk:Psneog|talk]]) 23:40, 11 November 2011 (UTC) : * I'd like to clear up myself and the topic itself. Dr. Hazarika's wife respected Priyambada Patel, never got divorced moreover, she's staying in Canada and that's their family matter but in a interview to Newlive aired on 11th Nov, Kalpana Lajmi said "Priyam Bo came to see him", she also said that she's 84 and her health is also not good from last 5 years thus, she stopped coming. Thus, Dr. Hazarika's relationship with his wife can be said "separated" in my point-of-view rather than, "Ex-wife" or something. Kalpana Lajmi also said that, Dr. Hazarika was so much involved into his music that he wasn't able to give time to his wife and son, so both the parties lived parallel lives but emotional bond between them was there. So, regarding his '''spouse''' field I'd suggest '''separated''' or nothing. Kalpana Lajimi deserves to be called '''partner''' or '''manager'''. Pre-Independent India, was called '''British India''' or '''British Raj''' (in Indian form of English, mixed language). So, I'd also suggest this to be changed. '''Wrix''' :Thanks for your input, '''Wrix'''. :So let me go ahead. For now lets go ahead, I'll try to present the spouce/separated part carefully. There is a {{married}} template, we can use that. I'll also put a {{citation needed}} tag. In the mean time, lets try to get some reliable reference material. In fact being in Guwahati, it'd be much easier for you. So, let's not fight, lets write. However, right now we need to gather information and present it ASAP (of course, we need to be correct, so we'll follow Wikipedia policy documents (please see your talk page for these documents.) [[User:Psneog|''''Prabhakar Sarma Neog'''']] ([[User talk:Psneog|talk]]) 10:59, 12 November 2011 (UTC) ==Unconstructive edits== #I removed the infobox from this talk page - this is not the place for test edits. #Wikipedia is [[WP:NOTMEMORIAL|not a memorial site]], but the edits since his death are largely POV; examples: "the trio who had a tremendous impact on his professional life" is unencyclopedic per [[WP:WTA]], "whose lessons on humanity and universalism were to last Bhupen Hazarika's entire life" is original research and editorializing, "the doyens of Assamese culture" is merely promotional, and so on : If they trio did have a tremendous impact on his professional life, how else would you word it? Bhupen Hazarika has frequently talked about the influence. What is probably lacking is a reference, which will ultimately come by. : "doyens" is word found in most reputed dictionary and used widely in India. So is Indian English colloquial for an Indian? : [[User:Chaipau|Chaipau]] ([[User talk:Chaipau|talk]]) 21:18, 12 November 2011 (UTC) #"Dr." is not part of a person's name but a title. #[[:File:Bhupen Hazarika.jpg]] is missing evidence of permission. #Section headings are not for one or two sentences. #"Personal biography" does not make any sense as a section title. : So what would you recommend? This section deals with Bhupen Hazarika's personal issues, separating it from his artistic life. #The article is now full of short and shoppy paragraphs - if you want to make a complete rewrite, use a sandbox. [[User:Hekerui|Hekerui]] ([[User talk:Hekerui|talk]]) 12:21, 12 November 2011 (UTC) : there is no other way to improve a collaborative article. == Overenthusiastic tags== I have removed over-enthusiastic tags by[[User:Hekerui|Hekerui]] . These tags should be properly and specifically justified. I had addressed the earlier concerns and made edit changes accordingly. The newer tags are not justified. The only justification new edits are in the form of an edit summary, which reads: '"infused with humanity and universalism" - POV not taken care of', and the original tags were reinstated. The particular phrase is a new one (so does not warrant a "not taken care of"), and it is general and broad characterization of the artist's theme of his entire opus (over a seventy-year period) that is made in the introductory part of the article. What it probably lacks is a citation and a general tag is unwarranted. Also, this article is a work in progress under [[Project:Assam]]. Constructive comments and specific guides are welcome, though broad tagging does not help. [[User:Chaipau|Chaipau]] ([[User talk:Chaipau|talk]]) 11:52, 14 November 2011 (UTC) :You must be joking. The lead is written like an laudatory obituary. "Known for writing strong lyrics with themes of communal amity, universal justice and empathy, his songs have become popular among all sections of ethnic and religious communities in Assam." - this is pure POV - the characterization is made by you. The overenthusiatic editing is your work and the maintenance templates should stay so the article may be fixed in the future. Also, why "broad tagging"? Maintenance templates only help if they are visible. [[User:Hekerui|Hekerui]] ([[User talk:Hekerui|talk]]) 09:19, 15 November 2011 (UTC) :: "...written like a laudatory obituary", is your personal point of view. As i mentioned, what is missing here is a citation. This is a summary of what will be justified in the "Legacy" section, duly referenced. But I don't want to get into an edit war with you and will let the tags stand for now, as I concentrate on adding more heft to the article. I repeat my earlier request---make specific observations about what you think are POV or problematic parts of the article at specific points and help the growth of this article. [[User:Chaipau|Chaipau]] ([[User talk:Chaipau|talk]]) 10:53, 15 November 2011 (UTC) == External links modified == Hello fellow Wikipedians, I have just added archive links to {{plural:1|one external link|1 external links}} on [[Bhupen Hazarika]]. Please take a moment to review [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?diff=prev&oldid=699898331 my edit]. If necessary, add {{tlx|cbignore}} after the link to keep me from modifying it. Alternatively, you can add {{tlx|nobots|deny{{=}}InternetArchiveBot}} to keep me off the page altogether. I made the following changes: *Added archive https://web.archive.org/20111112115459/http://www.deccanchronicle.com/channels/nation/northeast/hazarika-funeral-put-fans-keep-pouring-063 to http://www.deccanchronicle.com/channels/nation/northeast/hazarika-funeral-put-fans-keep-pouring-063 When you have finished reviewing my changes, please set the ''checked'' parameter below to '''true''' to let others know. {{sourcecheck|checked=false}} Cheers.—[[User:Cyberbot II|cyberbot II]][[User talk:Cyberbot II|Talk to my owner]]:Online 03:02, 15 January 2016 (UTC) == External links modified == Hello fellow Wikipedians, I have just modified {{plural:2|one external link|2 external links}} on [[Bhupen Hazarika]]. Please take a moment to review [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?diff=prev&oldid=747286938 my edit]. If you have any questions, or need the bot to ignore the links, or the page altogether, please visit [[User:Cyberpower678/FaQs#InternetArchiveBot|this simple FaQ]] for additional information. I made the following changes: *Added archive http://www.webcitation.org/6U68ulwpb?url=http%3A%2F%2Fmha.nic.in%2Fsites%2Fupload_files%2Fmha%2Ffiles%2FLST-PDAWD-2013.pdf to http://mha.nic.in/sites/upload_files/mha/files/LST-PDAWD-2013.pdf *Added archive https://web.archive.org/web/20130510095705/http://www.mha.nic.in/pdfs/LST-PDAWD.pdf to http://www.mha.nic.in/pdfs/LST-PDAWD.pdf When you have finished reviewing my changes, please set the ''checked'' parameter below to '''true''' or '''failed''' to let others know (documentation at {{tlx|Sourcecheck}}). {{sourcecheck|checked=false}} Cheers.—[[User:InternetArchiveBot|'''InternetArchiveBot''']] ([[User talk:InternetArchiveBot|Report bug]]) 14:49, 1 November 2016 (UTC) == External links modified == Hello fellow Wikipedians, I have just modified 2 external links on [[Bhupen Hazarika]]. Please take a moment to review [[special:diff/812896834|my edit]]. If you have any questions, or need the bot to ignore the links, or the page altogether, please visit [[User:Cyberpower678/FaQs#InternetArchiveBot|this simple FaQ]] for additional information. I made the following changes: *Added {{tlx|dead link}} tag to http://www.cathnewsindia.com/2011/11/07/church-condoles-hazarikas-death/ *Added archive https://web.archive.org/web/20121117031637/http://www.efi-news.com/2012/11/bhupen-hazarika-meghalaya.html to http://www.efi-news.com/2012/11/bhupen-hazarika-meghalaya.html *Added archive https://web.archive.org/web/20130910040522/http://drbhupenhazarika.org/Lyrics/ to http://drbhupenhazarika.org/Lyrics When you have finished reviewing my changes, you may follow the instructions on the template below to fix any issues with the URLs. {{sourcecheck|checked=false|needhelp=}} Cheers.—[[User:InternetArchiveBot|'''InternetArchiveBot''']] ([[User talk:InternetArchiveBot|Report bug]]) 14:51, 30 November 2017 (UTC)
